item.title: Fullstack Developer for Wikipedia at Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wikimedia Deutschland – Gesellschaft zur Förderung Freien Wissens e. V. is a non-profit organisation based in Berlin, Germany. With more than 80 employees and about 50.000 members, it is the oldest and largest of more than 40 independent chapters of the international Wikimedia movement. The most well-known Wikimedia project, the free online encyclopedia Wikipedia, is used by millions of people across the world every day and is continuously updated and improved by millions of users.


Wikimedia Deutschland furthers these ideals even beyond the free encyclopedia: It is our aim to establish and promote the creation, collection, and distribution of free knowledge in all parts of society. Our objective is to create a world in which the sum of all human knowledge is freely accessible for everyone. The main focus of our activities is the support of volunteers, the development of technology and software, public education, and cooperation with cultural and scientific institutions. We grant scholarships to volunteers working for Wikimedia projects and we provide technical support. On both the national and EU-level, we are advocating a legal framework which allows for free knowledge to become part of our everyday life.


We are looking for a Software Developer to join one of our agile development teams in our office at the heart of Berlin. You will either be working on the software behind the Wikidata project or on the software that powers our fundraising application and possible cross-department projects.


About you



  • You care about software; you have a passion which you can clearly convey by your actions rather than personal statements on your CV alone

  • You have an eye for software design and quality

  • You can recognize legacy code and know how to effectively deal with it

  • You are able to communicate fluently in English in a multidisciplinary team

  • For you it’s more than a job


We’re interested in candidates from any background, as long as you have a solid understanding of Object Oriented languages and basic experience with web development.


What we are offering you



  • We have internal presentations by our developers on topics they are enthusiastic about

  • You can attend local user groups during work time and you are encouraged to do so

  • You will have a noticeable impact on one of the top four visited websites in the world

  • We regularly go to conferences, both as attendees and participants


Our development teams are cross-functional, self-organizing and highly autonomous. No single team leaders or middle management. You’ll be working directly with the product owner. Among other things, testing, refactoring, and pair programming are encouraged. We’re constantly trying to improve the way we work.


All software we develop is Open Source, and we contribute back to various projects we use. Many of our components are published in a format that allows reuse outside of our own projects.


You can fill this position as permanent employee or as contractor.


Technologies we use


Most of our server side code is written in PHP. A lot of our projects have a HTML 5 & JavaScript frontend, which interact with server side backends via web APIs. We test our code with PHPUnit and QUnit, and with browser tests written in Ruby. Some of our code is written on top of the MediaWiki framework, some of it is entirely in-house and for newer projects we use libraries such as Symfony components and Doctrine.


An (incomplete) list of technologies we're currently using:



  • JavaScript, PHP, Ruby

  • MediaWiki, several MediaWiki extensions

  • PHPUnit, QUnit, Selenium, Cucumber, PHPCS, PHPMD, JSLint, Rubocop

  • Git

  • MySQL, SQLite

  • Composer

  • TravisCI, ScrutinizerCI, Jenkins

  • Wikimedia Labs infrastructure

  • Phabricator

  • Linux server, nginx

  • Puppet, Vagrant

item.title: Senior Python Engineer (Backend / Data Driven/ Zalon) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalon is the successful story of curating and delivering complete outfits for our customers. Part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent software engineering.

As part of our recruitment ramp-up for a designated Data Science & Research Engineering team, you, as a Python Backend Engineer will bring the engineering perspective into our products. Expect a role where you will have immediate impact as we iterate fast and experiment a lot, welcoming your innovative engineering ideas to the table. The teams work with full end-to-end responsibility on solving the challenges at hand - starting with ideating over prototyping and user testing to bringing features live and checking their performance.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • Python skills (deep understanding of language internals, profiling, best practices, eg. Pandas, Scikit-learn). Java or Scala experience (or an interest) would also be appreciated.



  • Solid understanding of data structures, coding standards, best practices, software design, architecture.

  • Interest in setting up monitoring, tracking and reporting, designing and implementing pipelines for training and deploying new models and a real curiosity around "how algorithms work".

  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS. Knowledge of microservice architecture and distributed systems is also advantageous.

  • At least 3 years of professional programming experience in a commercial environment, backed-up by a Masters or Bachelor Degree in a relevant subject or additional working experience.

  • English language fluency


YOUR ROLE



  • You will communicate with the data scientists (or machine learning experts or research engineers) and exchange ideas about solutions to the existent and potential problems. You will do this by identifying the right components and putting them together in the correct manner.

  • You will work closely with product owners and the business counterparts, acting as a sparring partner on technical solutions to our immediate challenges.

  • You will be part of a team where Code Quality, Code Reviews, Test Coverage, etc. are kept at very high standards, therefore you should also be positive and firm in your attitude towards them.

  • You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions, that your peers praise for its elegance and code readability.

  • You will be accountable for all aspects of your work as you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).

  • You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from ideation over design to implementation and maintenance.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.

  • Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

  • Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at related Conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.

  • Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5-year-old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.

item.title: Backend Engineer, Search Team at HotelTonight (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HotelTonight makes it remarkably easy to book great hotels at amazing last-minute rates on your mobile device, for tonight, tomorrow and next week. Our mission is to make people feel more alive by delivering the unexpected and we’re looking for a Backend Engineer to join our Search team and help do just that.


We believe that simplicity is one of the pillars of great user experiences. To keep things simple, our customers see a maximum of 15 hotels at a time - thanks to the team's scoring algorithm that ranks hotels based on market dynamics and behavioral data.

When you join HotelTonight, you'll work on search API and this scoring algorithm. You'll join the team in personalizing the search experience; connecting users with hotels they want to see. You'll also experiment with different setups of the algorithm by running A/B tests to find the sweet spot for core metrics. To accomplish this, you’ll have access to the best tooling and work with a best of class team.

Follow our Technology Blog at BuildTonight to learn about the Engineering Team's challenges, goals and everything in between.


WHAT YOU'LL DO



  • Collaborate with other engineers, product managers, designers, and domain experts to iterate on and improve our ranking algorithm and search APIs

  • Contribute to platform evolution, support existing features, recommend new ones and optimizations

  • Participate in code reviews, improve our software development processes and deliver high-quality software in a fast-paced environment

  • Work on managing and scaling the infrastructure that enables our services to process millions of requests per day with 99.99% uptime

item.title: Softwareentwickler / Informatiker (m/w) at ÖKOTEC Energiemanagement GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Veolia ist der weltweite Maßstab für optimiertes Ressourcen­management. Das Unter­nehmen entwickelt und verwirk­licht Lösungen für die Bereiche Wasser-, Ent­sorgungs- und Energie­manage­ment im Sinne einer nach­haltigen Ent­wicklung der Kommunen und der Wirtschaft. In Deutschland arbeiten mehr als 12.000 Mitar­bei­te­rinnen und Mitar­beiter an den über 200 Stand­orten von Veolia und seinen Beteili­gungs­gesell­schaften. Zusammen mit seinem Tochter­unter­nehmen ÖKOTEC Energie­manage­ment GmbH sind wir aktiver Gestalter der Energie­wende. Gemeinsam identifi­zieren und realisieren wir Energie­ein­spar­maß­nahmen bei unseren Kunden. Mittels unserer inno­vativen Software EnEffCo® sorgen wir darüber hinaus für eine trans­parente Nach­haltig­keit der umgesetzten Maßnahmen.




Vor dem Hintergrund eines wachsenden Kundenstammes und umfassenden neuen Entwicklungen suchen wir  für unser Tochterunternehmen ÖKOTEC Energiemanagement GmbH  an unserem Standort Berlin



Softwareentwickler / Informatiker (m/w)


Nr. 79756



Nach einer intensiven Einarbeitung werden Sie zunehmende Verantwortung für die Programmierung von Teilbereichen bis hin zu Softwaremodulen und Gesamtfunktionen bekommen. Ihre Tätigkeit erfolgt in enger Abstimmung mit unserem Entwicklungsteam.



Sie wirken mit bei der Entwicklung unserer EnEffCo®-Software:




  • Entwicklung Browser-basierter Anwendungsoberflächen für PCs und mobile Endgeräte

  • Programmierung komplexer Prozesse zur Verarbeitung und Analyse von Daten

  • Programmierung von Schnittstellen zu Geräten und anderen Datensystemen

  • Programmierung kundenspezifischer Zusatzmodule und von Prototypen für innovative Erweiterungs-Module

  • Mitwirkung bei der Konzept-Entwicklung

  • Support, Fehlersuche, Implementierung von Kundensystemen


Der Schwerpunkt Ihres Einsatzbereiches wird unter Berücksichtigung Ihrer Fähigkeiten und Interessen gemeinsam mit Ihnen festgelegt.



Ihr Profil:




  • Abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium oder vergleichbare Ausbildung mit entsprechender Zusatzqualifikation

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in C# oder Java, JavaScript, HTML und SQL

  • Vertraut im Umgang mit Visual Studio, Microsoft SQL Server, Web-Forms sowie in modernen Web-Applications-Architekturen

  • Von Vorteil sind Erfahrungen über Daten-Schnittstellen z. B. OPC UA, Modbus, MSCONS, TCP/(S)FTP-Protokoll

  • Grundkenntnisse in Physik und Mathematik, insbesondere im Bereich Messgrößen und deren Umrechnung, sollten vorhanden sein

  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

  • Gewissenhafte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise, analytisches Denkvermögen



Wir bieten Ihnen:



Eine Arbeits­atmosphäre, in der Engagement wahr­genommen, gute Ideen aufgenommen und eine Kommu­nikation auf Augenhöhe gepflegt wird – das schafft Ihnen optimale Einstiegs- und Ent­wicklungs­möglich­keiten in einem zukunfts­orien­tierten Unternehmen.




Wenn Sie diese Heraus­forderung reizt, freuen wir uns auf Ihre aus­sage­kräftige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehalts­vor­stellung und des frühest­möglichen Eintritts­termins unter folgendem Link: https://www.veolia.de/karriere/arbeiten-bei-veolia




Für nähere Informa­tionen stehen wir Ihnen gerne unter Telefon +49 30 536397-30 oder energie@oekotec.de zur Verfügung.

item.title: AWS / Kubernetes Senior DevOps Engineer M/F at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
To support our team we are currently looking for Senior DevOps Engineers (m/f) to join us in our Berlin office as soon as possible.


Your tasks


On Flixbus's DevOps Team, you are going to participate in engineering the next generation of our infrastructure platform. Our stack is highly sophisticated and composed of many cutting edge components. It's implemented based on a self-hosted kubernetes cluster that sits on top of AWS. Continuous operations are facilitated by Gitlab and Jenkins. Centralized logging is powered by Elasticsearch and Graylog. Monitoring and application instrumentation is handled by Prometheus and Grafana.

We believe in automating everything and are strongly inspired by Google's Site Reliability approach, so we strive to commit a maximum of 50% of our time to operations and a minimum of 50% to further automation of our infrastructure. The final vision is to have an elastic, self-healing and highly available computation cluster that provides a platform that's capable of handling our massive growth and offers great flexibility for our autonomous product teams.

Right now we are in the process of disassembling our PHP and jvm based monoliths, turning them into fine grained microservices and moving them into our new container based application layer. Soon our internal web-based tools, booking engine, mobile and iot backends, APIs and customer facing webservices will all *run* on the cluster.

Here another short video about why it is interesting to work for us:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTg

Your responsibilities:
Full stack development, you will build and adapt Golang, Lua, Python and Ruby based applications
Teach our delivery teams on how to use the stack
Contribute to open source projects (e.g. Kubernetes, Openresty and many more)
Write configuration scripts to further automate our infrastructure
Evaluate technology decisions and implementation strategies
Troubleshooting and disaster recovery
Build automated tests to make sure all components work properly


Skills & Requirements


Your Profile


Strong knowledge of designing cloud architectures
Fluent in English
Experience working with multiple development teams
Solid Linux, networking and database skills
Excellent communication skills
Be result driven and value oriented


Our offer


Be part of an incredibly fast growing company with a strong brand
Join a passionate and experienced team
Office location near Alexanderplatz
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours
Conference visits
Lots of opportunities for personal growth
International relocation support

What you can expect:
Trust and great responsibility
Constant learning
Having a fun time
Professional training and continuing education
12 free bus rides for you and great discounts for your family and friends

So if you are passioned about the new stack and you want keep up with promising emerging technologies, Flixbus is the place to be. Apply now!

item.title: Scala / Python Data Engineer M/F - Smart mobility to experience the world at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)

We want to grow our successful German business and therefore we are looking for Data Engineers (m/f) to join our Data Science team based in Berlin, Germany.


Your tasks


You will be responsible for building a data platform that manages our companies' data flows. 
The platform consists of several services (messaging, streaming, persistence, machine learning etc.) that can be used by our product development teams in a self-service way. 
As a member of one of our product development teams, you will be building data-intensive applications on top of our data platform, ranging from data ingestion to processing and making use of the data to provide smart services to our customers and internal business users.

3+ years of experience as Data Engineer or Software Engineer
Solid expertise in at least one programming language (preferably Scala, Java or Python) 
Working experience with structured engineering methods like test first (TDD, BDD)
Experience with big data technologies (Flume, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Redshift and NoSQL Databases) 
Practical experience with Amazon Web Services 

Nice to have:

Experience with Docker

item.title: Data Scientist (e-Commerce/ Machine Learning/ Python/ Zalon) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalon is the successful story of curated shopping experience, part of Zalando SE. Being part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent data and software engineering.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Zalon, you will be at the heart of business, data and technology; your work having an immediate impact on customer satisfaction and company profitability.

As part of our empowering technology culture - Radically Agile - you will have the autonomy to develop innovative and complex algorithms for novel use-cases from scratch, while leveraging our rich data, spread across a large range of topics. From data exploration and model building, to algorithm implementation or data engineering, you will have our trust to choose the optimal approach to solve problems. Our wide range of topics to touch upon include several different areas of machine learning and statistics, such as ranking algorithms, supervised and unsupervised learning, Bayesian inference, and any approach that will help you shine in your role.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.).

  • +4 years experience in the analysis of real data with the tools of Machine Learning.

  • Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analysing and modelling data sets and an interest in statistics.

  • Ideally, at least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object-oriented language, Python or Scala.

  • Willingness to work with microservices architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs.

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

  • Effective communication skills, ability to understand business requirements and an interest in being a touch point for product, software development and commercial.

  • Deep scepticism, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzwords, false assumptions and analysis.

  • English language fluency.


YOUR ROLE



  • Research, design, and implement algorithms to improve our various machine learning driven systems.

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability.

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis, to testing and deployment.

  • Play a critical role in the team as a creative input, working on key results. Your role will span over a number of various topics; therefore, a curious nature would be advantageous.

  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders.

  • Think in an abstract manner and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.

  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints.

  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.
Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.
Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.
Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5 year old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.
Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.

item.title: Working Student (m/f) Frontend Development at SuitePad GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We shape the hotel room of the future!


As the European market leader for in-room-tablets, more than 400 of the most renowned hotels worldwide trust us with their digital guest communication. For our international and agile team of three Full Stack Developers, two Android Developers and a Head of Engineering, we are on the hunt for a frontend focused working student (m/f). You love coding and are on the lookout to expand your knowledge in frontend development? Then we are thrilled to get to know you!


About what to expect:


Our Engineering Team develops the software and support infrastructure to remotely administer 10,000s of android devices. The devices are used daily by hotel guests and staff, so they have to run reliably. We’re looking for a team member who can support our Engineering Team to the fullest extent of his or her technical abilities, and do his or her best to grow those capabilities. The core assignments we’ll send your way (as a best guest):


Special Projects (5-10 hours) - We’d like to let you utilize what you already know and help that knowledge expand. Special projects could include:



  • If you have the skills, write tests to help expand our automated testing coverage

  • Helping write a Github<>Youtrack API integration

  • If we’re able to move far enough, we might be able to ask you to work on production code - with close mentorship


Occasional Manual QA (5 hours per week)



  • Assistance diagnosing technical issues with our tablets - sorting out configuration problems vs bugs

  • Manual testing of new features for Android with predefined test cases (the hours invested in this will continue to decline as we automate more of our testing, so you can focus on special projects more!)


Random technical tasks (<5 hours per week) - depends on your ability, but might include:



  • Setting up specialized raspberry pis, oDroids or other devices

  • Potentially helping with setups around our new IOT development projects

  • Random WIFI setup/troubleshooting

  • Helping SSH into remote tablets to diagnose technical issues from clearly defined instructions


A great deal of your success will depend on your passion and openness to learn and grow.  


About your profile:



  • You are currently enrolled in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field

  • You have growing knowledge in Front-End technologies like CSS3, HTML5 and Javascript. It would be amazing if you had experience with Ember.js and/or any experience writing automated tests in QUnit

  • You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and are able to prioritize and work independently

  • You can think outside the box and have a proactive working style

  • You have excellent command of English, German skills are a plus but not required

  • You are available to work between 15 and 20 hours per week and are interested in joining our team for at least six months

  • You are eager to grow, can take constructive feedback well, and see yourself in a web focused professional role


About our offer:



  • An innovative product with global traction and a lot of, no literally, tons of Android tablets and other devices at your disposal

  • You become part of our excellent Engineering Team and get exciting insights into our development cycle

  • You are right in the thick of things instead of watching from the sidelines and you will experience our successful development close up

  • A modern office right in the heart of Berlin and an environment where your ideas and impact are cherished

  • A competitive salary and the prospect of a long term collaboration

  • Yes, we have free drinks, fresh fruits and regular team events but more importantly: we are an international team that is fun to work with :-)


Technical Overview:


Our tech team has built a robust service oriented architecture that powers over 20,000 devices - tablets, large format digital touch screens, signage and even a touch projector, courtesy of a special partnership with Sony’s Xperia Touch Team. We power our devices with Android, digging deep into Android OS with our own custom ROMs. We’re primarily a Android/Ruby/Ember shop with some services and node.js and moving some services towards Elixir. We’re running our infrastructure on AWS, currently in dockerized EC2 instances with a home rolled orchestration system, but migrating to ECS. Most of our services are back by PostgreSQL DBs, with some redis and NoSQL sprinkled in where it makes sense. Finally, we use AMQP for as a message bus to tie server communications together.


Want to join us? Go ahead and apply!


Get in touch – become part of our team and shape our success story! Please send us:



  • Your CV

  • Cover letter (optional)

  • Any reference project(s) you have been part of.

  • Please mention any relevant special skills you have or want to improve. 

  • We’d also love to see a link to your GitHub profile - please direct us to any highlights we should look at.


Please send the above to Elisa Mucheyer (HR) at jobs@suitepad.de. We are looking forward to getting to know you.

item.title: Javascript Developer for the agricultural revolution at infarm GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Where are we now?


Our farms are automated and connected. A large amount of data is collected from them every minute. Our farm management system allows the INFARMers (operators, plant scientists and supervisors) to monitor in real time and control the farms via a dashboard and several apps. Reports are available for data-nerds.


About the position:


We’re looking for an enthusiastic individual willing to learn and grow with us. Autonomy, proactiveness and a feel for the bigger picture are all traits we consider important in potential employees. Interest in cutting edge technologies, an eye for design and entrepreneurial spirit are appreciated.


You will develop web and mobile applications, with emphasis on:


    - user interaction


    - data visualizations/exploration


    - reporting tools


    - data labeling tools for our machine learning pipelines


    - architecture and CI/CD


Since a number of stakeholders are involved, you need to be communicative, non-technology-first and oriented toward solutions.


Wondering about our cutting-edge frontend stack? 


- Angular CLI


- Angular Material2


- Angular 4


- Typescript


- Ionic 3


- Node


- Plotly/D3


- Ionic Framework


- TDD (Karma, Jasmine, Protractor)


What are we looking for? 


- You are communicative and a team player


- You have  experience with Angular2


- You are a craft-person 


- You're proficient in JS and know or want to get into Typescript 


- You understand RESTFul APIs

item.title: Head of Development Web & Mobile Apps (m/f) in Berlin at 4scotty.com (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Currently we are looking for an experienced Head of Development for our tech team in Berlin. We are facing bigger projects like moving to React and ECMAScript-7, refactoring our matching (machine learning), optimization on mobile and creating a scalable microservices architecture for the future.  



Therefore we want to give our tech team more leadership power to make our backlog tremble. Would it be interesting for you joining us and boosting our platform and team to the next level?


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • You are an experienced software developer / architect with minimum 5 years experience i

  • You gained already experience in leading a tech team and project management

  • You have excellent skills in Node.js and JS frameworks (we use Meteor and will use React in the near future)

  • You did build up large and complex web applications in the past

  • You bring experience in developing and building up software architectures

  • You enjoy to develop agile

  • You do not hate DevOps

  • You like to bring in your ideas in product development

  • You like to lead, coach and motivate an international team 



WHAT WE OFFER


Technology:


We pride ourselves with the latest technologies and trends of the tech world. Our stack is now based on Node.js, Meteor and Elastic Search and we want to use React, ECMAScript-6/7 and microservices architecture in the future. 
We deploy on AWS and Galaxy, use several top tools for communication, CRM and business intelligence, LESS, Jenkins and a few other fancy apps. All up to the latest versions. We use tools we like and make us love our job.You will sprint with us in scrum and we just started TDD. 


Working tools:


You will be assigned a computer you like and you can choose the development environment you want. We believe in diversity not just in personality, but also in tools and in way of doing things.


Team:


You will be working with our geek tech team and you will enjoy it! Our company language is English.


Personal development:


Here at 4scotty we value personal growth, motivation and passion for what we do. We will work together to find the best fit between what you like to do and what we need, and assign you responsibilities you are comfortable with. Ideally we would like to see you growing into your role, but we are ok if you feel comfortable with your position in your career and like to keep it that way.


Benefits:



  • Free water, mate, coffee, tea and sometimes beer

  • Team events

  • Homeoffice

  • Flexible working hours

  • Fun!


What else:


We would love to see your participation in product development and engage with our dev users in hackathons and events.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer (Ruby on Rails) (m/f) at CareerFoundry GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

Outcomes for 2017

  • Move our application to service oriented architecture

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Search & Browse (Scala & Solr/ElasticSearch) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Search & Browse" you will focus on developing Zalando's in-house search engine service providing highly relevant personalized search results helping millions of people find their favorite fashion items. You will be working with state-of-the-art technology to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.
Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality search results and also provide a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Scala developers and expert data scientists pushing "Fashion Search" one step further every day.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 3+ years of experience, working as a Scala Developer (or with any other functional programming language). A technical degree is a plus.

  • You are experienced with lucene-based technologies like Solr/ElasticSearch

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts

  • A keen interest in applied Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing and Data Mining is essential, work experience in these topics a plus

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You love to optimize processes & code and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving large-scale, data-driven products

  • You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce, Amazon EMR)

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our search pipeline in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our search for various markets all across Europe with more than a dozen different languages

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our search engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate & improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.




WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to join the team and work on building a robust platform leveraging cutting-edge infrastructure and tools that is scalable, accurate, governed, secured and coherent.  You would be joining our talented team who are self-starters, driven, bold and who are excited about exploiting emerging technologies to enable our business to solve complex problems.

item.title: Senior QA Engineer at Chegg Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Are you excited about working for a company that’s disrupting an entrenched industry?  Chegg is revolutionizing the business of higher education.  Chegg is looking for a hands-on Software Testing Engineer to help us craft the underlying systems that will allow us to continue to build the business as a leading social education platform. 
 
Organization: Writing Services
The goal of the Writing Services Team is to provide students with effective writing solutions to better their academic careers. Currently composed of 4 of the largest student citation services in the world - EasyBib.com, citationmachine.net, bibme.org, and citethisforme.com, the team reaches students from all over the world. The sites each have millions of unique visitors a year (almost 30 million combined) and has the potential to make a broad impact on students’ lives throughout the world.

Students struggle with the citations process, and Chegg offers fast and accurate solutions to this problem. Our sites reach almost 30 million users a year, and reach students at all grade levels. The Chegg family consists of 4 of the largest online citation services in the world. The role will create and improve existing backend services fueling all of our citation services.

We develop multiple products in parallel, in small dedicated teams. We are proud to work on high-quality code using modern development methods and technologies. Continuous integration and delivery, automated tests and quick development turnarounds are cornerstones of our development agenda.

The ideal candidate likes to think outside the box, is interested in constantly improving themselves and their team by education and feedback, and wants to give back some of their work to an open source community. They love tackling new problems, deploying frequently, thinking on their feet, and coming up with new ideas.
 
The Role:



  • You’ll be creating automated tests for our highly scalable and fault tolerant Java based systems.  We deal with financial transactions, so mistakes are literally costly.  We highly value test driven development.  We’re not a TDD team… yet.  You will participate in improving our team to reach TDD nirvana.

  • Understand the business problems being solved and understand how to evaluate our software that solves those problems

  • Create tests that maximize the value to our business (reduce risk the most for the least investment in effort)

  • Clearly communicate actionable insight to those that can resolve the problems you identify


 
Requirements:



  • Expert in creating and maintaining automated test suites.

  • Expert in communicating the results of tests and recommending corrective action

  • Expert in translating expected behavior into a comprehensive test suite

  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills

  • Experience with both RDBMS ( prefer MySQL ) and NoSQL

  • Experience with a scripting language ( e.g. Python, Perl, Ruby )

  • Experience working in a Linux/Unix development environment

  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience


 
Bonus Points



  • Experience with running automated tests on BrowserStack

CORE supports clients in critical IT transformation projects worldwide, cooperating with leading institutions where IT provides a disproportionately high contribution to their business success.
We are committed to the principles of confidential cooperation, the consistent application of expert knowledge, and strict performance orientation.
The development of our team members is a very important element of our corporate culture. Only by providing continuous guidance and training can we ensure that we meet our clients’ expectations consistently.


IT ARCHITECT (F/M)

Knowledge in IT architecture framework (TOGAF), enterprise integration frameworks and various database systems, SOA, CQRS, ES, microservices, asynchronous designs as well as ETL tools.
- Client work and software is your passion. In addition, you have always wanted an environment that consistently implements software projects at the highest quality level and bring you all the necessary skills and experience.


OUR OFFER

- Excellent development opportunities in a dynamic and growth- oriented company
- Motivated colleagues in a value-based and team-oriented corporate culture

Miriam Schiffer

item.title: Scientific programmer in Bioinformatics/Computational Biology (m/f) at MAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZIN (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Berlin Institute for Medical Systems Biology (BIMSB) is the most recently established institute at the Max-Delbruck Centre for Molecular Medicine (MDC) in Berlin, Germany, which is one of the national research centres of the Helmholtz Association. Research at BIMSB combines state-of-the-art high-throughput technologies with Bioinformatics, molecular biology, biochemistry and engineering to gain a comprehensive and fundamental understanding of different biological systems. The successful applicant will join an international team of interdisciplinary scientists on a vibrant research campus in Berlin, Germany.


The recently established Bioinformatics research group of RNA Structure and Transcriptome regulation (Prof. Meyer) seeks an experienced scientific programmer and Linux systems administrator to support the research of the Meyer group. The systems administration work will be coordinated with the Bioinformatics Platform headed by Dr. Akalin.


The MDC/BIMSB is looking for one


Scientific programmer in Bioinformatics/Computational Biology (m/f)


(Reg.-no. 10851/2017)


Job description:



  • overall: support the research program of the Meyer group and coordinate corresponding Linux system admin work with the BIMSB Bioinformatics Platform headed by Dr. Akalin

  • develop, test, install and configure new scientific software and computational analysis pipelines integrating various data sources and programs

  • set up and maintain web-servers for Bioinformatics applications

  • convert new and existing software and analysis pipelines into stable software packages for Linux distributions, e. g. for official release and for use on high-performance multi-user compute cluster

  • provide written and oral documentation of work including oral presentations of work


Required skills:


Essential skills:



  • strong interest in Bioinformatics research

  • excellent oral and written communication skills in English

  • bility to meet deadlines and to work independently as well as as part of a team

  • excellent programming skills in C++, Java, R

  • excellent programming skills in a scripting language (Perl and/or Python)

  • basic knowledge of statistics

  • experience establishing shared software profiles using reproducible builds (e. g. Guix) and packaging software from source (.rpm, .deb)

  • experience deploying software on different settings, in particular on shared-user high-performance clusters

  • experience in working with, installing and managing linux machines

  • experience in setting up web-servers or proxy (e. g. Apache) and in automated system deployment and linux configuration management (e. g. Puppet)


Desired skills:



  • experience in Bioinformatics research, in particular analyzing high-throughput sequencing data

  • experience in algorithm design

  • working knowledge of network storage, hardware, file system management, backup and recovery

  • experience working in an international environment and interdisciplinary research setting

  • oral and written communication skills in German (considered a plus, but not essential)


Certificates:



  • essential: BSc or MSc in Computer Science or Bioinformatics/Computational Biology or another science discipline with a strong focus on devising and employing computational methods

  • essential: a minimum of 2 (Msc) or 3 (BSc) years of experience as scientific programmer

  • desired: Red Hat Certified Engineer or Ref Hat Certified System Administrator


Salary: German TVÖD (Bund/Ost) E13, depending on qualification and experience Start date: as soon as possible Application deadline: October 31, 2017 Limitation: The position is initially offered for 2 years, with the possibility for further extension beyond the initial 2-year contract.


For further information please contact
Irmtraud Meyer (irmtraud.meyer@mdc-berlin.de) or Altuna Akalin (altuna.akalin@mdc-berlin.de)


Please submit your complete application by indicating the registration number 10851/2017 as a single pdf-file by email to Sabrina Deter (sabrina.deter@mdc-berlin.de) including



  • letter of motivation (1 page max)

  • CV including relevant experience

  • university and other relevant certificates

  • full contact details of 2 or more referees


The MDC is an equal opportunity employer and supports gender equality.


MAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZIN
More information: www.mdc-berlin.de/bimsb


MAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZIN
More information: www.mdc-berlin.de/bimsb

www.tinkerbots.com

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at DCMN GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
DCMN is growing fast and is getting more and more international. Therefore we are looking to hire a world-class Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) to support our fantastic team, based in our headquarter in Berlin.



We're looking someone (an "experienced DevOps engineer" if you wish) to guide the operational side of our tech team. You'll get your hands dirty and have to maintain, grow, and optimize our development infrastructure, but the focus will be on driving the culture to enable the team to maintain the infrastructure, not on maintaining it yourself.

We're currently a ~20 person tech team deploying three products across a mix of bare metal and AWS infrastructure. We are explicitly looking for someone to coordinate the whole team's efforts and provide experience and vision for how to set up and maintain a clean infrastructure. That is, we'd like you to provide ideas and enable everyone to work on infrastructure without pulling their hair out. We're generally very open to doing things the "right way" if you can convince us that that's what it is.

The kind of questions we'd like to answer together



  • Should we move everything to the cloud or to bare metal?

  • Do we want containers and which scheduler should we use?

  • We need to scale our product globally: Should we set up a "satellite system" in Asia due to latency requirements, or will Europe be good enough for now? What can we keep here, what needs to go into the satellite? How do we synchronize storage? How much would it cost?

  • How can we unify our rather diverse provision/build/test/deployment structure (chef, salt, docker, jenkins, make, ...)?

  • How can we make environments available for development and for staging, production branches? Both for developers across Linux and Mac OS and for the product team?


Some things you'll get to play around with:



  • a bare metal RTB set-up handling 100k requests per second

  • a Spark data science pipeline processing a few hundreds of GB per day

  • PostgreSQL replication and failover

  • MySQL on RDS

  • Aerospike/Redis/Elasticsearch clusters


Requirements



  • You should be able to provide well-founded input to questions like the above

  • You are able to understand and modify our current deployment automation tooling

  • Experience in administering and automating networking, Linux, AWS or similar

  • Experience in troubleshooting networking and systems failures

  • Fluent in English (written and spoken)



What's in it for you?



  • Work in a dynamic, experienced team of outstanding developers

  • Be a part of an elite international team – we have 30 nationalities!

  • Working with the latest technologies

  • Take full responsibility from day one

  • Home-office and remote work friendly, matched with flexible working hours.

  • We're not cheap, you'll get a nice screen or two

  • Free language courses, pilates classes and massages during and outside work time

  • We live work/life balance (!)

  • A recently remodelled and trendy office in a building with other great digital companies in one of the hottest neighbourhoods in Berlin,

  • A competitive compensation and an incentive plan that rocks when you rock



Interested?


Does this job description sound perfect for you? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. Your contact person is Theresa Jasaraj (career@dcmn.com).

Please note: We prefer applications via our application form.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Recommendation & Personalization (Java, Big Data) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Recommendation & Personalization" you are working on Zalando state-of-the-art recommendation systems serving millions of customers with highly relevant and personalized content. You will be working with the newest technologies to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.



Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality recommendation results and at the same time provide a low-latency, rock solid and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of an autonomous and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced software engineers and expert data scientists working on the cutting-edge every day.


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 4+ years of experience, working as a (Java or Scala) developer. A technical degree is a plus

  • You have in-depth experience of working with data-driven recommendation solutions, including creating, implementing, and tuning recommendation engines

  • You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce)

  • You are experienced in building and deploying large-scale, distributed data-driven systems in a cloud environment

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts and have passion to solve algorithmic problems

  • You have a keen interest in Data Mining & Processing as well as applied Machine Learning

  • You’ve worked with NoSQL databases before (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB) and ideally also have experience in search engines (Solr, Elasticsearch)

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to enterprise level

  • You love to improve & optimize software and to use new technologies

  • Knowledge of near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommender systems in short release cycles

  • You will build and operate all services and stream-processed data infrastructure for low-latency personalized recommendations

  • You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our recommendations for various markets all across Europe for millions of customers

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.




WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

item.title: iOS Code Signing Engineer (f/m) at incapptic Connect GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

  • Happy to support us on-site in Berlin.

item.title: Python Developer (f/m) for Data Analytics at Autonomous Mobility Services at Daimler Mobility Services GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Our mission


The future of mobility is shared and autonomous. With electric and autonomous vehicles hitting the roads in the next years, we are working towards a new revolution in urban mobility and increase the quality of urban life by reducing traffic and emissions.


It’s on us to create remarkable products and services around thousands of autonomous vehicles that bring people to their destinations quick, safe and most convenient.


The project


The Daimler Mobility Services is building up a hub for future mobility in the heart of Berlin.


We will focus on customer related questions and make autonomous driving services applicable and prepare its mass suitable use in public transportation. We will build a customer service platform that includes real-time data processing, Big Data analysis and machine learning algorithms as well as a user friendly front end.


Your role



  • Implementing large scale data processing with real time constraints in the cloud

  • Redesigning and implementing algorithms for parallel processing

  • Developing software prototypes to evaluate solution approaches, functionalities and mutual interactions

  • Creating production-ready Docker containers for self-built software


Requirements



  • You have successfully completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar qualification

  • You have minimum 3 years of work experience in software development

  • You have good knowledge in working in and with agile teams with SCRUM and you can handle challenging deadlines


Skills and tools



  • You have very proficient Python skills

  • You can create production-ready Docker containers for self-built software

  • You are experienced in developing large scale data processing applications


That would be a plus



  • You have a good understanding of today’s security and data protection requirements


Your work environment


You will be based at our brand new and unique office in the heart of Berlin. The building offers spacious offices and meeting rooms and excellent connectivity to public transport.


The team


As a self-organised and agile team we work collaboratively to solve complex problems outside of the car. We are an international team of experts which is just about to be built up. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and the eagerness to build services that make daily mobility easier and hazzle-free.


The recruitment process


When you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.


If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.


The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Stuttgart, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and a hiring manager.

Interested? Then go ahead and apply now!






APPLY FOR THIS JOB

item.title: Senior Mobile App Developer / Architect (iOS/Android) at 365FarmNet Group GmbH & Co. KG (Berlin, Deutschland)

item.title: JS Frontend Engineer at Europes most popular home & living shopping platform at Home24 AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Are you interested in building software used by millions of customers? Do you like writing performant, high quality code at a rapid pace? If you answered yes to these questions, you could be just the person we’re looking for to join our team at Home24.


We are looking for a great Senior Frontend Engineer who is passionate about developing customer-facing front end solutions that will deliver a great user experience - whether you’re on your smartphone, tablet or home computer. In joining our team you will get the opportunity to work on some of the most interesting and challenging problems we can offer. This position is full-time and based in our cool office in Berlin.


Responsibilities



  • Build beautiful, fast,efficient and reusable frontend solutions

  • Build prototypes and proof of concepts to demonstrate emerging technologies

  • Working with product managers and UX designers to implement the next generation of the Home24 e-commerce experience

  • Use RESTful APIs for communication with our backend services

  • Work in a small agile team collaborating with designers and other engineers taking features from concept to production

  • Identify and adopt best practices for software and front-end engineering

  • Make demos for the whole company to share achievements


What we can offer you



  • Opportunity to use state of the art front end development tools

  • Become a part of a highly motivated world class team of technology professionals

  • An open culture to learn, share new ideas, solve hard problems and opportunity to demonstrate your creativity to make a real difference

  • Opportunities for advancement, independence and the autonomy to take on responsibility

  • Benefits including relocation support, employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and much more


Skills & Requirements


Skills you should have



  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript and web technologies (HTML5/CSS3); 4+ years of experience in building web applications

  • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for the UI

  • Working experience with React.Js, preferably with REDUX and ES2015

  • Working experience with Javascript testing, component testing and acceptance testing

  • Familiar with the use of RESTful APIs in modern Frontend Applications

  • You are passionate about mobile first thinking and development (responsive / adaptive)


Skills that are nice to have



  • Practical knowledge and experience in jQuery and JavaScript frameworks like Backbone and Angular is a big plus

  • Node.js and AWS stack experience is a plus

  • Experience in deployment automation and continuous delivery is a plus

item.title: Frontend Developer at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
From a technology perspective, we have thousands of sensors with our own firmware installed in our customers’ retail stores around the world. We process terabytes of data via machine learning algorithms and provide a self-service  platform for our analytics solutions. We offer a great opportunity for personal and professional growth in a multicultural environment. We work, learn and develop while having lots of fun on the way.

Join our team as a Frontend Developer.

What we do all day:
We create a beautiful self-service platform for our analytics solutions using modern tools and libaries such as React, Redux, Webpack, Babel and write JavaScript in ES6. We work in cross-functional teams in order to create a premium experience for our customers. We believe that being a good developer is not so much a question of skills, but more a question of mindset. If you are passionate like us, you love to learn, work and share knowledge with your team, you will be a good fit.


Skills & Requirements


Required skills:

- You love working with JavaScript (and frameworks like React, Angular or Ember) and CSS
- 1+ years of working experience in frontend
- You find and share frontend best-practices with team members and other developers
- You pay attention to details and identify potential performance weak spots

Appreciated skills:

- You are creative and have a sense for good (responsive) design and user experience
- You have good skills with the Adobe Creative Suite

item.title: Agile Database Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer (m/f) (Berlin or Groningen) at Swarm64 AS Zweigstelle Hive (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Your Role 


Your passion for software quality will make Swarm64's products a success. As a member of our application team, your work has substantial influence not only on the stability of our product, but also on the productivity of our developers. Through close collaboration with stakeholders you gather test requirements and implement them in collaboration with software developers. Your work makes Swarm64's continuous delivery a reality and gives the team and company instant feedback when product quality can be improved.
You will also play a major role in the shaping of our future testing and quality assurance strategy and direction. 


Soft Skills 



  • Team Player we test and develop software as a team and make our decisions collectively so we are looking for someone who can both lead the team towards a consensus and compromise when needed as we develop our QA strategy and goals. 

  • Communicator good communication skills are necessary to work with software developers and to achieve a team consensus on future directions and strategies, as our QA engineers are part of the software development team, you will work closely with developers to write and automate tests as needed.

  • Growth Oriented our company is small, but growing fast and will be growing even faster.  We need co-workers who can help with hiring, mentoring, onboarding and planning for future team and company needs 


Hard Skills 



  • Experience in testing complex software above the unit level

  • Experience with continuous integration

  • Proficient in at least one scripting language, preferably Python

  • Basic knowledge of SQL and relational databases 


Your Daily Work 



  • Work in our office in Berlin or in our newly opened office in Groningen (NL).

  • Work with the Product Owner to ensure all features being advertised to customers are covered by tests.

  • Help software developers to write unit tests.

  • Help automate systems to ensure that we can keep quality targets

  • Write functional tests with the help of developers.

  • Perform exploratory testing as needed.

  • Work with the team to plan sprints and prioritize bugs and feature backlog.

item.title: Scrum Master (f/m) Autonomous Mobility Services at Daimler Mobility Services GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Our mission


The future of mobility is shared and autonomous. With electric and autonomous vehicles hitting the roads in the next years, we are working towards a new revolution in urban mobility and increase the quality of urban life by reducing traffic and emissions.


It’s on us to create remarkable products and services around thousands of autonomous vehicles that bring people to their destinations quick, safe and most convenient.


The project


The Daimler Mobility Services is building up a hub for future mobility in the heart of Berlin.


We will focus on customer related questions and make autonomous driving services applicable and prepare its mass suitable use in public transportation. We will build a customer service platform that includes real-time data processing, Big Data analysis and machine learning algorithms as well as a user friendly front end.


Your role



  • You will lead and act as a Scrum master for 1-2 scrum teams, advise them in agile working methods and help them reach their goals



  • You will be facilitating sprint planning, retrospective and sprint demos and ensuring cross-team coordination

  • Acting as a project manager when necessary. Take responsibility for managing dependencies between our team and third parties or between our team and other scrum teams.

  • Reaching out to the larger company network for impediment removal and represent the teams towards other stakeholders



Requirements



  • You have successfully completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a similar qualification



  • You have minimum 3 years of work experience in software development, dealing with sophisticated and technically focused client server products or developing large scale data processing applications




  • You have gained experience playing the Scrum Master role for at least two years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theory



Skills and experience



  • Good knowledge of other agile approaches: XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc.



  • Broad knowledge of numerous well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach (example: numerous Burndown techniques, numerous Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc.)


That would be a plus



  • Proven experience as a team lead


Your work environment


You will be based at our brand new and unique office in the heart of Berlin. The building offers spacious offices and meeting rooms and excellent connectivity to public transport.


The team


As a self-organised and agile team we work collaboratively to solve complex problems outside of the car. We are an international team of experts which is just about to be built up. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and the eagerness to build services that make daily mobility easier and hazzle-free.


The recruitment process


When you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.


If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.


The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Stuttgart, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and an HR manager.

item.title: (Senior) PHP Entwickler, Softwareentwickler (m/w) PHP, Datenbank, API at Ventoro Fenster & Türen GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
(Senior) PHP Entwickler, Softwareentwickler (m/w) – PHP, Datenbank, API


Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen (Senior) PHP Entwickler, Softwareentwickler (m/w) für unser Berliner Büro, der mit uns den Erfolg von Ventoro mitgestalten möchte.


ÜBER VENTORO


Wir bei Ventoro digitalisieren den Fenstermarkt! Unseren Kunden bieten wir beim Fensterkauf ein Rundum-sorglos-Paket inklusive Einbau der Fenster zum Festpreis – mittlerweile in jeder Region Deutschlands. Wir entwickeln Technologielösungen (u. a. APIs, Web-Apps, iOS-Apps), die die Branche vor uns noch nie gesehen hat. Dafür suchen wir talentierte PHP-Entwicklerinnen und -Entwickler mit Pioniergeist. Unser CEO ist selber Programmierer und leitet das Team. Bei der Entwicklung setzen wir auf State-of-the-Art-Technologien und –Prozesse (z.B. Scrum, Testautomatisierung, Continuous Integration, Cloud Infrastruktur).


Deine Aufgaben



  • Du verantwortest die Planung und Entwicklung unserer PHP-Systeme, welche von unseren Mitarbeitern, Kunden, Monteuren und Lieferanten genutzt werden.

  • Du entwickelst Systeme, die die Branche noch nicht gesehen hat.

  • Du bist technischer Ansprechpartner für Deine Projekte.

  • Du arbeitest in einem motivierten Arbeitsumfeld nach dem Scrum-Prinzip.

  • Du übernimmst Verantwortung in unserem wachsenden Team.


Dein Profil



  • Du hast mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von PHP Anwendungen.

  • Du hast Erfahrung mit bekannten PHP Frameworks (z.B. Laravel, Symfony, Zend, etc.)

  • Du kennst Dich sehr gut mit relationalen Datenbanken aus, insbesondere SQL.

  • Du hast Erfahrung in objektorientierter Programmierung.

  • Du hast Erfahrung in Unit- und Integration-Testing.

  • Du verfolgst aktuelle Entwicklungen in der Community und bist neuen Technologien gegenüber aufgeschlossen.

  • Du verfügst über gute bis sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.


Wir bieten



  • Die Chance das Entwicklungs-Team aktiv mitzugestalten, da es gerade aufgebaut wird.

  • Viel Platz für eigene Ideen und Möglichkeiten, Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

  • Freie Wahl Deiner Hard- und Software (Mac, Windows, Linux).

  • Spannende Projekte, bei denen Du von Anfang an dabei bist.

  • Flache Hierarchien, Spaß und Teamzusammenhalt.

  • Ein schönes Büro in Berlin-Mitte mit Klimaanlage.

  • Einen ruhigen Arbeitsplatz, der konzentriertes Arbeiten ermöglicht.

  • Kostenlose Snacks und Getränke im Büro.

  • Regelmäßige Teamevents (Lasertag, LAN-Partys, Catering, Teamlunch etc.).


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?


Dann schicke uns Deine Expressbewerbung – wir melden uns bei Dir!


Charlotte, Anna und Bianca vom Ventoro-HR-Team Weitere Informationen zu ventoro findest Du hier: www.ventoro.de

item.title: Work at Zenjob in Berlin as React Frontend Developer at Zenjob (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:

item.title: Data Platform Architect - (Java or Scala & Hadoop) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


As a Data Platform Architect at Zalando, you will be responsible for building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more efficiently. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


You will work for the Data Services department in Zalando, supporting the teams that are taking care of defining our Big Data strategy. Among the other services that you will help evolve, there are the Data Lake and Nakadi. The Data Lake is a platform that aims to collect all the data and business events generated within Zalando, in near-real-time and batch manner, archive them, offer transformation functionalities and data access that will be used to take data-driven decisions. Nakadi is an Event Bus (open sourced by Zalando) that creates an abstraction layer on top on Apache Kafka (and other distributed streaming platform) providing REST interfaces and several feature like schema validation, schema definition evolution, authentication, authorization.


What we are looking for



  • Experience as data architect or senior engineer in larger scale companies in the internet domain like e-commerce, software or infrastructure as a service (SaaS, PaaS), or similar

  • Ability to demonstrate competencies and experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of big data technologies, like Spark, Flink, Presto, Impala, Hadoop / MapReduce, Google BigQuery and scalable pub/sub event message queues (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis)

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied data mining and machine learning techniques

  • Knowledge of microservice based SOA and service communication using RESTful APIs, GraphQL, gRPC, Avro or other techniques

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Java, Scala or Python

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills and ability to balance technical trade-offs

  • A great communicator with different stakeholders who is skilled in architecture documentation and technical presentations

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Design and build a cloud-based mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement our existing analytics and data warehouse (DWH) architecture

  • Align multiple teams to apply new big data solutions and provide support as an architect and a peer review partner

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via documentation, coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


You Benefit From


Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Taryn Bonugli

item.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer - (HTML/CSS, React, Angular/Angular 2 or Node) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will be building the technologies that are utilized as a base for further products and aim to connect all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility - a software development methodology that allows engineers to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.


Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement, it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue.Along with you, we strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. As part of your onboarding, you will get to know some and join one of our teams that matches your interests and skills. As a team, you will build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that redefine the user experience of our customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code. You will decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive the whole development cycle according to its purpose - from implementation to testing and maintenance.


Mastery. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user-centricity of our software. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.


Skills & Requirements


You Are Skilled


Technologies. In working hands-on with JavaScript, HTML/CSS, modern libraries (eg. React) and frameworks (eg. Angular/Angular 2 or Ember). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.


Code Quality. In writing high-performance, reusable code and using version control systems.


Feature Development. In delivering bug free and fully functional features and products that are well tested and based on user requirements.


Knowledge Exchange. In contributing to our growing frontend community and becoming part of our internal Web Guild.


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coder Dojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, subvention of your occupational pension plan, 40% Zalando shopping discount, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals as well as help with kindergarten and schools, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice, family rooms


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel, Matthias Schmeißer or Antonia Samanns.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Java/ Scala/ Go) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

item.title: System Operations Engineer - Systemadministrator (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Develop the future of journalism with us!


We are CeleraOne: A team of highly motivated software developers, architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from machine learning, routing algorithms and signal processing to compiler technology and theoretical mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve the technology behind CeleraOne’s paywalls, real-time analytics and machine learning models to support newspaper publishers in Europe like Axel Springer or NZZ Mediengruppe.

  • Installation, backup, configuration, operation and monitoring of Linux systems

  • Managing of CI/CD and support developer teams

  • Responsible for incident, problem, and change management

  • Deployment and monitoring of the CeleraOne software stack

 Who we’re looking for



  • At least two years experience with production systems running Linux

  • Experience with common internet protocols

  • Strong knowledge of configuring, operating and debugging web servers and databases

  • Experience with automation and/or configuration management tools like Ansible, Salt, Puppet or Chef

  • Experience with installation and usage of monitoring tools (elastic stack, Icinga/Nagios, Ganglia)

Why join us?
