item.title: Software Engineer - Backend (Ruby) at Babbel (Lesson Nine GmbH) (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Hallo! Bonjour! Hi!


We believe that everybody should have the chance to learn a foreign language. Languages are about much more than simple everyday communication, they are a unique window into a rich world of diverse and colourful cultures. Babbel exists to offer everybody the chance to learn languages.


Babbel offers 14 learning languages - from English to Indonesian - and, since founding in 2007, we have grown to become the market leader in app-based language learning. There are 500 of us from over 42 different countries working hard to keep this going - we call ourselves ‘Babbelonians’.


We want to inspire change and create even more. That’s where you come in.


As our Backend focused Software Engineer, you will be self-motivated, full of ideas as well as energy and collaborate with other talented engineers in making our software even better.
So, from one kind of language to another, we are looking to talk with enthusiastic and dedicated Software Engineers who speak our language….Ruby/Rails. We use the following technologies:



  • Ruby testing frameworks using BDD/TDD

  • REST-based API

  • AWS

  • Node.js, Sinatra or other server side frameworks

  • React.js/Redux (Nice to have)


More broadly, we are looking for smart and curious minds who can share in our goal of widening access to language learning. You care about maintaining a clean code base and strive for technical excellence in the build of our product.
Above all else, you are always personally learning and developing, and you have the maturity and technical artistry to make timely and sustainable contributions.


If this sounds interesting, why not learn more about the exciting culture that we are building in our Engineering teams.  


To see first hand what life is like as a Babbelonian check out our Twitter pages @BabbelBytes and @BabbelJobs
Apply now and a Babbelonian will be in touch soon.

item.title: Frontend JavaScript Developer (m/f) React/Redux at Kentaur GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
remind me GmbH is a Berlin-based start-up that has set itself the goal of revolutionizing the market for contract changes of any kind. Via a digital reminder service, we help our customers to keep an eye on the cancellation dates of their long-running contracts such as electricity, gas, mobile communications or magazine subscriptions to renegotiate with their provider in good time or to cancel them at the right time. Thanks to the strong demand and our comprehensive market research, we are in a position to offer our users the best conditions and attractive additional services.



Our goal is to convince our customers with a state-of-the-art product. Therefore, we are looking for an innovative and quality-oriented






Frontend JavaScript Developer (m/f) React/Redux


who looks beyond the horizon and loves to proactively take part in the development of our FinTech product.


 Your tasks:







  • Planning, development and integration of JavaScript-based software solutions using Node.js, React and Redux in an agile environment

  • Ensure the scalability and performance of existing and new software solutions

  • Development of new concepts in close collaboration with our product management team

  • Observation of technical innovations and trends in the market and adaptation for the product development


What we offer:



  • The chance to design an innovative product with a high customer base in FinTech

  • The opportunity to design our technical basis independently for the future

  • A lot of space for the implementation of your own ideas

  • An open, friendly and very pragmatic team of colleagues

  • Cooperation with very experienced serial entrepreneurs centrally located in Berlin-Mitte






Your qualifications:



  • You are keen on creating an innovative product that provides a noticeable benefit to our users.

  • You embody the culture of excellent troubleshooting, communication and documentation.

  • Secure handling of JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Node.js, React, Redux)

  • Good understanding of software architectures, REST APIs and mircoservices-based applications as well as data handling (JSON, YAML, XML)

  • A good sense of usability & user experience

  • Experience in applying build automation tools such as Webpack, Gulp or Babel

  • High degree of quality awareness in product development

  • Good communication skills (English, German is a plus) and a pragmatic approach

  • Computer Science diploma or equivalent education is desirable






 Are you up for a challenge?






Would you like to experience this unique opportunity? Then send your application documents via email to Henning Claußen (Interim HR Manager) at: jobs [at] remind.me. If you have questions regarding this position, please feel free to contact me directly: henning [at] remind.me. I look forward to hearing from you!


remind me GmbH         Novalisstr. 10         10115 Berlin         jobs@remind.me

item.title: Senior JavaScript Developer - build a digital hospital at medbelle (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Healthcare is one of the least digitised and standardised industries, making it incredibly inefficient and often causing negative patient experiences. 


We are reinventing healthcare to make it work as it should. MedBelle offers medical procedures whilst leveraging technology to make the process simple from start to finish.


Backed by experienced investors, we are helping an ever-growing number of patients and are looking for a senior JavaScript developer to build the foundation of our tech team in Berlin and bring real change to healthcare.


You are a great fit if:




  • You're fluent in English (both spoken and written)




  • You have a great understanding of ...




    • JavaScript, Meteor and/or Express.js (or another Node.js framework) and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB as well as API design




    • JavaScript (ES6), React, web basics (HTML, CSS/LESS), fundamental UX concepts and a good feeling for design






  • You have lead software development teams and have a strong view regarding development processes (communication, code quality, testing, GIT, general DevOps)




  • You know how to prioritise business results and minimise technical debt




  • Experience with microservice architecture design is a plus




  • Key ingredient: You are passionate and motivated about what you do and why you do it, and genuinely want to improve people’s lives.

    We have worked really hard to build a very driven team that works tenaciously to get modern healthcare to where it should be. We put our heart into it - not only for ourselves or our team but to make our vision reality. This is key in a successful company like ours.




What you will do:




  • Coin MedBelle’s development culture: help build, shape and grow our tech team




  • Collaborate with founders and Head of Software Engineering on technical decisions




  • Develop software to improve medbelle.com for patients, doctors and staff




  • Build a scalable architecture




Compensation & Benefits:




  • Competitive base salary




  • Free hardware choice




  • Budget for tech conference visits




  • Share options plan: you will be an integral part of the company and should be rewarded for it




What you’ll find at MedBelle:




  • A small, highly international (60%+), English-speaking (and very funny) MedBelle family who loves to welcome new additions




  • A company culture focused on building a great service and a professional emphasis on numbers and growth but also making every day more fun than the last




  • The usual cool stuff: free drinks, coffee (and British tea!), Friday memes & beers, etc.




We move quickly. If you are a great match, we can cover the initial phone interview, technical on-site interview and chat with the founders in one week.


We look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Senior Android Developer (f/m) at DaWanda GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
What it´s all about:

You love developing Apps for Android? You use a butterknife not only while breakfast? When you hear "Otto" and "Bus" you don´t only think about the Simpsons? You want to work in a dynamic team with motivated colleagues from all over the world? You have strong interest in new technologies, passion for developing apps and want to work in a technology focused company?

Do you think this could be you? To pursue our mobile strategy, we are looking for a Senior Android Developer (f/m).  In this position, you will be responsible for the optimization and maintenance of our existing Android App and development of completely new apps from scratch.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Develop Apps for Android phones and tablets by collaborating with a user-centered and self-organized team

  • Write High Quality Code, that needs to be clean, self-explanatory and flexible

  • Work with modern libraries like okhttp, retrofit, dagger

  • You establish a Continous Integration System and Build-Pipeline to get fast feedback from stakeholder & QA

  • Monitor and participate in workflow tracking and documentation and decide on tooling, e.g. Trello


Our Requirements:



  • Deep knowledge and practical experience with the Android SDK, ADT and Android Studio

  • A minimum of 2+ years of Android development and experience with RxJava

  • Experience with Kotlin is a nice to have

  • Knowledge of user-centered design principles coupled with a “Don’t make me think” understanding of usability

  • Experience developing against multiple devices and screen sizes

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, GIT, testing, and operations

  • Knowledge of Ruby a plus


We offer:



  • Be part of one of Europe’s most loved internet brands

  • To see your ideas become a reality and generate value

  • The opportunity for personal and professional development

  • Participate in an open, creative, innovative company culture

  • Flexible working hours

  • Work in a beautiful loft in Berlin Charlottenburg


If you are interested in this position, please send us your complete application stating the earliest date you could start and indicate your salary expectations.

item.title: Software Engineer Ruby (f/m) at DaWanda GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
DaWanda is the leading German online marketplace for handmade and unique products. We are looking for passionate and skilled people to join our software development team. We are an international and diverse group and we strongly support the Ruby community.


How we work

Our Product Engineering department is composed of passionate Software and QA Engineers, UX/UI Designers, Data Analysts and BI Experts. We manage our own fleet of servers, deploying our services inside Docker containers. Besides, we develop our features in small incremental steps, with a workflow based on GitHub pull requests. We want our code to be well tested and we continuously deploy new features to production. The scale of our operations is a sweet spot between the freedom and the agility of a startup and the challenges of a big company.


You have gained experience with Ruby on Rails and Ruby in general in large-scale production environments? You are a team player who knows how to integrate with many different technologies, not only from the Ruby land? You are generally interested to explore other technologies and languages? Join us as a Software Engineer Ruby (f/m).


Your Responsibilities:



  • Work in a flat hierarchy international team (our office language is English)

  • Write elegant and performant code that is easy to maintain

  • Develop your code well-tested and improve tests and code continuously

  • You deploy to our production cluster with over 100 million monthly page impressions on a daily basis

  • Agile development and modern project management following the Scrum approach

  • Ensure, restructure and maintain code for scalability


Our Requirements:



  • You build software not only at work, you are passionate about software

  • Experience in software development

  • Knowledge and production experience of Ruby and its ecosystem of frameworks and gems

  • Experience in web-technologies and agile development

  • Good command of English 


We offer:



  • The opportunity to bring in fresh ideas to the team and participate in the next evolution of our platform

  • Join a talented, driven and international team, passionate about our product and our customers

  • Highly relevant, insightful and challenging tasks & the opportunity for personal and professional development

  • Participate in an open, creative, innovative company culture with flexible working hours

  • All the perks of working in the most exciting city in Europe when it comes to quality of life and knowledge sharing opportunities in tech


If you are interested in this position, please send us your complete application stating the earliest date you could start and indicate your salary expectations.

item.title: Abschlussarbeit zu Smart Contract-Plattformen in der Praxis at Senacor Technologies AG (Berlin, Deutschland) (allows remote)
item.description:
Deine Aufgaben


Deine Bachelor- oder Masterarbeit umfasst den Vergleich und die Bewertung unterschiedlicher Smart Contract-Plattformen. Gemeinsam mit unseren Experten untersuchst du, welche weniger bekannten Plattformen es neben Ethereum gibt und was unterschiedliche Smart Contracts auszeichnet. Auch die Unterschiede der virtuellen Maschinen, die für die Contracts zuständig sind, sollen herausgearbeitet werden.


Ziele deiner Abschlussarbeit sind:



  • Anzahl und Implementierungsstatus der Smart Contract-Plattformen am Markt (Ethereum, Hyperledger-Fabric, NEO, Tangle (Iota), Counterparty, Lisk)

  • Vergleich der unterschiedlichen Plattformen

  • Auswahl von ein bis zwei prototypischen Beispielen und der exemplarischen Umsetzung auf allen Plattformen 


Dein Profil




  • Überdurchschnittlicher Notenschnitt im Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder in einem vergleichbaren Studiengang




  • Grundkenntnisse der Blockchain-Technologie und Smart Contract-Programmierung




  • Fortgeschrittene Smart Contract-Programmiererfahrung von Vorteil




  • Erfahrung mit Virtuellen Maschinen (Laufzeitumgebungen) wie z.B. der JVM von Vorteil




  • Teamgeist, Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Pragmatismus und gehöriger Biss sowie Begeisterung für neue Technologien









Die Abschlussarbeit ist ab sofort zu besetzen, deinen Standort wählst du selbst.

item.title: Help us as Frontend Web Developer to become the standard for personalized audio at Mimi Hearing Technologies GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Frontend Web Developer as full-time position in our office in Berlin.


// This is your workplace:


Mimi Hearing Technologies, founded in 2014 in Berlin, is one of the most promising startups in the mHealth / sound space. We develop tools for people to explore their hearing health and enjoy a unique listening experience - we strive to be the forefront of sound innovation.


Our skills are deeply rooted in science, psychoacoustics and engineering. The Mimi team is a diverse group of innovators with strong expertise in audio- and sound engineering, product, communication and business design.



  • Mimi Hearing Test is the number one hearing test app in the AppStore with over one million tested ears worldwide

  • Mimi Music is revolutionizing the way, how people listen to Music and the upcoming Mimi SDK will enable even more use cases for our technology

  • Total number of app downloads: 650K

  • Two patents filed + two patents in the pipeline

  • Close cooperation with Charité Berlin and medical certification of our products


Our vision is to set a new standard for the way we listen and become the #1 technology for personalized sound and hearing health.


// Who are we looking for?


We are committed to create a culture which nourishes personal growth as the base for company growth. We are a learning organisation which means, we love to work with people who start doing things, fail and learn fast in order to keep moving instead of waiting and drafting the perfect solutions.


As our Frontend Web Developer you will:



  • Build responsive web applications with a clear focus on frontend development

You must have

Daniel

Who you are

Core information

Working Student


We also welcome applications from students in any field. We will find a suitable task for your level of experience.


Apply today to find out more.

item.title: Java Developer (f/m) for ePayment solutions at Daimler Mobility Services GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
That's us


Become part of Daimler Group’s unique electronic payment system ‘Mercedes pay’! It enables payments on-the-go from our customers’ smartphone and makes the products and services we offer even more appealing. As leading provider of digital mobility services, Mercedes pay is a fundamental component of Daimler’s mobility and digitalization strategy.


Our vision: the customer of tomorrow can pay for fueling/charging, washing, parking, workshop services and many others with our self-designed e-wallet.


The project


The mission of the team is to create a cloud based middleware that connects our core paying platform ‘Mercedes Pay’ with various service applications used by our customers and clients. We want to grow our microservice architecture and continuously expand services, features and paying methods. Our ePayment system is deployed worldwide, used by millions of customers and connects several platforms from various functional domains.


Your role


You will play a key role in ensuring fast and reliable delivery of our core transaction systems and their integration layers. You will contribute clean and secure code to be deployed in predominantly virtualized environments and containers.



  • You work in close collaboration (pair programming, coding dojos, etc.) with other team members and teams dispersed across Europe to understand requirements and incorporate them into ‘Mercedes pay’

  • Developing and maintaining an easy testable and rapidly deployable system along the entire integration and testing pipeline by using TDD, BDD, DDD, CI/CD

  • You contribute your leadership strength and experience to build up a new developer team from scratch and frequently on-board new colleagues

  • As the senior you lead and drive tasks and deliverables pro-actively and show self-confident to inspire your co-workers


 As skills and requirements you have:



  • Successfully completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar qualification

  • Experience in developing software for web services in a cloud environment and work experience with current CI/CD management tools

  • Know-how to design a system following the Behavior/Domain-Driven Design approach to develop a growing microservice landscape

  • A proven track record of object-oriented design, architecture and development

  • Good working knowledge of agile approaches, e.g. Scrum, XP, Kanban, etc.

  • Open minded (pioneer mindset) to learn new technologies and frameworks

  • Clean Code and SOLID principles


Your work environment


You will be based at our brand new and unique office in the heart of Berlin. The building offers spacious offices and meeting rooms and excellent connectivity to public transport.


The team


As a self-organized and agile team we work collaboratively to solve complex problems outside of the car. We are an international team of experts which is just about to be built up. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and the eagerness to build services that make daily mobility easier and hazzle-free.


The recruitment process


When you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.


If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.


The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Stuttgart, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and a hiring manager. Usually there will be a small hands-on code challenge.

item.title: System Operations Engineer / Systemadministrator (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Develop the future of journalism with us!


We are CeleraOne: A team of highly motivated software developers, architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from machine learning, routing algorithms and signal processing to compiler technology and theoretical mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve the technology behind CeleraOne’s paywalls, real-time analytics and machine learning models to support newspaper publishers in Europe like Axel Springer or NZZ Mediengruppe.


About the Job

  • Responsible for incident, problem, and change management

  • Participation in 24/7 standby service

  • Deployment and monitoring of the CeleraOne software stack

Who we’re looking for



  • At least two years experience with production systems running Linux

  • Experience with common internet protocols

  • Strong knowledge of configuring, operating and debugging web servers and databases

  • Experience with automation and/or configuration management tools like Ansible, Salt, Puppet or Chef

  • Experience with installation and usage of monitoring tools (elastic stack, Icinga/Nagios, Ganglia)

  • Knowledge of NoSQL databases like MongoDB, Redis

Why join us?

Ever dreamed of disrupting an entire industry?


Join ARGO and change the way companies participate in international trade!


Have you ever wondered how Western companies sell goods to countries such as China or Tanzania for hundred thousands of Euros without fear of never being paid? We help them do it!


ARGO is building a new way to take the risk of non-payment out of international trade transactions, helping companies paying when its best for them. We make global transactions as easy as PayPal made it for consumers to buy in the dangerous world wide web.


We have just started on our big vision! We are backed by one of the best European VCs, we have a great complimentary management team and are right in the middle of building our first product.


But now it's time for us to get help. We are looking for experienced Ruby on Rails champions that share our vision of creating a big disruption and want to build something exciting and fresh from the ground up!


As a core member of our backend team, you will help to build...



  • our API-centric Ruby on Rails application

  • attached services that help us create the best experience for our customers

  • a broad test coverage to ensure availability


Both in Berlin as well as in a remote position, we offer you...



  • a small team of super smart, experienced and driven people that believe in changing things for the better

  • an informal working atmosphere based on direct communication and feedback with no bureaucracy or unnecessary disturbance: we believe in Slack, limited meetings and fast honest talk

  • direct influence on anything you build: We know what we want to do, but if you know a better solution, we will go your way!

  • an environment to grow: learn from your team, help others around you getting better every day, visit conferences, get and give feedback regularly and understand more than just the technical side of our business

  • lots of additional perks such as awesome team events, regular team lunches and dinners, free of choice hardware,...


We hope to find in you...



  • experience in Ruby on Rails development proven by contribution to at least one or two projects

  • a passionate developer that loves to code

  • a team player that can talk code and English

  • sufficient Ruby, Ruby on Rails and test-driven development skills 


 We are super excited to hear from you!

item.title: Software Developer (m/w) für Senacor Digital Coders Berlin at Senacor Technologies AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Senacor Digital Coders Berlin


Digital Coders Berlin ist eine neue Software-Entwicklungseinheit der Senacor Technologies AG, die von der Erprobung neuer Technologien, über Prototypenbau bis zur Umsetzung und den Anwendungsbetrieb digitale Softwareprodukte konzipiert und für unsere Kunden liefert.
Wir arbeiten in Berlins Mitte in agilen Teams mit neuen Technologien, sehr guter Arbeitsumgebung und passendem Equipment. Dabei sind wir digital, arbeiten mit Passion, sind innovativ und mutig, liefern immer exzellent und schätzen die Zusammenarbeit im Team.
Unsere Lösungen sind anspruchsvoll und zeichnen sich durch moderne Technologien / Konzepte wie Simplicity, Reactive Architectures, Vertical Scaling, Polyglot Persistence, Zero-Downtime, Agile/Lean Development, Continuous Delivery, DevOps, Cross-Functional Teams und Design Thinking aus.


Senacor wurde 1999 gegründet, erwartet 2017 über 120 Mio. Umsatz, hat über 400 Mitarbeiter sowie jährlich 20% Wachstum und ist für 30 der größten Unternehmen in Deutschland und Österreich – vor allem DAX und Marktführer – tätig. 


Was wir suchen


Du bist (Lead/ Senior) Software-Entwickler, der im Full-Stack mit modernen Java- und Script-Technologien unterwegs ist. Hierbei interessieren dich sowohl Web- und App-Frontends, Business-Logik und Backends, Datenbanken (sql, no-sql, analytics), Integration und DevOps. Gerne kannst du dich auch auf eines der Themen fokussieren.


Was wir bieten



  • Du bist Teil einer jungen, stark wachsenden Mannschaft, die sich gerade neu aufbaut und spannende Projekte bearbeitet

  • Wir entwickeln Softwareprodukte für große Kunden, aus denen echte digitale Produktivsysteme entstehen

  • Von der Architekturkonzeption über Prototypen bis zur Marktreife mit Weiterentwicklung kannst du in unterschiedliche Zyklen dabei sein

  • Als Digital Coder steht dir das Netzwerk der Senacor Community mit 400 Experten zur Verfügung - von Tech-Gurus bis hin zu Fachexperten und Strategen in ganz Deutschland


Was wir erwarten



  • Die Fähigkeit, sowohl quer zu denken und vieles auszuprobieren als auch komplexe Anwendungen zu bauen

  • Spaß und Passion im Team und das Bestreben, immer erfolgreich zu liefern

  • Pioniergeist und Freude am Ausprobieren neuer, aber praktikabler Technologien für den Projekteinsatz

  • Selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise in einem dynamischen Projektumfeld

  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

item.title: Data Engineer (m/w) at S-Kreditpartner GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
S-Kreditpartner - unser Name ist Programm. Und der macht auf den ersten Blick deutlich: Wir gehören zur Familie der Sparkassen. Als spezialisierter Verbund­partner bündeln wir die Aktivitäten für die Auto- und Konsumenten­finanzierung. Gemeinsam mit unseren Vertriebs­partnern wollen wir die Position der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe in diesen Geschäftsfeldern stärken.


Informationstechnologie ist eine wesentliche Voraussetzung unseres Erfolges. Durchgängig digitalisierte Prozesse sind Schlüssel zu individualisierten Angeboten, intelligenter Beratung, neuen Vertriebskanälen, schnellen Entscheidungen sowie höherer Effizienz und Transparenz unseres Geschäfts.


Um die Zukunft des Bankings 2.0 gemeinsam zu gestalten, unsere starke Position zu festigen und weiter auszubauen, brauchen wir starke Experten mit dem digitalen Mindset in unserem Team - dafür suchen wir Sie zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als


Data Engineer (m/w)


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Sie projektieren und implementieren datengetriebene Anwendungen (analytische Plattform, Data Lake, Big Data Analytics) im Bereich Auto- und Konsumenten­finanzierung

  • Sie konzipieren die Architektur von der analytischen Plattform und ihren verschiedenen Komponenten, wie Data Ingestion und Data Transformation, Data Repositories, Analytical Execution & Processing, Self-Service BI, Reporting & Datenvisualisierung

  • Sie übernehmen die Auswahl, das Setup und die Konfiguration von geeigneten Open Source- und kommerziellen Systemen & Tools, implementieren und integrieren die Komponenten der analytischen Plattform, realisieren Schnittstellen zu den Quellsystemen und automatisieren Prozesse zur Datenübernahme

  • Sie haben die Fähigkeit sich in die fachlichen Anforderungen und Kundenziele zu versetzen, können auf dieser Basis tragfähige technische Lösungen entwickeln und können diese Anforderungen der Anwender in die Systeme integrieren

  • Sie betreuen und optimieren die datengetriebene Anwendungslandschaft und entwickeln diese weiter


Ihr Profil:



  • Sie verfügen über einen Hochschulabschluss in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung und greifen auf mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer (m/w) bzw. Softwareentwickler (m/w) zurück

  • Sie haben analytische Plattformen in Unternehmen eingeführt und im produktiven Einsatz betreut und bringen fundierte Hands-on-Erfahrungen mit Software­techno­logien wie MapReduce, Hadoop, AWS Redshift, SQL und NoSQL Datenbanken (bspw. MongoDB, Cassandra), Stream Processing (bspw. Spark, Flink, Storm, Kafka), Self-Service BI und Visualisierungstools (bspw. Tableau) mit

  • Sie sind sicher im Umgang mit Programmiersprachen (Python, R, Java, C++, Ruby, JavaScript etc.) und beherrschen mindestens eine davon sehr gut

  • Sie haben praktische Erfahrungen mit Scrum und Kanban und idealerweise auch Domänenkenntnisse im Bereich Bank/Financial Services oder CRM

  • Sie verfügen über ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, eine rasche Auffassungsgabe, kommunikative Fähigkeiten und eine eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise


Wir bieten Ihnen:


Eine interessante, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit einem hohen Maß an Selbstverantwortung und großem Gestaltungsspielraum. Sie erhalten eine attraktive Vergütung, Weiterbildungsangebote und verschiedene Sozialleistungen.


Interessiert?


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagefähige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.


S-Kreditpartner GmbH Postfach 11 05 48
10835 Berlin karriere@s-kreditpartner.de

item.title: Technischer Projektmanager (m/w) at S-Kreditpartner GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
S-Kreditpartner - unser Name ist Programm. Und der macht auf den ersten Blick deutlich: Wir gehören zur Familie der Sparkassen. Als spezialisierter Verbund­partner bündeln wir die Aktivitäten für die Auto- und Konsumenten­finanzierung. Gemeinsam mit unseren Vertriebs­partnern wollen wir die Position der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe in diesen Geschäftsfeldern stärken.


Informationstechnologie ist eine wesentliche Voraussetzung unseres Erfolges. Durchgängig digitalisierte Prozesse sind Schlüssel zu individualisierten Angeboten, intelligenter Beratung, neuen Vertriebskanälen, schnellen Entscheidungen sowie höherer Effizienz und Transparenz unseres Geschäfts.


Um die Zukunft des Bankings 2.0 gemeinsam zu gestalten, unsere starke Position zu festigen und weiter auszubauen, brauchen wir starke Experten mit dem digitalen Mindset in unserem Team - dafür suchen wir Sie zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als



Technischer Projektmanager (m/w)


für digitales Banking



Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Sie erstellen die Projektplanung und verantworten die Umsetzung der Projekte sowie die Zeit- und Budgetplanung

  • Sie steuern und koordinieren IT-Projekte, in denen wir die Anwendungslandschaft zur Abbildung unserer Geschäftsprozesse kontinuierlich weiterentwickeln, und interne und externe Entwickler-Teams während der Umsetzung und dem Go-Live

  • Sie treiben die in Ihrer Verantwortung liegenden Produkte visionär voran, optimieren Entwicklungsprozesse, steuern externe Dienstleister und stehen für sie als Ansprechpartner (m/w) auf Augenhöhe zur Verfügung

  • Sie sind das Bindeglied zwischen Entwicklerteams und internen Stakeholdern und arbeiten eng mit unserem Produktteam im Rahmen der Anforderungsdefinition und Produktkonzeption zusammen


Ihr Profil:



  • Sie verfügen über einen Hochschulabschluss in der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung oder haben eine IT-nahe Ausbildung sowie mehrjährige Berufserfahrung z. B. als technischer Projektmanager (m/w), Produktmanager (m/w) oder Product Owner (m/w)

  • Sie bringen Erfahrungen in der Leitung von Softwareentwicklungsprojekten mit und möchten auch weiterhin den Bezug zur Entwicklung behalten

  • Sie sind mit klassischen und agilen Projektmethoden (Scrum, Kanban) vertraut und haben diese bereits in Unternehmen eingeführt und/oder angewendet

  • Sie haben idealerweise Branchenkenntnisse im Bereich Banken/Finanzdienstleistungen und kennen sich mit Bank-Kunden-Prozessen, Standards, Rechtsnormen und regulatorischen Rahmenbedingungen aus

  • Sie sind erfahren in der Analyse und Modellierung von Geschäftsprozessen, sind strukturiert in Ihrer Arbeitsweise und bringen ein sicheres Auftreten und starke kommunikative Kompetenzen mit


Wir bieten Ihnen:


Eine interessante, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit einem hohen Maß an Selbstverantwortung und großem Gestaltungsspielraum. Sie erhalten eine attraktive Vergütung, Weiterbildungsangebote und verschiedene Sozialleistungen.


Interessiert?


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagefähige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.




S-Kreditpartner GmbH

10835 Berlin

item.title: Senior Software Engineer for Application Support in Healthcare at Visage Imaging GmH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Visage Imaging GmbH is based in Berlin, Germany and is where the Product Development and Global Customer Service teams are based. At the European headquarters, Visage Imaging GmbH is looking for Applications Engineers.  The Visage Imaging Applications Engineer will be a part of the Global Customer Service team, and will be responsible for installing and performing initial configuration of Visage 7 software, implementing solutions at customer sites, as well as providing IT training and ongoing customer support to healthcare institutions around the world.


The Applications Engineer shall:



  • Have Microsoft Windows Server, Microsoft SQL Server, OpenSuSE Linux, and networking skills sufficient to install and support Visage Imaging products, both remotely and at customer facilities.

  • Have understanding of the overall healthcare IT standards relevant to each project, specifically but not limited to IHE, DICOM, HL7 and HIPAA.

  • Present technical status updates to the Project Team.

  • Be responsible for installation and configuration of Visage Imaging products, both remotely and at customer facilities.

  • Configure DICOM and HL7 interfaces, and integrations with 3rd Party Products.

  • Train, both remotely and at customer facilities, customers’ support resources on the use and support of Visage Imaging products.


Experience Required


5+ years healthcare informatics, or related experience.  Less experience will be considered for the right candidate.


Degree in a technical or scientific subject or equivalent qualification.


Experience in one or more of the following areas: Administration Linux, Windows Server, SQL Server, networks, DICOM / HL7, medical imaging, software development, scripting languages (perl, php, bash, …).


Good command of the English language, both written and verbal. German language is desired. Other languages are a plus.


Expected Travel


0-25%


Employment Type and Location


Full-time or part-time, at our Berlin headquarters.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at Feingold Technologies GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
For our rapidly growing R&D Center in Berlin Mitte we are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f).


Area of responsibility


The Senior DevOps Engineer will be part of a team that is responsible for our production, staging and development environments.


Tasks and responsibilities



  • Maintain Jenkins CI projects

  • Maintain Ansible configuration management automation for deployment

  • Coordinate efforts with development and management

  • Estimation of capacity requirements and scaling to meet them        

  • Maintain health monitoring systems and integration with Datadog or Beats/Elasticsearch

  • Set up and maintain production, staging and development stacks using Amazon VPCs

  • Database operations with Elasticsearch, MongoDB and others, including import and export of data, backups, migration and scaling          

  • Technical documentation of operational details and procedures


Requirements



  • At least 2 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer                      

  • Fluent in English

  • Autodidact, fast learner, proactive attitude, work autonomously, ability to take full ownership on tasks and challenges

  • High motivation and willingness to learn  

  • Eligibility to work in Germany would be advantageous


Knowledge and Experience



  • Knowledge and experience of AWS (EC2, VPC, ELB, S3, ElastiCache etc.)

  • Strong knowledge of Ansible is preferred, but knowledge of Chef and/or Puppet is acceptable

  • Significant experience in all of the following: Cloud architecture, Networking, Open VPN, Linux servers, script writing, the building and deployment of automation tools, DB management, Elasticsearch cluster maintenance, and MongoDB

  • Familiarity with Java 8, Spring MVC, JUnit, Maven, and load testing  

  • Familiarity with Redis and RabbitMQ

  • Experience with Packer and other Hashicorp tools    

  • Understanding of Networking Fundamentals, eg. subnets, TCP, UDP, ports etc.

  • Experience with Linux/Docker containers deployment using Kebernetes

  • Experience working with Git, Jenkins, Linux, and Bash scripting                              

  • Knowledge of Python and/or Ruby

  • Good understanding of the challenges of Scaling and experience devising solutions for these challenges

  • Experience with automated deployment in large scale production environment

  • Knowledge of security policies implementation best practices and familiarity with Big Data and Machine Learning would both be very advantageous.

item.title: Praktikant / Werkstudent (m/w) in der Full-Stack Entwicklung at Ventoro Fenster & Türen GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Praktikanten / Werkstudenten (m/w) in der Full-Stack Entwicklung für unser Berliner Büro, der mit uns den Erfolg von Ventoro mitgestalten möchte.

ÜBER VENTORO


Wir bei Ventoro digitalisieren den Fenstermarkt! Unseren Kunden bieten wir beim Fensterkauf ein Rundum-sorglos-Paket inklusive Einbau der Fenster zum Festpreis – mittlerweile in jeder Region Deutschlands. Wir entwickeln Technologielösungen (u. a. APIs, Web-Apps, iOS-Apps), die die Branche vor uns noch nie gesehen hat. Dafür suchen wir talentierte Full-Stack-Entwicklerinnen und -Entwickler mit Pioniergeist. Unser CEO ist selber Programmierer und leitet das Team. Bei der Entwicklung setzen wir auf State-of-the-Art-Technologien und –Prozesse (z.B. Scrum, Testautomatisierung, Continuous Integration, Cloud Infrastruktur).




Deine Aufgaben



  • Du unterstützt das Team bei der Entwicklung von neuen Systemen, welche von unseren Mitarbeitern, Kunden, Monteuren und Lieferanten genutzt werden.

  • Du konzipierst und entwickelst Features im Front- und Backend unserer Systeme.

  • Du entwickelst eigene Ideen und Lösungsansätze.

  • Du arbeitest in einem motivierten Arbeitsumfeld nach dem Scrum-Prinzip.

  • Du übernimmst Verantwortung in unserem wachsenden Team.




Dein Profil



  • Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von PHP-Anwendungen.

  • Erfahrung mit einem bekannten PHP-Framework wäre ein Plus (z.B. Laravel, Codeigniter).

  • Du kennst Dich mit Datenbanken aus (insbesondere SQL).

  • Erfahrung mit JavaScript wäre ein Plus.

  • Du schreibst sauberen, wartbaren und testbaren Code.

  • Du informierst Dich über neue Entwicklungen und Tools.

  • Du bist ein/-e Teamplayer/-in.

  • Du sprichst fließend Deutsch oder Englisch.

  • Du arbeitest selbstständig und qualitätsbewusst.




Wir bieten



  • Möglichkeit zum Festeinstieg und Aufstiegschancen, da das Team gerade aufgebaut wird.

  • Viel Platz für eigene Ideen und Möglichkeiten, Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

  • Spannende Projekte, bei denen Du von Anfang an dabei bist.

  • Flache Hierarchien, Spaß und Teamzusammenhalt.

  • Ein schönes Büro in Berlin-Mitte mit Klimaanlage.

  • Einen ruhigen Arbeitsplatz, der konzentriertes Arbeiten ermöglicht.

  • Kostenlose Snacks und Getränke im Büro.

  • Regelmäßige Teamevents (Lasertag, LAN-Partys, Catering, Teamlunch etc.).




Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?


Dann schicke uns Deine Expressbewerbung – wir melden uns bei Dir!


Charlotte, Anna und Bianca vom Ventoro-HR-Team
www.ventoro.de

item.title: Data Engineer (m/f) at crealytics GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
To strengthen our international team in Berlin, we are offering a full-time position as


                                   Data Engineer (m/f)


crealytics is a fast-growing technology company whose data-driven platform enables global e-commerce retailers to drive performance in product advertising and paid search. Our innovative products support our clients by automating their workflow and generating valuable intelligence. crealytics is generating € 1.7 billion in annual client revenue for top internet retailers such as Footlocker, ASOS, and Harrods, enabled by 170 employees in our Berlin, London, Passau, and New York City offices.


We are always looking for people interested in working with industry leading technologies, and are willing to play a big part in small, agile teams.


// Your responsibilities



  • As Data Engineer, you will be responsible for fast, accurate, robust and scalable data-processing in our company

  • You develop and deploy new features in an agile, test-driven environment in tandem with our team of data engineers, data scientists, software developers, and operations managers

  • You build fault tolerant, self-healing, adaptive, and highly accurate data computational pipelines

  • You optimize data transfer processes at the code, memory and architecture level

  • You develop in an environment of micro-services and event-based architecture


// Your profile



  • You have either a bachelor's degree with 3+ years of work experience or a master’s degree and 2+ year of work experience

  • You have prior experience with a high level programming language like Ruby, Scala or Go

  • You have the ability to quickly understand business requirements and transform them into data models

  • You are experienced with Big Data related technologies like HDFS, Hive, Pig and Spark

  • You have an aptitude to independently learn new technologies and you are passionate about data

  • Prior experience with online marketing is a plus, e.g. Google AdWords, BingAds, Social Media Advertising or Universal Analytics


// How we work



  • We trust in data — data drive our business decisions and product development roadmap

  • Our employees are our best investment — develop yourself through knowledge sharing sessions, workshops, and personalised training

  • We keep innovating — stay close to users, challenge the status quo, dedicate 20% of your work time to new ideas

  • We get great work done — we enjoy working face-to-face, but value results over office presence

  • Our team is diverse — we unite smart and passionate people from over 30 nationalities

  • Relocation is simplified — paid accommodation, as well as experienced “relocation buddies,” guide you through your visa application


If you would like to become part of our success story and think you would make a great addition to our team, Ann-Marie Hennemuth will gladly receive your application with the subject line “Data Engineer (m/f) SO” in English at talents@crealytics.com. Please make sure to include your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.


www.crealytics.com

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at SatoshiPay Germany UG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
TL;DR



  • React, Redux, Babel, ES2016+, SASS

  • Full-time preferred

  • Immediately

  • Berlin, Germany


What you will be doing



  • Design, develop, improve and maintain our client applications

  • Create well-tested and scalable client-side code

  • Design and implement client-to-server protocols (using sockets and REST)

  • Make design decisions as one of the two key engineers of our team

  • Train junior front end developers

item.title: Data Analyst (m/f) at komoot (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
item.description:
Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help users all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, and we empower everybody to explore more of the great outdoors. To help us be even better at what we do, we’re looking for a data analyst to help us to drive product decisions and strategy. We believe that data-driven decision making is key to our success and your skills and curiosity will play a crucial role in building the future of outdoor experiences.


Your key responsibilities



  • Turn events and data into actionable insights

  • Develop analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy

  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and continuous reports

  • Communicate and present findings to different audiences

  • Working closely with teams throughout the company, solving very diverse data challenges

  • Be an evangelist of data-driven decision-making


Why you will love it



  • You’ll be a key player in making product development, marketing and business decisions

  • You’ll work with a modern and powerful analytics platform based on AWS Kinesis and Redshift

  • You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers

  • You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love

  • We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, our headquarters in Potsdam or anywhere else that lies in any time zone between UTC-1 and UTC+3

  • Every day, your work will inspire people to discover more of the great outdoors

  • You’ll join us for team gatherings in locations like Mallorca or the Bavarian Alps several times a year


You will be successful in this position if you



  • Have a burning desire to transform data into actionable insights

  • Have 3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data

  • Have proven skills in programming (e.g. in python), SQL and Pandas/R

  • Have strong communication skills

  • Have fundamental statistical skills

  • Are keen to keep in touch with the latest advances in your area

  • Have a hands-on attitude and are highly self-driven


Sounds like you?


Then send us the following:



  • Your CV

  • A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komoot

  • Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)

  • Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account, or your OpenStreetMap profile if you have one

  • You’ll get bonus points for: Doing something creative with komoot (we love it when people go the extra mile)

item.title: Software Developer (fullstack) m/f at MSA Technologies & Enterprise Services GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
In order to further expand our team in Berlin, we are seeking a


Software Developer (fullstack) m/f


A team comprising international specialists works on the safety technologies of tomorrow in our Research & Development department in Berlin – taking an agile and passionate approach and in close collaboration with developers around the globe.


Your task in our team


In your role as Software Developer, you will give our cloud-based software solutions their character and you implement a high-performance architecture that provides access to safety data for our clients – in real time. These are some of your most important responsibilities:



  • Planning: You will prepare requirements and specifications for our platform hosted on AWS while working together with colleagues from Marketing.

  • Developing: You will implement sophisticated cloud-based web applications with the help of tools like JIRA, Confluence or Bamboo.

  • Testing: In close collaboration with our test engineers, you will automate software tests and thereby support our continuous release process.

  • Releasing: Together with colleagues from our DevOps team, you will plan and execute your releases.

  • Optimising: You will also draw on your expertise to continually improve existing tools and processes.


Your profile: Expertise meets experience


We are looking for people who would like to further develop their existing web expertise in challenging projects. Your four facets:



  • Academic: You have successfully completed a degree in computer science or a comparable field.

  • Practitioner: You can look back on at least three years of professional experience in product development.

  • Specialist: Extensive knowledge of web technologies (JS, HTML, CSS, Node.js) is a must, while experience with Angular JS, AWS, agile projects and test-driven development is a plus.

  • Team player: You enjoy working with people across various disciplines – including in an international setting thanks to your fluent English skills.

item.title: DevOps Engineer / Cloud Specialist (m/w) (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Jenkins) at BILD GmbH & Co. KG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Deine Aufgaben bei uns



  • Automatisierung von Prozessen hinsichtlich Continuous Integration und Continuous Delivery

  • Know-How-Transfer zwischen Betrieb und Entwicklung

  • Unterstützung der Entwickler bei betriebsnahen Themen

  • Bereitstellung und Betreuung unserer Cloud- und OnPremise Infrastruktur

  • Ständige System- und Prozessoptimierung 

  • Beratung und Weiterentwicklung hochverfügbarerAnwendungen in neuen und bestehenden Projekten

  • Evaluation und Beratung im Bereich Technologiewahl und Planung von Änderungen der Systemlandschaft

  • Analyse und Behebung von Störungen im Server- und Applikationsbereich


Das bringst Du mit



  • Begeisterung für innovative Technologien und Interesse an den neusten technologischen Trends und Entwicklungen

  • Tiefgehenden Erfahrungen im Betrieb datenbankbasierter Web-Portale und breites Wissen zu Netzwerk- und Softwarearchitekturen

  • In folgenden Bereichen bst Du topfit: Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Chef, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Tomcat, Varnish, AWS, Azure oder GCP

  • Programmierkenntnisse idealerweise in den Sprachen Java, Shell, JavaScript, Ruby

  • Lösungsorientiertes Arbeiten

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse von Content Management Systemen sind von Vorteil

  • Sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten und Durchsetzungsvermögen

  • Studium im Bereich Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung

  • Du denkst nicht nur gründlich nach, sondern vor allem auch quer und verlässt gern ausgetretene Pfade um neue Wege zu gehen


Unser Angebot


Wir geben unseren Entwicklern den Freiraum, selbstverantwortlich an der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte mit zu arbeiten und so Produktentscheidungen aktiv beeinflussen zu können.


Wir investieren in unsere Mitarbeiter mit Schulungen und Trainings und profitieren dabei von unseren Partnerschaften mit Microsoft, Amazon und Apple. Darüber hinaus entsenden wir Kollegen gerne zu internationalen Konferenzen, um verschiedenste Themen und Fachbereiche intern abdecken zu können. (Google I/O, AWS Summits, Apple WWDC, etc.)


Ein reiches Seminarangebot im Bereich der Softskills, spannende Konzernaktivitäten, betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Unterstützung für Familien stehen den Mitarbeitern parallel zur Verfügung.


Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern eine angemessene Bezahlung, ein jährliches Bonussystem und ein attraktives Aktienbeteiligungsprogramm. Dazu erhalten die Angestellten neben Getränken und Obst, freie Mittagskost in einer der besten Kantinen der Stadt.


Die Arbeitsplätze sind hochmodern und werden mit hochwertiger Apple Hardware ausgestattet.


Wer Lust auf ein spannendes Projekt, mit der Sicherheit eines Großkonzernes im Rücken, anständiger Bezahlung und guten Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten im Herzen von Berlin hat, ist herzlich eingeladen sich zu bewerben.

item.title: Software Tester, QA engineer (f/m) at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Are you keen to push renewable energies further?


Are you passionate about quality tested software?


Are you a team player and keen getting things to work?


Then this job is for you


As a professional software tester and QA engineer at Younicos you will develop and execute test specifications and most appropriate test strategies and improve our test automation on unit, component and system integration level. You look at technology and business facing tests that support the team and critique the product in all functional and non-functional aspects. Within your focus is also improvement of our configuration management, the build and deployment process as well as application lifecycle management.


To reach the goals in terms of high product quality and customer satisfaction you work together with the developers as part of an agile team (Scrum) and cooperate with our requirements and system engineering. Together with the teams and the customer you will specify user acceptance and factory acceptance test specifications. You will introduce new tools, if required, to perform and monitor tests that will help you and the team to raise the quality of the products. With your knowledge, approach and open feedback you will continually improve the quality policies within the development teams.


With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.


Your profile



  • Significant expertise in software testing in agile teams

  • Profound knowledge of testing tools

  • Experience with BDD/TDD, test automation and CI (Jenkins)

  • Some expertise in Python and knowledge of C++, Java and PHP

  • Excellent analytic and conceptual skills

  • A source of constant ideas for improvement

  • A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea win

  • Knowledge of SW development tooling infrastructure and system administration

  • Open to new technologies

  • A will to continually improve your skills

  • Exceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracy

  • Basic German is a plus


Our offer



  • The opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy shares

  • Motivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things done

  • Open discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your work

  • Participation on trainings, meetings, conferences, etc.

  • Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

It’s an enterprise-grade application which connects our own services to third party platforms like Salesforce. The code base is written in Python 3 and our entire stack is up to date. Our main data store is PostgreSQL. Our business is constantly growing and changing. New feature requests or requirement changes may emerge every day. As a result we build software that is highly maintainable to satisfy those needs.

Your job will be to work in small teams on independent projects alongside your non technical colleagues. You will analyze our business needs and implement solutions while maintaining a high quality standard and developing at startup speed. You will have the freedom to use any tools and resources to achieve your goals. Our team of more than ten experienced engineers will support you to reach your full potential.

  • fluent in English (German is a plus)

item.title: Do you want to BOOST.spirit your career? at think-cell (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At think-cell expect a wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks.


think-cell is looking for smart, creative C++ developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


Skills & Requirements


Do you believe in beauty when it comes to programming? Do you have a vivid interest in elegant algorithms? Are you fluent in C++? If so, we would like to meet you.

item.title: Senior Operations Engineer / DevOps (m/f) at crealytics GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
To strengthen our international team in Berlin, we are offering a full-time position as


Senior Operations Engineer / DevOps (m/f)


crealytics is a fast-growing technology company whose data-driven platform enables global e-commerce retailers to drive performance in product advertising and paid search. Our innovative products support our clients by automating their workflow and generating valuable intelligence. crealytics is generating € 1.7 billion in annual client revenue for top internet retailers such as Footlocker, ASOS, and Harrods, enabled by 170 employees in our Berlin, London, Passau, and New York City offices.


We are always looking for people interested in working with industry leading technologies, and are willing to play a big part in small, agile teams.



// Your responsibilities




  • As Senior Operations Engineer / DevOps, you will manage the high availability and scalability of crealytics’ platform, spanning Mesos, On-Premise, GCP, AWS, and more

  • You have joint responsibility for the 24/7/365 operations of our SaaS platform and will be significantly involved in the infrastructure, architecture and choice of tools and technologies used

  • You build & maintain tools to automate the provisioning, deployment and monitoring of crealytics’ infrastructure

  • You will help planning and implementing expanding and/or migration into new data center locations




// Your profile




  • You have 3+ years of experience in a similar role in a relevant software or internet service industry with a service operational background supporting high availability environments

  • You have profound knowledge of Linux system administration and networking - routing, tunneling, firewalling

  • You have good scripting & programming skills; actual development experience is a big plus

  • You have strong analytical and critical thinking skills

  • You have a very good understanding of high availability, load balancing, service discovery concepts and available technologies

  • Operating large-scale highly available relational databases is a plus

  • You are familiar with provisioning tools; hands-on experience with Saltstack is a plus




// What we offer




  • We trust in data — data drive our business decisions and product development roadmap

  • Our employees are our best investment — develop yourself through knowledge sharing sessions, workshops, and personalised training

  • We keep innovating — stay close to users, challenge the status quo, dedicate 20% of your work time to new ideas

  • We get great work done — we enjoy working face-to-face, but value results over office presence

  • Our team is diverse — we unite smart and passionate people from over 30 nationalities

  • Relocation is simplified — paid accommodation, as well as experienced “relocation buddies,” guide you through your visa application




Join our team and become part of our success story!


Ann-Marie Hennemuth will gladly receive your application with the subject line “Operations Engineer / Dev Ops (m/f) LI” in English at talents@crealytics.com.


Please make sure to include your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.



www.crealytics.com

item.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer (m/f) at Seven Senders GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Are you bored of developing the test automation of the next random e-commerce startup?


Are you tired of taking on another QA’s work?


Instead, you want to work on something fresh and new? Come and work with us.



THE DEAL


At 7S you will influence the test automation suite of our product substantially. You implement your own ideas and process to test automate our products. If you are not satisfied playing a minor role in an average Berlin business, then this is the job you have been waiting for.



WHO WE ARE


We are Seven Senders. Our product revolutionizes cross-border e-commerce by enabling an optimal customer experience after checkout. We engage with thousands of customers across Europe. So far, no clear code structure and best practices has been put in place for our test automation suite. Your role is to bring those topic up to date and make them as efficient as possible.



YOUR ROLE


Develop and maintain a robust scalable test automation framework for a B2B web-application. Test complex backend logic as well as ReactJS based single-page front-end applications. Test web and mobile views.


Some of the technologies we are using:



  • Amazon web services (S3, CloudFront, etc.)

  • PHP, MySQL, Symfony

  • Java, MongoDB, Spring.

  • ReactJS, Angular, Bootstrap, jQuery


For testing automation we use Jenkins, Selenium, Groovy, TestNG.



WHAT WE EXPECT


Work responsibility



  • Develop a robust scalable test automation framework for a B2B web-application

  • Maintain our existing testing infrastructure

  • Manage the QA resources across multiple products


Requirements



  • Good communication skills, spoken and written English

  • Experience with Selenium

  • Solid knowledge of Java or Groovy for test automation development

  • Experience with either Selenium Grid or cloud services like BrowserStack or SauceLabs

  • Knowledge in TestNG and Jenkins

  • Git

  • A deep knowledge of the best practices regarding test automation



WHAT WE OFFER



  • You will create a test automation suite to track millions of parcels across Europe

  • A great product and a highly motivated team that wants to push boundaries

  • Rapidly growing team with long-term prospects

  • A lively startup atmosphere

  • Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of Berlin

  • Attractive and performance-based salary



We look forward to getting to know you and to understand your ideas and plans in a personal meeting.


We need you on board soon. Therefore, please do only apply if you do already possess a working permit for the European Union. Send your email application to join@sevensenders.com.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Frontend (m/f) at Seven Senders GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Are you bored of developing the frontend of the next random e-commerce startup?


Are you tired of taking on another developer’s work?


Instead, you want to work on something fresh and new? Come and work with us.


THE DEAL


At 7S you will influence the frontend development of our product substantially. You implement your own ideas and brand our product with your individual style. If you are not satisfied playing a minor role in an average Berlin business, then this is the job you have been waiting for.


WHO WE ARE


We are Seven Senders. Our product revolutionizes cross-border e-commerce by enabling an optimal customer experience after checkout. We engage with thousands of customers across Europe. So far, our main focus was on backend development. Now, we are looking for someone to lead our frontend development and to turn our data into a beautiful product.


YOUR ROLE


We know what our customers want: highly responsive and smooth interfaces. Our core backend tech stack is PHP 7 (Symfony3), on the frontend we are looking at React.js, Redux, ES6, Webpack, Node/npm, SCSS. Does our IT stack sound familiar to you? Then come on board and exploit your complementary skillset to take on the full responsibility of our product’s frontend. A product that tracks hundred thousands of shipments across Europe.


WHAT WE EXPECT


We look for an experienced developer who wants to join the team and who is able to focus on getting things done. Are you willing to take responsibility for what you can do best? Here are the skills we require from a person who leads our frontend development:



  • Minimum 3 years of experience with JavaScript, including asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6

  • Minimum 3 years of experience with HTML/CSS/SCSS, including concepts like layout, specificity, animation, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility

  • Very good experience with browser APIs and optimizing front end performance

  • Good knowledge of React.js and the concept of Redux or other state management system is a must have

  • Very good experience with at least one other JS framework (AngularJS, Vue.js, Meteor) is a strong plus

  • Good Experience in testing JavaScript with mocha, Jest, Jasmine or the test framework of your choice

  • Very good experience working with task runner like Grunt, Gulp and Webpack

  • Familiar working with GIT on a daily basis

  • Knowledge and using Functional Programming with JavaScript is a strong plus

  • Knowledge of charting library like D3.js or Chart.js is a string plus

  • You have an interesting open source portfolio

  • Effective oral and written communication skills in English


WHAT WE OFFER



  • You will create a platform to track millions of parcels across Europe

  • A great product and a highly motivated team that wants to push boundaries

  • Rapidly growing team with long-term prospects

  • A lively startup atmosphere

  • Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of Berlin


We look forward to getting to know you and to understand your ideas and plans in a personal meeting.


We need you on board soon. Therefore, please do only apply if you do already possess a working permit for the European Union. Send your email application to join@sevensenders.com.

item.title: PHP Developer (m/f) to support the growth of an E-commerce start-up at Contorion GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Why we are different? - 5 reasons to work in our team:



  • We are open-minded for new technologies and we use them when it makes sense.

  • We are 100% pragmatic. You’ll work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (w/m) für die FinTech Plattform GENOPACE at GENOPACE GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer (w/m) für die FinTech Plattform GENOPACE


VOLL- ODER TEILZEIT
Berlin, Deutschland


GENOPACE ist die Plattform zur Vermittlung von Baufinanzierungen der genossenschaftlichen Finanzgruppe (Volks- und Raiffeisenbanken). GENOPACE ist ein Teil der Hypoport-Gruppe und deshalb sind wir alles, aber keine Bank. Hierarchien waren gestern, heute setzen wir auf Selbstverantwortung und die Motivation eines jeden einzelnen. Eine unserer Stärken ist, dass wir verschiedene neue Ansätze der Arbeitsorganisation ausprobieren. Wir sind Entdecker der Arbeitswelt von morgen, deshalb legen wir auch viel Wert auf ein professionelles Arbeitsumfeld, denn immerhin verantwortet die Hypoport-Gruppe ein Kredit-Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd.€ pro Monat.



Wer du bist:



  • Du bist ein Senior Mitglied eines professionellen und hochqualifizierten Teams, welches ständig anstrebt die besten und smartesten Lösungen für unsere Businessanforderungen zu finden.

  • Du arbeitest Hand in Hand mit deinen Kollegen aus Produkt, Kundenservice und Vertrieb sowie deinen Kunden und hast Lust darauf eine komplexe Domäne mitzugestalten.

  • Du entwirfst, implementierst, testest und wartest neue Features und Finanzproduktintegrationen auf der GENOPACE Plattform.

  • Du verbesserst dich ständig und hilfst deinen Kollegen und deiner Umgebung besser zu werden.

  • Du übernimmst Verantwortung für die Software deines Teams -  auch in Produktion, denn wir machen DevOps und Continuous Deployment.

  • Du denkst unternehmerisch und richtest deine Entscheidungen an wirtschaftlichen Erfordernissen aus.



Was du kannst:



  • Weitgehende Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von serverseitigen Backends mit objekt-orientierten Sprachen (wir nutzen Java mit Spring und Groovy – wir glauben aber, dass du dich auch einarbeiten kannst).

  • Erfahrung im Entwickeln von skalierbaren und verteilten Services.

  • Interesse an Finanzprodukten. Wir arbeiten in einer komplexen Domäne und erwarten, dass jeder beim Lösungsdesign mitdenken kann. Wie eine Baufinanzierung funktioniert bringen wir dir bei.

  • Erfahrung mit zentralen serverseitigen Backend-Technologien wie z.B.: Messaging, HTTP und REST, Webservices, Concurrency, Resilienz und Caching

  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse



Was wir bieten:


Innerhalb der Hypoport-Gruppe wertschätzen wir Vielfalt, daher bieten wir einen Arbeitsplatz frei von Stereotypen. Die Energie unserer Teams wächst mit der Vielfalt an Perspektiven die jeder einzelne mit einbringt. Unsere Kultur fördert ein persönliches Arbeitsumfeld, so wie du es dir vorstellst. Zusammen bauen wir die führenden digitalen Plattformen für Finanzprodukte. Einige der Vorteile, die wir dir bieten:



  • Innovative Arbeitskultur und eine Umgebung in der du Dinge gestalten kannst wie in einem Startup allerdings mit dem Rückhalt eines etablierten Unternehmens.

  • Sehr gute Work-Life Balance mit flexiblen und familienfreundlichen Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office, 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr sowie die Option dir 10 weitere Urlaubstage zu erkaufen.

  • 120 IT-Kollegen und Kolleginnen, in der Hypoport-Gruppe, die dich unterstützen und eine aktive Wissenscommunity gestalten.

  • Einfluss auf den TechStack. Hier kannst du von Anfang an mitbestimmen.

  • Unsere Prinzipien nach denen wir arbeiten: 

    • Wir führen gemeinsam.

    • Wir lernen und entwickeln uns bewusst weiter.

    • Wir arbeiten gemeinsam miteinander.

    • Wir organisieren uns dezentral und autonom.




Wenn du neugierig geworden bist, dann findest du mehr über unsere Kultur auf unserem PnO-Blog. Wenn du mehr über unsere technischen Themen wissen willst, dann besuche doch einfach unseren TechBlog.



Möchtest du mehr erfahren? Dann schick uns doch deine Bewerbung, gerne auch mit deinem GitHub-Account.


Bei Fragen wende dich an


Nadine Lennartz, People & Organisation Partner
Tel. +49 30 420 86 -1925


Hypoport AG | Genopace AG
Klosterstrasse 71, 10179 Berlin

item.title: EMBEDDED ENGINEER (JAVA) IOT / SMARTHOME at Ewyso GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Java Developer to help build the best Embedded (Java) environment, so that we can make smart home as common, easy and accessible as a smartphone. For everyone.

With this you will help us change the definition of “home” for people of any kind around the world. We believe that a great product will shape the future of our living spaces.




Your mission is to build an awesome embedded environment in Java! (greenfield!)


Some of your activities



  • Sculping the future of Ewyso’s embedded devices – from the ground up!!- that power our hardware devices

  • Working directly together with the Product Owner (hardware)

  • Creation of software that runs on a constrained device

  • Building software which runs on the devices in more then 1mio households

  • Empower users to control their Smart Home devices at home


Key Qualifications



  • At least 3 year experience in Java development

  • You understand the core principles of embedded development

  • You have good understanding of Linux

  • You love to share your ideas and know how to communicate them


What makes us different?



  • We believe that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take

  • Responsibility for your role from day one

  • An agile environment you will love

  • Flat hierarchy, awesome culture

  • A pretty cool office in Berlin ‘Mitte’ + a free gym membership

  • Team events such as brunches, workshops, Friday tgif and trainings abroad….

  • Awesome international start-up atmosphere: Work Hard, Party Harder


You think Smart Home is one of the greatest things in the world and you share our passion for that topic?


We would love to get to know you!!
BUT please don’t write us a book…
Generic cover letters are as bad as broken radiator in winter.
A compact description of yourself and your achievements will do! :)


>>>Join and shape the future of our homes together with us!< <<

item.title: Senior PHP Developer (m/w) at Pepper Media Holding GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you love programming? Do you spend your time thinking about how to make things you’ve already made better, or get excited when you are able to implement something completely new where the only limitation is your imagination? item.title: Full-stack Softwareentwickler (m/w) für den Aufbau unserer InsurTech-Plattform at Smart InsurTech GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die börsennotierte HYPOPORT-Gruppe besteht aus einer Familie von in- und ausländischen Tochterunternehmen, gruppiert in die vier voneinander profitierenden Geschäftsbereiche Kreditplattform, Privatkunden, Institutionelle Kunden und Versicherungsplattform. Alle vier Bereiche befassen sich mit dem Vertrieb von Finanzdienstleistungen, ermöglicht oder unterstützt durch unsere Technologie (FinTech).


Für unser agiles Team, welches eine auf dem Markt einzigartige Softwarelösung zur Bestandsverwaltung von Versicherungen entwickelt, suchen wir einen Entwickler aus Leidenschaft.


Welche Aufgaben warten auf dich?



  • Als „Full-stack Developer (m/w)“ gestaltest und entwickelst du unsere Eigenentwicklungen im Bereich der InsurTech-Plattform maßgeblich mit

  • Du gestaltest den Aufbau unserer neuen Versicherungsplattform, die die ganze Branche revolutionieren soll, maßgeblich mit - bringst deine Ideen und dein Know-How jeden Tag.

  • Du bringst uns der Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Versicherungsbranche, z.B. bei der digitalen Provisions- und Dokumentenverarbeitung mithilfe deiner Backend-Lösungen einen Schritt näher.

  • Dabei gehört die technische Integration neuer Software in unsere Versicherungsplattform, insbesondere über Webservices zu deinen spannenden Aufgaben.

  • Bei uns arbeitest du cross-functional, agil und eng im Team zusammen und hast die Möglichkeit eigenverantwortlich in einem professionellen Team mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen unser Produkt maßgeblich mit zu gestalten.

  • Test Driven Development und Clean Code sind wichtige Bestandteile unseres Entwicklungsprozesses.

  • Dabei bist du von Anfang bis Ende dabei, d.h. von der Konzeption über die Implementierung bis hin zum Betrieb der Plattform.


Welche Technologien nutzen wir?



  • Java

  • JavaScript /Angular

  • PL/SQL

  • HTML 5 /CSS 3


Was erwarten wir von dir?



  • Du bringst dich mit Begeisterung, Engagement und Leidenschaft in unser Team ein.

  • Dein Talent als Java Entwickler hast du während deiner ersten beruflichen Erfahrung erfolgreich unter Beweis gestellt.

  • Mit Webservices kennst du dich gut aus.

  • Extrapunkte bringen dir Erfahrungen in der App-Entwicklung.

  • Wenn zudem agile Softwareentwicklung kein Fremdwort für dich ist, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.


Motivierte und fachlich hervorragend ausgebildete Mitarbeiter sind die wichtigste Säule für unseren Erfolg. Nur mit ihnen lässt sich unser hoher Anspruch Tag für Tag in die Tat umsetzen. Wir bieten ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld, weil wir Talent und Begeisterung unserer Mitarbeiter mit interessanten Aufgaben und gemeinsamen Zielen verbinden. Zudem setzen wir auf Teamgeist, fordern und fördern Leistung, während wir gleichzeitig Wert auf Vereinbarkeit von Arbeit und Privatleben legen. Zahlreiche Mitarbeiter-Benefits wie Vertrauensarbeitszeit, Kids-Office, Sportprogramme, After-Work-Partys und individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten sind für uns selbstverständlich. Jeden Tag!


Bei Fragen wende dich an:


Justus Breitmeier
People & Organisation Partner
Tel. +49 30/ 42086 1917


Hypoport AG | Smart InsurTech GmbH
Klosterstraße 71, 10179 Berlin


www.hypoport.de | www.smartinsurtech.de
