item.title: Softwareentwickler/in Django/Python at Max-Planck-Institut für Bildungsforschung (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das Max-Planck-Institut für Bildungsforschung in Berlin sucht für den Forschungsbereich Entwicklungspsychologie (Leitung Prof. Dr. Ulman Lindenberger) ab dem 01.01.2018 eine/n


Softwareentwickler/in Django/Python


(EG 13 TVöD, max. 39 Wochenstunden, 3 Jahre)


für ein Gemeinschaftsprojekt verschiedener Max-Planck-Institute. Ziel ist die Entwicklung eines neuen Open-Source-Management-Tools für die Organisation und Durchführung von humanwissenschaftlichen Studien in der Grundlagenforschung der Max-Planck-Gesellschaft (MPG).


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Agile Softwareentwicklung von Frontend-/Backend-Services und -Systemen

  • Programmierung und Entwicklung von Modulen und Schnittstellen

  • Konzeptionelle Mitarbeit an der Entwicklung des Systems

  • Begleitung des Deployments und der Datenschutz-Zertifizierungs- und Sicherheitsüberprüfung der Software


Was bieten Sie:



  • Neugierige/r und ideenreiche/r Django-Entwickler/in

  • Hochschulabschluss im Bereich der Informatik, Naturwissenschaften oder vergleichbarer Ausbildung

  • Nachweisbare Erfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und im Django-Framework

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in relationalen und nicht-relationalen Datenbanken

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift in Deutsch und Englisch


Wir bieten Ihnen:



  • Teamorientierte und familienfreundliche Arbeitsumgebung in einem internationalen und interdisziplinären Forschungsumfeld

  • Moderner Technologie-Stack

  • Flache Hierarchien und Raum für kreative Weiterentwicklung

  • Flexible Arbeitszeitregelung

  • Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen und beruflichen Weiterbildung


Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?


Die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, mehr schwerbehinderte Menschen zu beschäftigen. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen sind ausdrücklich erwünscht.


Ferner will die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft den Anteil an Frauen in den Bereichen erhöhen, in denen sie unterrepräsentiert sind. Frauen werden deshalb ausdrücklich aufgefordert, sich zu bewerben.


Bitte senden Sie Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen vorzugsweise in einer zusammenhängenden PDF-Datei bis zum 04.10.2017 per E-Mail an schaar@mpib-berlin.mpg.de. Informationen zu einer verschlüsselten Übermittlung auf Anfrage.

item.title: Qt Embedded Software Architect (automotive, medical, embedded, automation) at The Qt Company (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
item.description:
We offer excellent opportunities for a creative and passionate software architect to spread the word about the software development framework that rules them all – Qt.


About the Role








Qt (pronounced “cute”) is the leading C++ cross-platform application and UI framework in the world. Headquartered in Finland, The Qt Company is responsible for Qt development, productization and licensing under commercial and open-source licenses. The Qt Company has over 260 employees in Product Management, R&D, Sales, Marketing and Consulting Services with several offices worldwide.


The Qt Company Service Team helps large global customers to reach their targets by providing them advisory services both in Qt software framework and customer’s software solution. These services include guidance on the use of Qt APIs, functions, methods and programming techniques for all major platforms.


As a key member of this team, for the Automotive market segment, you will contribute primarily to the In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) systems and/or instrument cluster systems. You will represent the Qt Company as technical lead towards a customer on varying project tasks including, but not limited to, requirements, design, and delivery of applications. These applications primarily use Qt, usually on embedded Linux based platforms. You will also collaborate with Qt’s R&D department to apply the latest Qt technologies on your concrete customer use case.


You need to be enthusiastic, have a proven track-record of successful application development in the embedded environment. You should be interested in problem solving and quickly adapt to changing technical environments. You will need to work fluently and with pride in the customer interface as a recognized specialist of your own technical subject – A tip of the spear for the technologies we represent. 


Main Responsibility Areas



  • Leads design, architecture and development efforts for Qt’s Automotive customers (Tier-1s or OEMs)

  • Analyze requirements, functional specifications against the target hardware

  •  Create software design for applications developed with Qt and its interaction with other library components on the IVI stack

  • Interface with customers on system architecture through workshops and design meetings

  • Identify and address system level metrics, such as: resource consumption, performance, boot time and inter-application communication

  • Present technical solutions to customers

  • Provide support to the customer’s development organization; the go to person for any Qt related technical assistance

  • Focus primarily on securing customer success in using Qt Software products in the Automotive market

  • Regular travelling to customers 








Your qualifications



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or higher (not mandatory)

  • Preferably 5+ years of working on large software programs


Experienced and talented developer with deep understanding of one or more of the following:



  • Strong C++ experience with successful track record in developing C++ applications

  • Experience with major automotive Tier-1s and/or OEMs, with prior IVI or Cluster architecture is a big plus

  • Strong exposure to Embedded Linux adaptation and Qt including Yocto project

  • Excellent Technical understanding of Qt Software Products (Qt, Qt for Embedded Linux, Qt tools) 








Location


Berlin or Southern area of Germany / Suburbs of Detroit, USA 


Interested?


For more information, please contact:


Bernard Falise, bernard.falise(a)qt.io / European positions


Pat McGowan, pat.mcgowan(at)qt.io / USA positions

item.title: (Senior) Full Stack Developer (m/f) at Quadriga Media Berlin GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
(Senior) Full Stack Developer (m/f)




Position description



  • Exciting and varied projects with a focus on programing websites and portals in frontend and backend with PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript

  • Development of existing applications

  • Be part of a cross-functional task force consisting of front-end, back-end, design and product teams.

  • Understanding of APIs (JSON, XML)

  • In-depth knowledge of Git; Jenkins and CD/CI in general will be a plus

  • Knowledge of project management and the issue-tracking platform JIRA/Con­flu­ence is a plus

  • Hands-on-attitude and goal-oriented functioning as well as the ability to work independently

  • A clean coding style

  • Excellent command of English (German is a plus)

  • An open and honest person with a sense of humor and team orientation





Our benefits



  • Training: We put a high value on individual training and professional development. You will benefit from five days of further training per year.

  • Colleagues: Become part of a team of more than 230 highly-motivated colleagues and connect, exchange, and party with them during our regular team events.

  • Careers: Use your creative freedom, work autonomously, and profit from internal opportunities for your professional development.

  • Work-Life balance: A healthy work-life balance is important to us. We belief in flexible working hours (core working time 10 am – 4 pm) and home office options.

  • Flat hierarchies: We emphasize transparency, clear decision channels, and a friendly working culture.

  • Community: We create connections and promote team spirit through lunches for interns, trainees, and juniors, 'mystery lunches', social events, 'meet the CEO' gatherings, and much more.

  • Sports programme: Stay fit and have fun! Our weekly sports programme includes yoga, running groups, and fitness.

  • Onboarding: We facilitate an easy entry into the Quadriga world through clear onboarding processes with targeted induction, trainings, feedback conversations, and partner programmes.

  • Location: Work in the heart of Berlin with excellent connections to public transport, a private library, and a green outdoor area.




Together we create platforms to connect professionals and managerial personnel. If you would like to be part of our team, apply now with your complete application documents (cover letter, resume, references, proposed salary, and available starting date) via our online form.

item.title: Frontend Developer (f/m) - Real UI development at Younicos AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Are you keen to help shape future power supply?


Are you passionate about writing clean code?


You want to develop something real?


Then this job is for you


As a frontend developer at Younicos, you will work on our Y.Q platform, which monitors, supervises and controls various electrical components like batteries, inverters , pv plants, wind farms, thermal generators, transformers, switchgears and auxiliary systems. The development of the Y.Q platform, which runs as 24/7 service on site, is based on a distributed, messaging-based architecture. Specialized subsystems ensure the optimal control of the electrical components and implement technical interfaces for transmission line operators, energy providers and remote monitoring.


As part of an agile team (Scrum) you will work on all aspects of the UI development. Strongly modularized system architecture, documentation of the design and functional specifications, high performance UI design, test driven development, fully automated integration testing and building the final product are your day-to-day tasks. Depending on your skills and interests you might work on the general user guidance, the automation and generation of building blocks of the UI, graphical representation of live and historian data, interface to the database or interface to the messaging system to give you some ideas.


All developments are performed in close collaboration with the Y.Q development team and our technical engineers to understand and visualize the technical requirements of the electrical equipment. With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.


Your main responsibilities are:



  • Design/maintain graphical user interfaces which allow the operators to control the systems over the web

  • Write web based reports and extract pertinent information from the SQL/NoSQL database

  • Develop new solutions for time series and event based data for monitoring and reporting


Your profile


From the technical point of view a must is



  • completed university studies in UI design, user interaction design, computer science, informatics or comparable studies

  • years of professional experience in UI development ,ideally in an agile process environment

  • Experience in user guidance and UI design.

  • Experience in developing/architecting PHP/MySQL-based web applications (LAMP) ideally for industrial applications.

  • Desire for writing and testing clean, efficient and reliable code


Welcome is



  • Hands-on expertise with JavaScript, DHTML, and CSS, Angular

  • Demonstrated experience with web user interface toolkits.

  • Experience with PHP alternatives and backend programming like Java, Node.js, Scala is a plus

  • Experience with TSDB like InfluxDB or Prometheus

  • RDBMS experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or similar.

  • Experience with MVC frameworks.

  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum.

  • Familiarity with Version Control Systems (Git).

  • Experience with testing and continuous integration platforms: Selenium, PHPUnit, Jenkins.

  • Linux skills and experience with networking equipment is a plus


From personal point of view:



  • A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea win

  • Exceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracy

  • Basic understanding of the principles of electrical engineering is a plus

  • Basic German is a plus


Our offer



  • The opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy shares

  • Motivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things done

  • Open discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your work

  • Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

  • Permanent contract

item.title: Java-Entwickler / Java Developer at De Causmaecker & Partner / Schütze Consulting AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Karriereperspektive für überzeugende Persönlichkeit Kommunikationsstarker Software-Entwickler


Java-Entwickler (m,w)


Java Developer (m,w)


Übernahme von Verantwortung im Rahmen von SW-Entwicklungsprojekten


Erfolgreiche IT-Beratung Gute Work-Life-Balance


Berlin


Haben Sie Ihr Studium erfolgreich abgeschlossen? Z.B. in einem Bereich der Informatik, Natur- oder Ingenieurswissenschaften? Oder haben Sie sich in der Praxis gleichwertige Kenntnisse angeeignet? Können Sie auf solide Berufserfahrungen zurückblicken? Haben Sie bereits erfolgreich Java implementiert und kennen die gängigen Tools und Software-Architekturen? Möchten Sie nun ihre mehrjährigen Kenntnisse in Digitalisierungsprojekteneingeben? Gehören darüber hinaus Dynamik und Verhandlungsgeschick ebenso zu Ihren Stärken wie Analytik und Pragmatismus? Und sind Sie ein ausgesprochen guter Kommunikator? Dann lesen Sie bitte weiter:


Die Schütze Consultant AG als mittelständische, inhabergeführte, wachstumsstarke IT-Beratung mit ca. 80 Mitarbeitern gehört seit über fünfzehn Jahren zu den Hidden Champions. Wir haben uns auf Beratung (eRechnung, ePayment), Entwicklung und Betrieb sowie Digitalisierung fokussiert und sind in den Branchen Öffentlicher Dienst (eGovernment), Finanzen, Bildung, Soziales und Gesundheitswesen aktiv. Unsere Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt durch eine positive, transparente Atmosphäre in der Teamgeist, Authentizität und das Wohl jedes Einzelnen berücksichtigt werden. Wir wachsen weiter und bieten Ihnen deshalb beste Karrierechancen in einem spannenden Umfeld.


Nach einer fokussierten Einarbeitung übernehmen Sie eigenverantwortlich Entwicklungsaufgaben, teilweise vor Ort beim Kunden, teilweise in den Räumlichkeiten unseres Mandanten Hierzu gehört neben dem Management der Kundenbeziehung, auch die Beobachtung und Adaptierung neuer technologischer Entwicklungen. Die Ausschöpfung von Cross Selling-Potentialen bei Bestandskunden sowie die Akquisition von Nachfolgeaufträgen runden Ihr Aufgabenportfolio ab. Möchten Sie sich dieser Herausforderung stellen? Und haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?


Dann rufen Sie unseren Berater, Herrn Matthias Kohl, unter +49 69 666 82 12 an. Gerne auch abends und am Wochenende unter +49 170 555 49 78. Er beantwortet Ihnen erste Fragen und informiert Sie über die weitere Vorgehensweise. Oder Sie senden direkt eine E-Mail an mk@houseofconsultants.de unter Angabe der Kennziffer MK7045.

item.title: Technomathematikerin / Technomathematikers oder Informatikerin / Informatikers at Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt
Braunschweig und Berlin
Nationales Metrologieinstitut


Die Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt (PTB) ist das nationale Metrologie-Institut der Bundesrepublik Deutschland mit wissenschaftlich-technischen Dienstleistungsaufgaben und fördert Fortschritt und Zuverlässigkeit in der Messtechnik für Gesellschaft, Wirtschaft und Wissenschaft.


In dem Präsidialen Stab der PTB ist zum frühestmöglichen Zeitpunkt die Stelle einer/eines


Technomathematikerin / Technomathematikers oder
Informatikerin / Informatikers


zu besetzen. Die Stelle ist auf 2 Jahre befristet. Bei Bewährung ist die Übernahme in ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis möglich. Es kommen nur Bewerber/innen in Frage, die bisher in keinem Arbeitsverhältnis zum Bund gestanden haben bzw. deren Ausscheiden aus einem Arbeitsverhältnis zum Bund mehr als drei Jahre zurückliegt. Die Vergütung erfolgt nach Entgeltgruppe 11 TVöD Bund. Der Dienstort ist Berlin.


Die Stabsgruppe PSt1 „Koordination Digitalisierung" ist zum einen für die Koordinierung strategischer Vorhaben in der PTB im Bereich Digitalisierung zuständig und führt zum anderen eigenständige Forschungs- und Entwicklungsarbeiten in disziplinübergreifenden Querschnittsthemen der Digitalisierung durch.


Aufgaben:



  • Durchführung optischer Simulationsrechnungen auf Basis der an der PTB entwickelten Simulationssoftware SimOptDevice (Matlab)

  • Entwicklung graphischer Benutzeroberflächen und Programmdokumentationen (Matlab und Python)

  • Unterstützung bei der Implementierung von an der PTB entwickelten Auswerte-, Analyse- und Simulationsmethoden für die Metrologie in der digitalen Signalverarbeitung und für verteilte Messsysteme (Python)

  • Unterstützung bei der Durchführung von weiteren Forschungsaktivitäten der Stabsgruppe PSt1 „Koordination Digitalisierung"


Anforderungsprofil:



  • abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Diplom (FH) oder Bachelor) der Fachrichtung Technomathematik oder vergleichbar (Informatik oder Mathematik)

  • Erfahrung bei der Implementierung komplexer Lösungen in Matlab oder Python

  • Kenntnisse in der Bild- und Wellenoptik und/oder Kenntnisse in der digitalen Signalverarbeitung und Systemtheorie sind von Vorteil

  • sehr gute Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit

  • Kreativität, hohe Lernbereitschaft, großes Engagement, Verlässlichkeit und Fähigkeit zur selbständigen Arbeit werden erwartet

  • sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Englisch in Wort und Schrift

  • Bereitschaft, sich schnell in neue Themengebiete sowie neue Entwicklungen einzuarbeiten

  • Bereitschaft zur Reisetätigkeit im In- und Ausland


Die PTB fördert die berufliche Gleichstellung von Frauen und Männern und ist deshalb besonders an Bewerbungen von Frauen interessiert.


Die PTB bietet im Rahmen der dienstlichen Möglichkeiten flexible Teilzeitmodelle an, um insbesondere die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf zu unterstützen.


Schwerbehinderte Bewerber/innen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.


Sind Sie interessiert?
Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Bitte nutzen Sie unser Online-Bewerbungsformular


oder bewerben Sie sich auf dem Postweg:


Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt
-Institut Berlin-
Kennziffer 17-39-PSt
Abbestraße 2-12
10587 Berlin


Die Bewerbungsfrist endet am 30. September 2017.
Bitte haben Sie Verständnis dafür, dass wir Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht entgegennehmen.


Weitere fachliche Informationen zu dieser Stelle erhalten Sie bei 
Herrn Dr. T. Kleine-Ostmann, Tel.: +49 531 592-1008, E-Mail: thomas.kleine-ostmann@ptb.de oder
Herrn Dr. S. Eichstädt, Tel.: +49 30 3481-7946, E-Mail: sascha.eichstaedt@ptb.de.


Link zum Fachbereich


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagefähige Bewerbung.


Informationen über unser Haus entnehmen Sie bitte unserer Internetseite: www.ptb.de.

item.title: Full-Stack Softwareentwickler (m/w) at Hypoport AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die Hypoport AG ist Muttergesellschaft der Hypoport-Gruppe. Die Tochterunternehmen der Gruppe befassen sich mit dem Vertrieb von Finanzdienstleistungen, ermöglicht oder unterstützt durch Finanz-Technologie (FinTech). Die Tochterunternehmen sind in die vier voneinander profitierenden Geschäftsbereiche Kreditplattform, Privatkunden, Institutionelle Kunden und Versicherungsplattform gegliedert.


So spannend wie ein Start-up, so solide wie eine Bank - du suchst diese Kombination? Mit Scrum, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming und eigenen Clean Code Vorgaben entwickelst und gestaltest Du in unserem Entwickler-Team mit neuen Technologien und modernen Vorgehensmodellen. Professionell, aber in einem entspannten Umfeld.


Was tun wir?



  • Wir entwickeln neue Anwendungen und erweitern unsere bestehenden Software-Produkte.

  • Dazu zählen dynamische Inhalte auf unseren beiden Webportalen drklein.de und Vergleich.de, wie z.B. die Rechner, Vergleiche und Antragsstrecken.

  • Unsere weiteren Produkte sind das Reporting-System, mit dem die Berater von Dr. Klein ihren Erfolg messen können, und das Feedback-System, mit dem Kunden von Dr. Klein ihre Berater bewerten können.

  • Wir treiben die Entwicklung dieser Systeme von der Konzeption über die Implementierung bis hin zum Betrieb voran – und das alles innerhalb eines Teams – ganz im Sinne der Vollfunktionalität.


Welche Technologien nutzen wir?



  • Wir sprechen hauptsächlich Java und JavaScript.

  • Unterstützung erhalten wir durch Guice, Jersey, SASS, AngularJS und jQuery. Wir nutzen SQL- und Mongo-Datenbanken.


Wann passt Du zu uns?



  • Wenn du dich in unseren Technologien wiederfindest und darin schon mehrjährige Erfahrung gesammelt hast.

  • Wenn du auf Clean Code und TDD stehst.

  • Wenn Pair Programming und Teamverantwortung für dich eine gute Idee sind.

  • Wenn dich Full-Stack-Entwicklung reizt. Wenn du in einem agilen Umfeld arbeiten möchtest.

  • Wenn du kein Einzelkämpfer, sondern ein Teamplayer bist. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen mit uns zu teilen und zu vermehren.


Warum sind wir so gerne dabei?


Wir arbeiten eng mit Kollegen aus den Fachbereichen zusammen. Flexible Arbeitszeiten und agile Vorgehensweise ermöglichen es uns, entspannt zu gestalten. Wir tauschen uns regelmäßig mit anderen Kollegen aus und nehmen an Teamevents und After-Work-Partys teil. Über die Arbeit hinaus gibt es Sportangebote, Interessencommunitys, Rückenkurs, Massage und weitere Extras für das Wohlbefinden. Wenn die Luft raus ist, finden sich immer Kollegen für Kicker, Billard oder Tischtennis.


Und jetzt?


Bewirb Dich bei uns!


Bei Fragen wende dich an:


Justus Breitmeier
People & Organisation Partner


Tel. +49 30/ 42086 1917


Hypoport AG | Dr. Klein Privatkunden AG
Klosterstraße 71, 10179 Berlin


www.hypoport.de | www.drklein.de



Jetzt bewerben

item.title: Data Scientist - Payments at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make an Impact

At Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.

You Are Setting Standards

Variety. As a team you will research, design and implement machine learning algorithms to improve our payment solutions.
Ownership. You will be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment.
Excellence. Share your knowledge and passion about delivering scalable real-world machine learning solutions to end users, and help your colleagues excel.

You Are Skilled

Technologies. You have already worked with big data frameworks before (we use Apache Spark). You are eager to prototype new machine learning concepts (in R or Python) and are also able to push them all the way to production. You also have experience building production systems at scale (experience in Scala or Java is a plus).
You have experience in applied machine learning and know at least one of the following methods in depth (regression, tree-based methods, ensemble learning). And you have a good understanding of the mathematical concepts that are frequently used in machine learning (linear algebra, probability theory)
Code Quality. You are ready to deploy your code to production (including testing, CI, deployment) and taking ownership.
Education. You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.) and are eager to keep learning and applying new knowledge.

You Are Offered

Culture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued; positive, inspiring working atmosphere.
Perks. Competitive salary; great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; office in the heart of Berlin; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services; flexible working times; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays and volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings*. (*Depending on location)
Development. Mentoring; personal branding support focused on leadership; diverse career opportunities.
Peers. International, accomplished experts.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!
If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Maria Garcia

item.title: Lead Mobile (iOS / Android) Engineer, Lean Service Creation, Berlin at Aperto - An IBM Company (Berlin, Deutschland)

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f) at HeyJobs GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Your role:



  • Implementation of new business logic in our backend application, which powers the JSON API behind our React/Redux web applications

  • Working with various third party APIs (e.g. Facebook Marketing API, Google AdWords API, etc.) to automate processes in our marketing activities, add new channels and improve our performance

  • Building practical admin interfaces to enable our internal teams to work effectively and efficiently


Your profile:



  • You have 3+ years of work experience as a developer and at least 1-2 years of experience in Ruby-on-Rails

  • You are comfortable working with Git

  • You have experience with automated testing

  • You have worked with marketing APIs / automation before - not a must

  • Ideally, you have some experience with Python and AWS

  • You have a structured, proactive working style

  • You are a self-starter and an entrepreneurial mind – You get things done

  • You are a team player


What we offer: 



  • An important and shaping role in a fast-growing company

  • An opportunity to work closely with and learn from an experienced, cross-functional team of analysts, data scientists and developers

  • A quality oriented development culture - we're proud of our code, practice TDD, like to pair when needed and use continuous integration

  • A fast-paced environment with work which will have a direct impact on HeyJobs

  • An amazing team culture with regular team and company events

  • A feedback-seeking culture that helps your professional and personal growth

  • A super transparent information policy with flat hierarchies

  • Amazing office in Berlin Kreuzberg with lots of room for individual development


Interested? Send us your CV and we will get back to you as soon as possible. We are looking forward to your application!


Are you interested in the company culture at HeyJobs? Have a look at our ratings at Glassdoor!

item.title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Wayfair’s Front-End Engineering team is responsible for bridging the gap between Design and Back-End Programming on an Engineering team of 1000+ and a family of sites that sees over 55 million visitors per month, which generate more than $3.5 billion/year.  


Through the translation of mockups into scalable and maintainable coding patterns across six primary brands and three international sites, we work closely with Design and Full-Stack Engineers to maintain the company’s visual web standards within our codebase. We build all of our features using a combination of React and SASS. However, it's not only about the tools. We have complex business logic and a lot of building blocks, which sometimes require heavy lifting and we use Redux to handle that complexity.


We’re looking for a talented Frontend Engineer, who knows how to balance a passion for logic and problem solving with a keen eye for design to join this growing team.


Projects include:



  •       Writing clean, elegant, accessible, and performant Javascript, HTML, and CSS code in support of our 6 E-commerce sites, internal applications and supplier extranet.

  •       Problem solving on the fly using various resources and debugging methods to diagnose and execute solutions independently.

  •       Working seamlessly with Designers, Product Managers, and business stakeholders to translate designs/wireframes into frontend code.

  •       Working closely with other Storefront technology teams including Frontend Platforms, Performance, and Full-Stack (PHP) to create next generation site features.

  •       Understanding and employing engineering and optimization best practices with regard to frontend web standards, code maintainability, page rendering, and browser performance.


An ideal candidate has:



  • 1-3+ years of Javascript, CSS, and HTML development experience

  • Sense of humor and excellent communication skills

  • Skilled with CSS and HTML, including the ability to code from scratch without a framework, and a focus on code reusability, performance, and faithfulness to design

  • Skilled with Javascript, including familiarity with preferably React or other modern client-side frameworks such as Backbone.js, Angular, Ember, or Polymer.


Nice to haves:



  • Github account

  • Involved in meet-ups and conferences

  • Experience with/knowledge of frontend coding considerations for Mobile/Tablet devices, including responsive/adaptive design

  • Experience with React in particular

  • PHP or other server-side language exposure

  • Source Control exposure

  • Experience working on large, complex, enterprise level sites, ideally with multiple “skins” for the same markup

  • A Creative/Design background with an instinct for UI/UX


And finally, our proposition to you!




  • Of course the usual competitive salary, bonus and we share the company with you in stock units




  • We contribute to your gym membership and offer free Yoga classes, as well as Wellness Weeks with massages, workshops and other exciting events




  • The opportunity to work cross-functionally and closely with senior leadership not only in the Berlin office, but also with Boston, London and Galway




  • We offer a vast selection of classes through our learn@work program to enhance your professional and personal development.




  • We want you to connect with your team and fellow colleagues through regular social events




  • We’re in the heart of the Berlin startup scene with lots of space to encourage collaboration and teamwork




About Wayfair


Wayfair (NYSE: W) offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and décor across all styles and price points with a superior customer service and inspiring interior topics. With an unparalleled selection of more than seven million home items from 7,000 suppliers, Wayfair helps people find the perfect product at the right price. Always committed to using technology to create a superior shopping experience, Wayfair developed Wayfair Next which concentrates on 3D visualization technology


Wayfair generated $3.6 billion in net revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2017. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with operations throughout North America and Europe, the company employs more than 5,700 people.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at Smava GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are smava, the online loan comparison platform. We provide transparency and fairness to our customers by giving them all relevant data and information to act as empowered market participants. Our mission is disrupting financial services by digitalizing lending. We provide consumers with the fastest most convenient and most affordable personal credit solutions which fit their individual needs best. As a Berlin based FinTech we have grown to over 280 employees and strive to continue that successful growth. To achieve that, we are looking for the best employees to expand our team- employees like you!


Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f)


Our IT-Systems and DevOps team provides functional, reliable IT-Infrastructure and is always working on ways to improve it through evaluation and deployment of new technologies. The team is always ready to pitch in and gets the things done without losing the fun doing this. We take responsibility, think ahead and work together as a team.


At smava you will…



  • Help us to fully take advantage of state of the art cloud technologies and platforms and integrate those in our current platform

  • Have a significant role in the improvement and further development of our production environment

  • Work with the team to move from continuous integration to continuous deployment and integrate state of the art configuration management

  • Help us eliminate all manual or repetitive work through automation

  • Help us improve our monitoring system and leverage from it to measure and improve performance, stability and maintainability of our systems

  • Take an important part in troubleshooting our IT-Systems


Current projects



  • Integration of public cloud providers in our current environment

  • Improvement of our automated testing environment, deployment pipeline and production systems


Your profile



  • More than 3 years experience as a DevOps Engineer, preferably in Fintech, e-commerce and/or startups

  • You’ve worked with public cloud providers (e.g. AWS) in the last few years and have set up and/or migrated complex applications on these platforms in a senior position

  • You have extended knowledge in configuration management (e.g. Ansible, Saltstack)

  • Profound knowledge of setting-up and maintaining container virtualization (e.g. Docker) and deploy processes matching this methodology

  • Build systems and automatic deploy processes (Jenkins/Maven) isn’t a new challenge for you

  • You have strong skills in programming languages like Python and/or Groovy

  • You have a self-managed and service-oriented work approach

  • Your English is fluent


Nice to have



  • Knowledge of PostgreSQL

  • Experience in monitoring systems (e.g. Icinga2, Prometheus, ELK, Splunk)

  • IT-Security know-how (Linux/Java web applications/Apache2/PostgreSQL)

  • Setting up big data process with Apache Storm/Spark/Hadoop

  • General overview about newest trends in DevOps/System Administration sphere

  • German would be cool, but hey nobody is perfect

  • Working experience with Stash/Bitbucket, Jira and Confluence

  • Basic knowledge of Active Directory, Wordpress


What we offer



  • The opportunity to drive the future technology changes in the financial industry

  • Smart colleagues from all around the world (30 nationalities) we have onboarded successfully in providing e.g. visa sponsorship and relocation support

  • Open communication & flat hierarchy allows fast execution

  • Flexible working hours

  • Onboarding support

  • Paid education (e. g. trainings, workshops, conferences)

  • Language courses

  • Subsidized lunch offer (smunch.co) and public transport ticket (VBB Umweltkarte)

  • Discounted fitness offers close to the office

  • Beer Friday, Mystery Lunch, Breakfast Club and team events


Did we get your attention? Then we are looking forward receiving your application including



  • CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date addressed to Natalia Nehring

  • In case you are not an EU citizen, we also need a copy of your academic degree & valid passport

  • If you already have a Blue Card, Visa or Work Permit, please let us know


Note that it will be difficult to proceed with your application without the documents mentioned above.


APPLY ONLINE

item.title: Data Engineer (f/m) at Smartfrog Services GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We’re looking for talented and motivated people to join our team!


Location: Berlin
Start: ASAP; fulltime


Your role


We are looking for an experienced data engineer to support our Backend Team in building data infrastructure which will allow us to act data driven as a company.



  • Provide data on user behaviour, marketing and financial data to stakeholders which will be used for ad-hoc and automated reporting as well as data science applications (including object recognition in video and image data)

  • Get data from external APIs and combine them with our own data warehouse content

Requirements



  • Experience with relational and non-relational databases

  • SQL on expert level

  • Python - experience with data processing and common libraries like Pandas and Numpy, Data visualizations, ETL Pipelines

  • Experience working in an agile cross-functional team

  • Fluent in written and spoken English

  • Practical experiences with Spark and/or AWS Kinesis would be a plus

How to apply
Are you interested in joining the Smartfrog team? Please send your CV with a short cover letter including salary indication to Martin Kottbusch, jobs@smartfrog.com. We are excited to get to know you!


www.smartfrog.com

item.title: Senior Node.JS Developer (f/m) Urban Mobility at car2go (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Who we are
As the first free-floating car sharing system in the world, car2go offers flexible mobility with smart fortwo and Mercedes-Benz vehicles, everywhere and at any time for a reasonable price in the inner city areas of various cities. Vehicles can be located and booked spontaneously via smartphone app or the internet portal.

Your role
You will play a key role within the web development team and shape the backend of the car2go eco-system. You will write code for web based automated systems to analyze and process high volumes of data in ‘real-time’. Fast prototyping and bulletproofed production applications are both epics.



  • You constantly improve the architecture and performance of our highly available backend applications and respective APIs

  • You will write well tested, modular, documented code

  • You research for new technologies and you are happy to learn new ones that improve our products

  • You will closely collaborate with our multiple Backend- and mobile App-Teams

  • You will work with other software engineers in a self-organized scrum team



Skills and requirements



  • You have several years of professional experience with backend development in Javascript and Node.js

  • You have an outstanding understanding of Node.js and used frameworks like hapi in production

  • You have up-to-date skills in Javascript (ES6 or Typescript)

  • You’ve built RESTful APIs and micro-services before

  • You have good skills in test-driven and behavior-driven development

  • Knowledge of the usual cloud systems like AWS or IBM Softlayer is a plus



The team
As a self-organized and agile team we work collaboratively to solve challenging problems of the fast developing web technology. We are an international team of experts which supports direct communication and a hands-on culture. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and we foster the contribution of your own ideas and research.
One part of the team will be located in Hamburg, the other one in Berlin. You can choose your operation site freely.

The recruitment process
When you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.
If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.
The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Hamburg, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and an HR manager.

item.title: Business Intelligence Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)

Our Business Development and Intelligence team works on setting up, growing and continually further developing our innovative SaaS solutions on both strategic and operational levels. item.title: Help us as Software Engineer to become the standard for personalized audio at Mimi Hearing Technologies GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

We are looking for a Software Engineer as a full-time position for our office in Berlin. 


We operate at all levels of the stack: we’re responsible for the code we write from the time it enters the git history until the time it’s removed 4 months later because it was causing a bug.


As one of our Software Engineers you will:

  • Build an awesome user product

  • Ship early and often and ship things we can all be proud of

item.title: Java-Programmierer (m/w) at H&H Datenverarbeitungs- und Beratungsgesellschaft mbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir suchen das karierte Maiglöckchen! Doch sind wir einmal realistisch, das werden wir nicht finden. Deshalb suchen wir Sie als 


Programmierer / Softwareentwickler / Java-Programmierer / C#-Programmierer (w/m)


im Fachbereich Datenübernahme / Konvertierung und arbeiten Sie umfassend sowie systematisch in Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld ein! Bringen Sie Ihre Ideen bei uns ein, werden Sie zu einem Fachexperten in der Programmierung von Konvertierungsmodulen und Teil unseres familiären Teams. Dabei spielt es keine Rolle, ob Sie Berufseinsteiger bei uns starten möchten oder 30 Jahre Berufserfahrung mitbringen.


Ihr Profil


Sie passen zu uns, wenn Sie eine hohe Lernbereitschaft mitbringen und eine gängige objektorientierte Programmiersprache (z.B. Java, C#) beherrschen. Sie haben Freude an der Datenanalyse, am Lösen von Problemen, an der Programmierung und Weiterentwicklung von Programmen. Dies sind die Grundvoraussetzungen. Als weitere Pluspunkte sehen wir an:



  • Eine abgeschlossene  Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker mit dem Schwerpunkt Anwendungsentwicklung oder ein Studium im Bereich Informatik

  • Erste praktische Erfahrung als Programmierer / Softwareentwickler

  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken

  • Erfahrung in der Anforderungsanalyse, Konzeption und Realisierung objektorientierter Anwendungen

  • Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und ein hohes Abstraktionsvermögen

  • Gespür für Performance und Optimierung

  • Detailorientierung, Präzision und selbstständige Arbeitsweise

  • Teamfähigkeit


Ihre Aufgaben


Entwickeln Sie Programme zur Datenkonvertierung in Progress® OpenEdge ABL und verbinden Sie die Vielfältigkeit projektbezogener Tätigkeiten mit einer kontinuierlichen Aufbau- und Entwicklungsarbeit.



  • Analyse und Konvertierung von Fremd- und Eigendaten

  • Programmierung, Anpassung und Dokumentation von Konvertierungsmodulen

  • Weiterentwicklung unseres Konvertierungsframeworks

  • Codereview

  • Erstellen von Unittests

  • Ideenentwicklung zur Verbesserung unseres Finanzverfahrens und Umsetzung in eigene Produktideen

  • Begleitung der Fusionen und Gemeindegebietsreformen unserer kommunalen Kunden

  • Ansprechpartner für Support, Kunden und Partner


Ihre Vorteile mit H&H



  • Hohe Freiheitsgrade in der Softwareentwicklung: Ziel ist der Aufbau eines performanten, sauberen objektorientierten Quellcodes / Frameworks – den Weg bestimmen Sie

  • Wir legen Wert auf eine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance: Gleitzeit, die Möglichkeit für Home-Office nach Absprache, keine Reisetätigkeit

  • Attraktive Vergütungsrichtlinie, inkl. Weihnachts- und Urlaubsgeld

  • Angenehmes Arbeitsklima, familiäres Umfeld, guter Zusammenhalt unter den Kollegen

  • Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit mit Struktur aber wenig Routine in einem interdisziplinären Team

  • Sie bekommen die Möglichkeit zur fachlichen Weiterentwicklung und regelmäßige Schulungen

  • Verkehrsgünstige Lage


Unser technischer Backround



  • Unser Produkt: proDoppik (Finanzsoftware für öffentliche Verwaltungen)

  • Datenbank: Oracle, MS SQL und Progress

  • Quellverwaltungssystem: git und bitbucket

  • Projektmanagementtool: Jiira und confluence

  • Strukturen für 2-Tier und 3-Tier-Architekturen

  • Entwicklungsumgebung: Eclipse

  • Programmiersprache: Progress® OpenEdge ABL

  • Windows-Rechner mit Windows 10


Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung unter Angabe des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellungen an:


H&H Datenverarbeitungs- und Beratungsgesellschaft mbH, Kristin Michaelis, Storkower Straße 99, 10407 Berlin, bewerbung@hh-berlin.de

item.title: Software Engineer - Crypto/ Payments at Kraken (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)

Our Engineering team is having a blast while delivering the most sophisticated crypto-trading platform out there. Help us continue to define and lead the industry.

item.title: Full Stack Development for new Fintech Startup at Moonfare GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Full Stack Web Developer


working from Berlin, Germany



Moonfare was founded in 2016 in Berlin. We are first and foremost entrepreneurs – aiming to reinvent the way people invest into alternative asset classes. We are a technology-enabled investment platform that gives qualified investors access to curated alternative investment opportunities. We offer access to oversubscribed deals (at a low minimum), full transparency (low fees), and complete end-to-end investment support to qualified investors.


Our team collectively brings decades of experience from the most prestigious investment institutions, a trusted close network of industry relationships as well as a strong reputation as a preferred capital partner to continually pursue a steady flow of differentiated opportunities for our platform.


We have an open mindset, a disciplined work mentality, and embrace creativity. This makes for a driven and exciting work environment where you will be challenged and given responsibility to succeed amongst a trusted team.



JOB DESCRIPTION


We are looking for a full stack developer to help build the leading digital alternative investment platform! In this role, you will be responsible to develop, document, test, support and maintain data-driven and client server applications for investors using strong analytical and technical design to maximize the ease of use.


Your tasks and responsibilities will include:



  • Building next generation web features to smooth the way to invest into alternative assets. 

  • Designing critical product features with our Product manager

  • Being involved in all stages of product development and be an essential part of the decision-making process

  • Writing and improving the features to meet the highest expectations of our clients

  • Understanding business and customer needs and translate them into product requirements

  • Ensure efficient communication with your fellows to share latest news, developments, and learnings



YOUR PROFILE



  • Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer science or related discipline

  • You have 3 - 5 years’ experience as a full stack developer

  • You have experience with Node 7.x, Express, MongoDB, React Framework, JSX, npm/ yarn and webpack

  • Experience with working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with larger degrees of autonomy

  • Curious, inquisitive mindset and a desire to keep learning

  • You have strong verbal and written communication skills. You are able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management

  • You are ideally familiar with the financial industry and speak German



WHY US



  • You will gain experience from working with a team that is entrepreneurial at heart in an exciting new field

  • You get credit for the success of the business and are appropriately incentivized

  • You get a rewarding career where you continuously grow in a performance driven culture

  • You get access to a well-established network in Berlin, Munich and London’s start-up and business scenes

  • You enjoy a competitive remuneration package, coaching and personal development

item.title: Senior Security Software Engineer (Java or Scala, FinTech) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity

As a skilled Zalando Senior Security Software Engineer, you will analyze software designs and implementations from a security perspective of one of the world's largest e-commerce platforms. You will identify and resolve security issues and include security analysis, defenses and countermeasures at each phase of the software development lifecycle to result in a robust software. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand-while receiving meaningful support at every step.


Your responsibilities



  • Implement, test and operate software security techniques in compliance with technical reference architecture

  • Perform on-going security-testing and code review to improve software security

  • Consult team members on secure coding practices

  • Advocate Zalando´s security principles and a general "security mindset" in the teams

  • Explain how and why a particular security incident happened

  • Propose viable, informed solutions to fix security problems that arise

  • Gain a firm understanding of the security domains and understand how the apply at every stage of software development

  • Maintain technical documentation

  • Provide engineering designs for new software solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilities


What we are looking for



  • University degree in Informatics, Computer Science or a related field

  • Proven professional track-record in software security analysis and the security field

  • Payment, banking or financial background a strong plus

  • Understanding of payment or other sensible processes

  • Deep software development experience in programming languages like Java and/or Scala

  • Strong interest in all aspects of security research and development

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • Willingness to stay current on security topics

  • Engagement with the security team to discuss new tools and exchange best practices

  • A bit of charisma - you can make security cool and fun

  • English language fluency


What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical "People Leads" who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando

Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, operating in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires fast movers - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Emily Nguyen.

item.title: Software Engineer in IAM (Java or Golang, OAuth) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


The Zalando Identity & Access Management (IAM) Platform is responsible for the day-to-day security of Zalando systems and the various corresponding identities, including those representing our approx. 20 million active customers as well as our ~1.6k developers and their ~1k applications.

As an IAM software engineer for the Zalando IAM Platform team you will collaboratively and purposely extend and operate our most critical core infrastructure components. You will rethink, build and operate multi-tenant IAM solutions based on OAuth 2.0 and SAML 2.0 protocols for our vastly growing eCommerce business and help our engineering teams to integrate.

About you



  • You wonder how authentication and authorization in the web will look like in future.

  • You understand the extreme criticality of identity and access management.

  • You are not afraid to read, understand and responsibly question RFCs, yet grasp their true value.

  • You care for security in the software you write and systems you operate.

  • You wonder if they can be made to work differently long after others have stopped reading the specification.

  • You believe in clean code and feel comfortable with regular code reviews.

  • You understand that legacy code is the work you did yesterday.

  • You feel comfortable working in international teams.

  • You are able and eager to find highly-available, customer-oriented solutions to mitigate down-times and possible integration issues in existing and proposed systems.

  • You are willing to improve yourself, learn what you don't know yet and help others in doing so.

  • You respect other's opinions even if you don't agree.


Key Focus Areas



  • Support an ever changing technology infrastructure with the vision to enable identity within systems by providing them with a trusted distributed IAM as a service.

  • Design, develop, test and defend existing and future IAM systems in a vastly growing, multi-tenant environment.

  • Partner with Zalando engineering teams to help them enhance their IAM integration.


Skills and Experience



  • You have sound programming background, mostly in web applications.

  • Experience in Java and/ or Golang would be a plus.

  • You understand the benefit of automated tests and actively embrace it.

  • You have experience operating in sensitive production environments.

  • You are comfortable discussing not just IAM impact, risks, vulnerabilities and threats but also explain basic OAuth 2.0 to a variety of audiences.


What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and Practice Leads who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact recruiter Emily Nguyen.

item.title: Web Developer, Full Stack (f/m) at Ayuda GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Is it reasonable to expect mere mortals to have mastery over every facet of the development stack? We think so.
Full Stack Developers are special. They have the courage and confidence to dive into any software layer. Front end UX code? No problem. REST API code? Bring it on. Database optimizations and inner joins? No sweat.



You must:



  • Have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering with a 3.0 GPA or higher

  • Have spent at least 2 years building Web apps using ASP MVC and JQuery

  • Know your stuff when it comes to C#

  • Have deep experience with HTML5 and CSS3

  • Love creating and calling REST APIs that use JSON

  • Are really comfortable with all things SQL

  • Know how to write testable code


It would be great if you were skilled with:



  • AngularJS and KnockoutJS

  • Bootstrap

  • Inversion of control or dependency injection


We would throw you a welcome party if you have experience with:



  • WCF Data Services, OData and REST

  • Azure SQL DB

  • Optimizing SQL queries for performance

  • SQL joins (outer, inner, left, right, full)

  • Jasmine and Mocha

  • F#

item.title: (Senior) Frontend-Entwickler (m/w) at Ströer Media Brands AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Berlin suchen wir ab sofort einen engagierten (Senior) Frontend-Entwickler (m/w) mit sehr guten JavaScript-Kenntnissen.



Deine Aufgaben


Als (Senior) Frontend-Entwickler (m/w) arbeitest du eng mit Mitarbeitern der Produktentwicklung, Designern, Backend-Entwicklern und dem Rest des Frontend-Teams zusammen, um neue Ideen Realität werden zu lassen.


Deine Aufgaben beinhalten insbesondere:



  • Entwicklung von neuen Features in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Produkt und Design für eine technikaffine Zielgruppe

  • Pflege unserer Webseiten - We need it to be clear, look great and load fast!

  • Entwicklung von neuen UI-Komponenten, die wir über unsere Brands verteilen und welche eine perfekte UX für unsere User bieten

  • Unterstützung anderer Entwickler mit Code-Reviews und Mentoring hinsichtlich Erreichung des nächsten Levels



So bist Du



  • Leidenschaft für alles, was im Browser geschieht (HTML5, CSS3, Responsive, mobile first!)

  • Erfahrung mit modernen Frontend-Technologien (wir nutzen Twig, Bootstrap, Sass, Gulp)

  • Sehr gute JavaScript-Kenntnisse

  • Erfahrung und Kenntnisse in Vue.js oder Angular.js sind von Vorteil

  • Kreativität - Du findest "the right tool for the job"

  • Verständnis für die Wichtigkeit von modularem, testbarem und sauberem Code

  • Lust auf agile Projekt- und Teamarbeit (Scrum)

  • Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch (C1)

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift



So sind wir



  • Eine offene und transparente Unternehmenskultur, in der Dein Talent und Deine Persönlichkeit einen Platz finden

  • Verantwortung, Wertschätzung und Leidenschaft - Werte, die gelebt werden

  • Ein abwechslungsreiches Arbeitsumfeld in einem seit Jahren wachsenden Unternehmen

  • Viel Spielraum für die Verwirklichung eigener Ideen

  • Monatliche Teamevents

  • Regelmäßige Trainings und Workshops

  • Ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima in einem hoch motivierten und kompetenten Team

  • Attraktiver Arbeitsplatz mitten in Berlin, den Du Dir hier übrigens auch schon mal anschauen kannst: Ströer Media Brands Büro Berlin


Das klingt nach Dir und wir haben Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann starte durch! Wir freuen uns auf Deine Online-Bewerbung.


Bewirb Dich jetzt hier!

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) (f/m) at mbr targeting GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Software Engineer (Java) (f/m).


YOU will …



  • be a part of our experienced and inspiring development team.

  • build solutions that work at a scale that is unique in the industry.

  • drive your software from design through implementation into operations.

  • take responsibility for the stability and performance of our platform.

  • work together with our Product Managers to abstract business needs into APIs.


YOU have …



  • an academic degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • experience in designing and developing REST APIs.

  • proficiency in Java and understanding of related technologies, e.g. Vert.x, Netty, JUnit, Maven.

  • an interest in learning and applying other programming languages, like Scala, JavaScript/Node.js.

  • good understanding of distributed software systems and queuing technologies, e.g. Kafka, RabbitMQ, …

  • experience with NoSQL and SQL databases, e.g. Cassandra, Redis, PostgreSQL, Aerospike, …

  • a hands-on DevOps attitude and the will to take responsibility for operating the software that you design and implement.

  • ideally already participated in highly scalable and highly available web service Projects.


We offer …



  • a small, young and highly passionate team of extraordinary co-workers.

  • an open and embracing culture for the latest hot technologies.

  • an agile, focused, yet relaxed atmosphere with flexible working hours.

  • a high level of freedom and responsibility.

  • a competitive salary.

  • a nice and spacious Berlin-style office in the heart of Neukölln.

  • awesome Coffee and a large-scale reservoir of Club Mate that can be accessed in real-time!


Send an informal application including a CV to: jobs@mbr-targeting.com

item.title: iOS Developer at Tillhub GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are disrupting an entire industry. In 2017 more than 50% of the retailers need a new cash register. We are building the most mobile-native way to manage stores: meet Tillhub. We are are an award winning team consisting of experienced entrepreneurs and software developers. Based in Berlin, we have already acquired many very promising clients



iOS Developer



Now it is time for us and you to grow our team even further. We are looking for a talented, passionate, and resourceful iOS developer who shares our vision and wants to build something exciting and fresh. Our vision is to create a much better point of sale and help retailers to win in their businesses in the 21st century.







Your profile


You are a passionate engineer who loves to write clear, well designed and reusable code


You are an excellent iOS-Developer with outstanding skills in Swift, well knowing Objective-C


You gained at least 3 years of experience in the implementation of professional mobile projects


You are an enthusiast for technical challenges tweaking the use of third-party APIs and SDKs to maximum stability


You work well inside a team with a strong sense for quality in an agile environment


You have extended experience with Core Data, UIKit, concurrency handling and synchronization of sensitive data via REST-APIs. You are familiar with Unit- and UITests mainly inside Xcode


Experience with complex application architecture and database design is highly preferred, knowledge of other SQL-databases is a plus







Your role

You will be an essential part of a small team of iOS-developers. In close collaboration with the backend engineers you will help building the Tillhub-application for iPads. New features are waiting for your implementation.


Tasks will be planned together with the whole IT-team. You take responsibility in executing them - giving and receiving feedback along the process. We will always help each other to create the best product possible.


Flexibility is a very important factor to satisfy our customers and win new ones. Still we favor maintainability and extensibility over shortcuts - even if we admit that they are sometimes necessary. With your input also planning and documentation will improve.


We use Jira and Confluence, Slack, GitHub, Fabric and CocoaPods.


We aim to replace the majority of the remaining Objective-C legacy code and are looking forward to Swift 4.







We offer


Based in Berlin Kreuzberg, you will be part of our fine international team and shape the success of Tillhub. Your work has direct and noticeable impact on our product. Regular internal tech talks, skill-building events, as well as retrospectives will help you achieve mastery with us. We believe in flat hierarchies, limited meetings and fast honest talk. A monthly feedback day will help you receive valuable feedback from your peers and supervisors. Having awesome team events and a feeling that you change people’s lives all day long complete our offer. In our new and modern office in Kreuzberg, you will be provided with fruits, drinks, fancy chairs and a nice view to our newly built garden.



We are looking forward to meet you!

item.title: Software Engineering Lead - PHP at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We're looking for a passionate full-stack engineer who loves to solve complex problems, learns fast, shares knowledge, and balances generating business value and reducing technical debt. 


Our growing cross-functional engineering teams extend the e-commerce platform with an eye towards efficiency and scalability, impacting the business in real-time. 


You would focus onsupply chain, inventory management, product catalog, or customer-facing applications creating pleasant experiences that exceed customer expectations. 


The Role 



  • Build web-based, PHP centric, applications that are robust, scalable, and elegant  

  • Solve a wide range of challenging business problems extending the competitive advantage that separates Wayfair from other online retailers 

  • Work on a diverse group of systems that covers everything in the web stack – frontend tools, batch and event-driven processing 

  • Work with several large and complex SQL databases and queries 

  • Develop algorithms to streamline back end business workflow 

  • Contribute to architectural and code review discussions impacting our engineering ecosystem 


 
You have 



  • Several years of object oriented web development experience - ideally PHP 

  • Experience working with relational database management systems 

  • Knowledge of HTTP and web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) 

  • Experience and desire to work in an agile environment 

  • Interest in being challenged in a fast-paced environment while having fun 

  • Analytical and creative mindset and passion for solving business problems with technology 

  • Ability to quickly translate business requirements into working features 

  • Good communication skills and willingness to collaborate with other engineering teams


We are looking forward to your application, ideally including code samples (e.g. on GitHub) 


And finally, our proposition to you!




  • Of course the usual competitive salary, bonus and we share the company with you in stock units




  • We contribute to your gym membership and offer free Yoga classes, as well as Wellness Weeks with massages, workshops and other exciting events




  • The opportunity to work cross-functionally and closely with senior leadership not only in the Berlin office, but also with Boston, London and Galway




  • We offer a vast selection of classes through our learn@work program to enhance your professional and personal development.




  • We want you to connect with your team and fellow colleagues through regular social events




  • We’re in the heart of the Berlin startup scene with lots of space to encourage collaboration and teamwork

item.title: OpenStack Cloud System Engineer (m/f) at SysEleven GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Would you be interested in harnessing over 4,000 CPUs, 35 TB RAM and more than 800 TB storage to take an OpenStack cloud to the next level? Then you’ve come to the right place.


As a System Engineer for SysEleven, you will work with committed and passionate people to manage and develop an OpenStack public cloud. We need to tackle the challenges we face in an effective, efficient and highly technical way. What makes our cloud so special is that it complies with the relevant standards: we attract customers with our performance rather than locking them in. To stay constantly up to speed, we undergo regular training in all manner of different areas, including international conferences.


Your tasks:



  • Design, manage and develop our OpenStack cloud platform

  • Automate at all levels, from bare metal through to application management

  • Keep track of everything through good monitoring, alerting and trending

  • Evaluate and commission software and hardware, e.g. SDN, SDS and OpenStack components such as Designate and Kolla

  • Offer new ideas to improve our processes and architecture

  • Join the on-call rotation and help solve emergencies should they arise


Requirements:



  • Several years of experience managing distributed systems with Linux

  • Monitoring and trending experience, e.g. with Prometheus and Grafana

  • Experience of configuration management, e.g. with Ansible

  • Attention to detail

  • Ability to stay calm while solving critical incidents

  • Bonus: Experience with software-defined storage and/or software-defined networking e.g. Open vSwitch or CEPH

  • Bonus: Experience with Kubernetes and/or Docker

item.title: QA Automation Engineer at Signavio (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
What we offer:


So what’s the team like? What started as a university project has grown organically over the last seven years into a distinctly international crew. We keep things open, agile and communicative, with pair programming widely practiced and encouraged. It is all based on trust – no micromanaging, no distributed teams, no nearshoring, no offshoring – face to face communication is premium. That is why the whole development team is located together in one office in beautiful Berlin!


We are constantly evolving and looking to integrate new technologies in our technology stack. We currently:



  • Version with Git

  • Build with Gradle and Webpack

  • Write Java 8 and ECMAScript 6 code

  • Manage with NPM

  • Test with TestNG, Selenium, Mocha and Karma

  • Automate with Jenkins

  • Utilize React and Redux

  • Organize with Scrum and Kanban


You are free to use the OS and IDE of your choice, the tooling you are comfortable with and setup your workspace the way you like it.


Our engineers are self-organized within their teams, working on components and independent projects together and closely with product managers and UX designers. We value your thoughts and ideas and will give you the freedom to push and implement them.


We get that balancing a family and work can be a challenge, so everyone (family or no family) gets flexible work hours. Work when you work best.


We support personal growth, both in and outside of the company. You will gain – and share – knowledge during recurring learning lunches, jours fixes, pizza sessions and our annual code camp.


How you will contribute:


We are looking for a QA Automation Expert to strengthen our development team in Berlin. You will help to continue to develop and improve our leading cloud-based business process modeling, decision modeling and workflow software.


Specifically you will:



  • Drive the QA automation topic at Signavio

  • Discover the requirements of the development and elaborate solutions

  • Develop and enhance automated quality assurance processes during development, test, deployment and operations phase (continuous integration)

  • Improve our test frameworks for backend (Java) as well as frontend (JavaScript) testing

  • Review the work of your teammates


This is you:



  • Solid experience in automating development processes and tests

  • Deep knowledge in working with Jenkins and Selenium

  • Experience in the following programming languages and technologies: Java, JavaScript, Gradle, Tomcat, JSON, XML, TestNG, JBehave

  • Basic knowledge of database systems like MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, IBM DB2

  • Basic experience in using code coverage (jacoco, cobertura) and code analysis tools (FindBugs, Sonar)

  • A degree in an IT-related area

  • The motivation to work in an agile environment

  • The drive to understand the needs of our customers

  • Experience in using Git

  • Very good communication skills in English, German is a plus


Being part of a motivated team with flat hierarchies you know the importance of communication and feedback. You are appreciated for your engagement, your constructive input and your relentless drive to improve yourself, the product, and the company.


What we value most:



  • Be creative and innovative: Push ideas to create a product that our customers love to use, and minimize complexity.

  • Be passionate and create impact: Create amazing work and inspire others with your results.

  • Work independently and responsibly: Take responsibility for your own actions and think about your tasks.

  • Communicate and build trust: Communication is key to achieving our goals efficiently.

  • Be honest and selfless: Admit your own mistakes, be open to feedback, and make time to help your colleagues.
