item.title: Senior Front-End ReactJS Developer at Smart Host (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As  senior front-end engineer you'll be part of an amazing team responsible for our hospitality software solution.


You



  • are proficient in Javascript

  • have an understanding of related technologies, e.g. ReactJS, Redux, Webpack

  • are interested in learning and applying other programming languages

  • understand the fundamentals of networking and browsers

  • care about code quality

  • don't follow hypes blindly, but choose the right tool for the job

  • dig deep to find the root cause of any problem before shifting responsibility

  • constantly cultivate your professional knowledge


You will



  • develop a non-trivial user interface

  • be responsible for your code from design to deployment

  • optimize the UI for speed to deliver the best user experience

  • cooperate with Backend Engineers to create the most efficient API

  • solve occuring challenges on the way to making our customers happy

  • fight emerging complexity in the code by rethinking things from the beginning


We offer



  • a small and highly passionate team of extraordinary co-workers

  • a competetive salary

  • an ability to make significant impact on the company's future

  • high levels of transparency, trust and freedom

  • a casual working environment with flexible working hours

  • an office in the heart of Prenzlauer Berg with a great view on the Berlin TV Tower

item.title: Java Web (AEM) Developer (m/w) in Berlin at pro!vision GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Deine Aufgaben:



  • Als Teil unseres Teams konzipierst und implementierst du komplexe Erweiterungen für die weltweite Marketing-Plattform eines DAX-Konzerns. Die Website hat größte Sichtbarkeit und muss den höchsten nichtfunktionalen Anforderungen genügen wie Hochperformanz, Robustheit, Sicherheit und dabei auf diversen Endgeräten komfortabel funktionieren.

  • Zu den Herausforderungen gehören dabei nicht nur die Applikations- und Darstellungslogiken, sondern auch die optimale Bedienbarkeit für den Redakteur des zugrundeliegenden Java-basierten Web Content Management Systems sowie die Anbindung komplexer Backends und externer Schnittstellen


Du passt zu uns, wenn:



  • du Softwareentwicklung als Passion und nicht nur als Job verstehst

  • du Java und Java-Web-Technologien auf professionellem Niveau beherrscht

  • dir Open Source Frameworks im Java-Web-Umfeld nicht nur bekannt sind, sondern du sie auch effektiv einsetzen kannst

  • dir fachliche Weiterentwicklung wichtig ist und du dich gerne mit Kollegen auf hohem Niveau über technologische Innovationen austauscht

  • du als Backend-Experte auch Frontend-Technologien wie HTML5, CSS3 und JavaScript verstehst

  • du sowohl auf Englisch als auch auf Deutsch sicher kommunizierst


Dich erwartet:



  • die Arbeit in kleinen Expertenteams, die mit Leidenschaft für Technik und hohem Qualitätsanspruch gemeinsam technische Herausforderungen auf Basis neuester Technologien meistern - dabei steht die Kompetenz, nicht Firmenzugehörigkeit oder Hierarchie im Fokus der Organisation

  • Inhouse Entwicklung – also in zwangloser und freundschaflich geprägter Atmosphäre und (weitgehend) ohne Reise-Strapazen und Onsite-Einsätze

  • Selbstorganisation statt starres Management - effektive Zusammenarbeit auf Holacracy Basis

  • Angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre mit ein bis zwei Kollegen anstatt lauten Großraumbüros

  • die Möglichkeit mit anderen talentierten Köpfen auf höchstem Niveau an Projekten mit größtmöglicher Sichtbarkeit bei Top-Kunden zu arbeiten

  • ein umfassendes Weiterbildungsprogramm sowie interne Trainings

  • Arbeiten mit den aktuellsten Technologien und selbstgewähltem Betriebssystem

  • eine gelebte Work-Life-Balance bei freier Arbeitszeiteinteilung und individuellen Arbeitsmodellen

  • wir schätzen deinen Einsatz mit einer tollen Auswahl an kostenlosen Getränken, bezahlten Überstunden und 30 Urlaubstagen sowie mehreren Firmenevents pro Jahr

  • Geschäftsstelle mitten in der City: Berlin-Charlottenburg

item.title: PHP Developer for a digital Right-Service Agency in Berlin at Aperto - An IBM Company (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das erwartet dich



  • Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen

  • Schätzung von Entwickleraufwänden

  • Umsetzung von technischen Anforderungen in PHP

  • Qualitätssicherung und Monitoring der Softwareentwicklung

  • Funktion als Ansprechpartner für technologische Weiterentwicklungen



Das bringst du mit



  • Mehrjährige und einschlägige Berufserfahrung in der Programmierung von Webauftritten

  • Sicherer Umgang in der objektorientierten Programmierung in PHP, CMS Drupal oder TYPO3

  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Drupal Modulen oder TYPO3-Extensions (Extbase, Fluid) sowie mit PHP-MVC-Frameworks (z. B. Symfony, Zend)

  • Sicherer Umgang mit Datenbanken und GIT

  • Continuous Integration (z.B. Jenkins) und Clean Code sind für dich keine Fremdwörter, zudem ist es dein Anspruch, diese Prozesse und Standards ständig zu verbessern

  • Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten und großes Qualitätsbewusstsein

item.title: Senior Software Developer für mailbox.org at Heinlein Support GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
"Mit Kompetenz und Engagement arbeiten wir am sichersten Provider der Welt" lautet die Vision, die sich unser Team von derzeit rund 35 Kollegen an unserem Standort Berlin-Prenzlauer Berg gegeben hat. Teilen Sie unsere Vision? Dann machen Sie mit -- beim Testsieger der Stiftung Warentest.


Für unsere E-Mail-Provider mailbox.org und ox.io und unseren Geschäftsbereich Heinlein Hosting suchen wir Softwareentwickler (m/w) für unsere Webinterfaces und API-Backends, die gerne Verantwortung übernehmen. Besonders für folgende Arbeitsprofile:



  • Softwarearchitektur in PHP und JavaScript

  • Microservices

  • Continous Integration und Deployment

  • Aufbau einer hochskalierenden Plattform für <n> Millionen Nutzer


Ihr Aufgabenfeld


Wir entwickeln Kommunikations- und Sicherheitssoftware für unsere Plattformen und benötigen einen erfahrenen Programmierer für Planung, Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung der passenden Benutzerschnittstellen und zugehörigen Backend-Funktionen. Die Sicherstellung einer hohen Code-Qualität durch Reviews, Unit-Tests und Refactorings gehört genauso zu Ihrem Aufgabenfeld, wie die Analyse und Behebung von Fehlern und Anpassung der Applikation. Sie arbeiten in einem charmanten Team von 5 bis 6 Entwicklern + Teamleitung, unterstützt durch Scrum-Coaching und Projektmanager, sowie durch die Systemadministratoren unserer Plattformen. Ihr Hauptauftraggeber sind unsere Produkt-Teams und Projektmanager aus unserem Haus.


Ihr Profil



  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in PHP und JavaScript (Angular)

  • Arbeitsfähig in Python und bash

  • HTML und CSS (LESS/SASS) gehören für Sie zum Alltagswortschatz

  • Sie beherrschen einen strukturierten Programmierstil und koordinieren sich gut im Team

  • Im Bedarfsfall gehen Sie mit Kunden und Geschäftspartnern sicher und vertrauensvoll um

  • Streben nach steter Steigerung der Code-Qualität durch agile Arbeitsmethoden

  • Interesse an permanenter Fortbildung und Entwicklung

  • Gute Deutsch-Kenntnisse, gute Englisch-Kenntnisse


Zusatzqualifikationen (nicht zwingend erforderlich)



  • Sie können mit Linux umgehen

  • Sie haben Erfahrung mit Microservices


Sinnhaftigkeit, Teamarbeit & Flexibilität


Sinnvolles Arbeiten: Sie sind wesentlich daran beteiligt, mailbox.org zum sichersten E-Mail-Anbieter der Welt auszubauen und so auch in Zukunft eine sichere und freie Kommunikation zwischen unseren Kunden zu ermöglichen. Außerdem unterstützen Sie unseren seit 1989 existierenden ISP JPBerlin.de mit seinen sozial- und politisch engagierten Kunden und Organisationen sowie unsere Geschäftskunden bei Heinlein Hosting. - Wir bieten also einen vielfältigen, interessanten und verantwortungsvollen Arbeitsplatz.


Ein tolles Team: Sie arbeiten in einem kollegialen Team mitten in Berlin. Eigeninitiative und Mitdenken werden bei uns besonders unterstützt -- auf offene Kommunikation und Kollegialität legen wir großen Wert. Mindestens zwei Teamevents im Jahr und eine wöchentliche Mittags-Kochrunde freuen alle Kollegen, die dabei sein wollen.


Lebenslanges Lernen: Unsere hauseigene Heinlein Akademie lockt mit spannenden Fortbildungen Admins aus ganz Europa nach Berlin – und bietet für uns selbst natürlich ebenso zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, Neues zu erlernen und Vorhandenes zu vertiefen.


Sehr gute Rahmenbedingungen: Flexibilität in der Arbeitszeit für die Verbindung von Familie und Beruf sind für uns selbstverständlich. Ein angemessenes Gehalt, Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Freizeitausgleich, wenn es mal hoch her ging, gehören für uns genauso dazu wie eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre, frisches Obst und unser Masseur, der einmal die Woche vorbeikommt.


Ihre Bewerbung


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung). Diese richten Sie bitte ausschließlich per E-Mail mit PDF/JPG-Anhängen (keine MS-Word-Dokumente) an jobs@heinlein-support.de.


Ihr Ansprechpartner bei Fragen ist der Teamleiter der Developer, Yan Minagawa. Sie erreichen ihn telefonisch unter: 030 / 405051-60.

item.title: (Senior) C#/.Net Software Developer (f/m) at Chal-Tec GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At Wayfair, we are looking to grow our Site Reliability Engineering team by bringing on board a talented Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) to help manage the large scale physical and virtual server environment that underpins our global e-commerce platform.

Though the focus of this team is Linux, due to the nature of our platforms you will be involved with and exposed to a wide variety of systems. This team owns a large portion of our customer facing systems and services, and as such are heavily involved in the architecture, growth, and improvement of our various platforms.

Ever wondered what it would like to work at ‘internet scale’? At Wayfair we are dealing with internet scale challenges on a daily basis. With our traffic doubling year over year consistently we are faced with some pretty exciting and interesting challenges!


Some projects the team is currently working on in 2017:



  • Create and improve tools to aid in monitoring and control of our systems

  • Enhance our infrastructure to support a variety of different disaster recovery options

  • Expansion of current physical data centers

  • Migrating targeted applications, sites, systems to cloud platforms

  • Improving automation of systems, processes, and services

  • Looking to the future - containers? Mesos?




Responsibilities include:



  • Taking POC Systems and preparing them for production use by applying our standards to them and making them immutable

  • Provide the highest level of technical escalation within the organization of our critical production platforms

  • Improve security and performance of infrastructure

  • Automate, Automate, Automate

  • Provide Architecture & Design feedback for all production platforms, as well as for other teams with in the organization

  • Proactively monitor systems to anticipate business needs before they become critical path

  • Thinking of what is the next big infrastructure thing




Qualifications:



  • 5+ Years experience in a SRE/DevOps type role

  • Experience managing Linux in a large scale environment

  • Experience working with Linux automation tools, such as Puppet, Chef, etc.

  • Knowledge of Web Servers (Apache/Nginx)

  • Familiarity with load balancing tools and techniques (HAProxy, etc)

  • Experience working in virtualized environments

  • Experience working with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)

  • Scripting ability particularly in Bash, PHP, Python or Ruby




Other traits we look for:



  • Good interpersonal and team building skills

  • An easy-going attitude and sense of humor

  • A positive, people-oriented and energetic attitude

  • A strong drive to learn and try new things

  • An analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems

  • An interest in being challenged in a fast-paced environment, and having fun while doing it

item.title: Senior AI Architect (JVM, Machine & Deep Learning) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact

As Zalando transforms from a pure online retailer to a fashion platform, we bring fashion competency and branding expertise to the game by connecting all the players in the industry: consumers, stylists, designers, brands, influencers, and, online and offline stores. By providing a bold mix of global brands, local designers and specialist labels, we create fresh concepts, high-impact campaigns, smart applications and innovative partnerships.

We are now searching for a Senior AI Architect to join our Search & Personalisation department. In this role, you will create an overarching AI strategy and drive our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.



You Are Setting Standards

Vision. You'll define the strategy and roadmap for analytics, deep learning frameworks, and pioneer the vision to the organization.

Implementation. As part of a growing, multi-disciplinary team of Data Scientists and Research Engineers you'll build AI architecture and develop solutions to reinforce the value of data and analytics.

Hands-on. You'll provide hands-on support to complex business and technology piloting projects in order to apply theory to solve real-world problems.

Mission. You'll cultivate and disperse knowledge and best practices on AI architecture and design development within the engineering team.

Ownership.You'll be the owner of Zalando's Global AI architecture documentation and ensure its consistency and alignment with various engineering stakeholders.

Team play. You'll embrace architecture development as a collective effort and share your knowledge through coaching, peer reviews, articles, and tech talks.



You Are

Passionate about Deep Learning. You are a proud PhD degree holder in Computer Science, Computer Architecture, Deep Learning or a related field.

Experienced (on a senior level). You can impress us with 12+ years of professional hands-on experience as a (senior) engineer and architect. Your experience is derived from distributed large scale applications requiring research integrations, such as search and personalization or price forecasting systems.

Polyglot. You bring an expert level programming skills with Java and JVM based languages, like Scala, and ideally Python.

Skilled. You have experience in one or more of the following areas: artificial intelligence, large-scale data mining and machine learning, (including a solid understanding of DL fundamentals).

Enthusiastic about solving hard business problems. You love data and analytics in balance with open source technologies.

Armed with soft skills. Your effective communication skills paired with your strong analytical competence allows you to simplify complex information and problems.



You Will Benefit From

Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.



Want To Join Us?

If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact us via email: Magdalena Masluk-Meller.

item.title: Senior iOS Engineer at Babbel (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior iOS developer (full-time) to join our office in Berlin, Germany.


Who we are:
With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms.


How we work:
Our agile delivery teams are working in full-stack and feature teams involving disciplines from product management, user interface design, user experience research, analytics and engineering. Due to the growth our multi-team environment is scaling fast while we are adopting agile values, management and engineering practices.


Who we are looking for:
You are a passionate, experienced and pragmatic iOS engineer who has proven skills in creating innovative apps with modern and elegant user interfaces. You have a strong knack for problem solving and want to change the future of language learning while working in a challenging environment. Working together with ambitious colleagues you are eager to collaborate and dive into different disciplines to broaden your knowledge in other fields of expertise as well as share your own. Contributing to a great architecture and building the base of an easily extendable and well maintainable application is something you enjoy and take pride in.


Responsibilities for the role:



  • Deliver high quality apps from designing and iterating new features into production in a short sprint cycle

  • Independently build, maintain and take on ownership of complex features sets and frameworks

  • Collaborate cross-functionally to inform API design and architectural decisions

  • Maintain and make use of a good overview of the overall technology stack an infrastructure

  • Shape, facilitate and survey coding guidelines and quality standards

  • Manage technical debt

  • Independently focus on continuous learning and improvement and drive the evolution of our engineering practices

  • Support and coach Junior and Professional engineers to expedite their development


Requirements:  



  • 2+ years of experience with Swift, 5+ years of Objective-C

  • Multiple successful apps in an app store

  • Excellent understanding of mobile platforms and their unique features concerning technology and user experience

  • Excellent engineering practices including design patterns, testing and continuous integration

  • Confidence in driving architectural decisions

  • Proficiency in long term maintenance of complex code bases and handling of legacy code

  • Experience with REST-based APIs

  • Excellent communication skills in terms of moderating dialogues and managing conflicts

  • Solid understanding of lean and agile practices

  • Fluency in written and spoken English


  Benefits:



  • The potential to change the way of learning for millions of users worldwide

  • Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth

  • Potential within a fast growing team

  • Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags

  • A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours

  • Long-term prospects

  • A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities

  • Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene

  • Great company benefits (High-End company bike, fresh fruits & drinks, Hackathons etc.)


Check out our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression of how we work at Babbel!

item.title: Senior Java Backend Developer (m/f) at eGym GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
eGym is looking for a talented, passionate, and resourceful Senior Java Backend Developer who wants to bring fitness to the 21st century. Do you have 3 years of experience? Come join our team in Berlin.


Your daily workout



  • As a part of one of our agile, cross-functional teams you will work on different parts of the eGym ecosystem with a focus on our backend mainly living in the Java world

  • Typical tasks involve work on the API, design of backend functionalities and their architecture, decision making on technology and putting them into production

  • You choose the right tools to solve these challenges, with a great degree of freedom in how to architect your solutions. This includes optimal use of the latest choice of technologies in e.g. microservices, containers, databases and new programming languages and best practices (e.g. TDD, Code reviews, continuous delivery)

  • Developers’ responsibility does not end with design and implementation, but also includes running services and taking end-to-end responsibility. This includes DevOps tasks in our cloud-based infrastructure using technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes and Google Compute Engine


Your fitness level

  • You feel comfortable with Linux both on servers and workstations and appreciate test-driven design as well as test automation

  • You know your way around best practices, tools and frameworks to effectively deliver RESTful web services, efficient data storage and great software in general

  • You get excited by the idea of a fast paced environment, driven by Continuous Integration and Delivery

item.title: Engineering Manager for Wikidata & Wikipedia at Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wikimedia Deutschland – Gesellschaft zur Förderung Freien Wissens e. V. is a non-profit organisation based in Berlin, Germany. With more than 80 employees and about 50.000 members, it is the oldest and largest of more than 40 independent chapters of the international Wikimedia movement. The most well-known Wikimedia project, the free online encyclopedia Wikipedia, is used by millions of people across the world every day and is continuously updated and improved by millions of users.


Wikimedia Deutschland furthers these ideals even beyond the free encyclopedia: It is our aim to establish and promote the creation, collection, and distribution of free knowledge in all parts of society. Our objective is to create a world in which the sum of all human knowledge is freely accessible for everyone. The main focus of our activities is the support of volunteers, the development of technology and software, public education, and cooperation with cultural and scientific institutions. We grant scholarships to volunteers working for Wikimedia projects and we provide technical support. On both the national and EU-level, we are advocating a legal framework which allows for free knowledge to become part of our everyday life.


Engineering Manager at Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. support engineers and designers who build features, products and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. As experienced and hands-on Engineering Manager you enable our communities to achieve our Vision: a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.


You will join our Software Development Department where we work on Wikidata, a free collaborative, free licenced database to store the knowledge of the world. We also developing technical products & features for the german speaking Wikipedia. You’ll supporting teams that work on exciting open source technologies like the Wikidata Query Service. Our Software Engineers working on ambitious projects like Wikidata, the Technical Wishlist and the local Fundraising.


As an Engineering Manager, we’d like you to do these things



  • Organize teams to be effective in meeting their goals

  • Develop goals and track progress publicly and collaboratively

  • Represent team members within the organization and publicly

  • Coordinate with other teams and departments and take care of agile engineering processes

  • Support your team’s members to develop their individual career paths

  • Recruit and hire new team members

  • Write code for our products and projects with our Developers and Engineers


What we are offering you



  • We have internal presentations by our developers on topics they are enthusiastic about

  • You can attend local user groups during work time and you are encouraged to do so

  • You will have a noticeable impact on one of the top four visited websites in the world

  • We regularly go to conferences, both as attendees and participants


Our development teams are cross-functional, self-organizing and highly autonomous. No single team leaders or middle management. You’ll be working directly with the product owner. Among other things, testing, refactoring, and pair programming are encouraged. We’re constantly trying to improve the way we work.


All software we develop is Open Source, and we contribute back to various projects we use. Many of our components are published in a format that allows reuse outside of our own projects.

item.title: 4 Senior Java Developer - bring more sun and wind to the power grid (f/m) at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Are you keen to help shape future power supply?


Are you passionate about writing clean code?


Are you a team player for all aspects of the development process?


Then this job is for you


As a lead Java developer at Younicos, you will work on our Y.Q platform, which monitors, supervises and controls various electrical grid connected systems like batteries, pv plants, wind farms, thermal generators, transformers, switch gears and auxiliary systems. The development of the Y.Q platform, which runs as 24/7 service on site, is based on OSGi technology and a distributed, messaging-based architecture. Specialized subsystems ensure the optimal control of the electrical components and implement technical interfaces for transmission line operators, energy providers and remote monitoring.


As part of an agile team (Scrum) you will work on all aspects of the software development. Strongly modularized system architecture, documentation of the system specifications, test driven Java implementation, fully automated integration testing and building the final product are your day-to-day tasks. Depending on your skills and interests you might work on the core architecture and design of the Y.Q platform, the interface abstraction for the integration of new components, the development of algorithms, the design and development of an API for external systems to give you some ideas.


All developments are performed in close collaboration with our technical engineers to understand and implement the technical requirements of the electrical equipment. With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.


Your profile


From personal point of view:



  • A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea win

  • Exceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracy

  • Basic understanding of the principles of electrical engineering is a plus

  • Basic German is a plus


From the technical point of view a must is



  • Significant expertise in Java and experience of other higher programming languages

  • Intuitive understanding of software architecture and design

  • Desire for writing and testing clean, efficient and reliable code


Welcome is



  • Experience with OSGi, Apache Karaf and Apache Camel or similar technologies

  • Experience with ActiveMQ and Google Protocol Buffers or other messaging middleware

  • Expert knowledge of MySQL and/or time series database like TICK stack or Prometheus

  • Experience in micro services

  • Experience with BDD/TDD and test automation


Our offer



  • The opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy shares

  • Motivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things done

  • Open discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your work

  • Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

  • Permanent contract

item.title: Agile/Ruby - Team Lead (m/f) at Helpling GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a hands on Agile/Ruby - Team Lead (m/f) to boost one of our tech-teams to the next level.


How we work



  • We work as a team, supporting and trusting each other to achieve our goals together

  • Our teams are cross-functional: backend and frontend devs, QA, UX/UI designer and a PM

  • Our teams are split by KPIs and are responsible to measure and improve metrics across all possible platforms: web (mobile and desktop) as well as mobile apps

  • Every quarter, each of our teams presents a roadmap aligned with its own KPIs

  • We follow Scrum as working framework and we encourage short iterations (1 week sprints)

  • We promote a strong testing culture as a part of our DNA

  • Our technology stack includes Ruby on Rails, Postgres, Redis, Rspec, Capybara, Webpack, Babel, React, Redux, React-router, Sass, Postcss, Jest, Sinon and Chai

  • We deploy up to 10 times a day to Heroku and AWS through a Continuous Delivery pipeline

  • We use Vagrant and SaltStack to have a reproducible working environment in a few minutes

  • 12 out of 12 at Joel test


Who we are looking for



  • You enjoy taking part in shaping ideas to meet business requirements as well as defining technical solutions

  • You are an ego-less experienced leader who enjoys giving constructive feedback to empower your team

  • You are a data-driven and goal-oriented person that feels comfortable working autonomously

  • You are happy being an active driver of the prioritization process to make great ideas come true

  • You have at least 2 years of experience on a similar role to join our team


What we offer



  • Helpling is one of the most exciting start-ups in the heart of Berlin with a disruptive product and well backed by investors of international renown

  • You will work in an international team with flat hierarchies and short communication channels in which your work can have a real impact for Helpling everyday

  • We support your personal and professional development with challenging projects and a personal conference budget

  • Free drinks, fruits and cereals, office parties, team events, BBQs, kicker & table tennis


If you consider yourself ready for this challenging opportunity and your technical knowledge matches the described environment, we are looking forward to receive your convincing application in English (resume, cover letter, references and certificates) including your availability and salary expectations.


Please send it via Stackoverflow or directly to katharina.prien@helpling.com.

item.title: Tech Lead Ruby for Team Cards (f/m) at solarisBank AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
solarisBank is the world’s first banking platform. Our goal is to empower finance pioneers - anyone who wants to build something new with banking services. The core of the company is fast, modern technology that makes our banking services quick to setup and simple to build with. We see ourselves as a tech company with a full banking license. Our international team of 90+ colleagues combines digital focus, tech expertise and banking experience. Whether you're a full-stack developer, banker or astronaut, if you're ready to change banking, reach out to us. We love what we do and love our team. 


Tech as a team together with Product is the agile heartbeat of the company and as engineers we collaborate end-2-end within the company to build great products for our partners and end customers. It is our pride to build state of the art, elegant, straight forward software and it is our professional ambition to deliver value in high quality as early as possible in a sustainable way. The products we deliver are resilient, scalable and performant.


As a principal member and a strategic partner of MasterCard, solarisBank is not only working on issuing today’s standard card products but will also work on innovative card products together with MasterCard. The main tech stack is ruby, the API is end-2-end tested and continuously deployed.


Your Role:



  • Your primary job is to work as a Software Engineer in the solarisBank tech team.

  • As a Tech Lead you run one of our small, autonomous, self­-organized scrum product development or productivity teams in order to create, develop, maintain backend / frontend products and services.

  • You have experiences in the areas of Backend / APIs and Frontend / JS as well as System Design or DevOps

  • You have the strong will and ability to learn fast and you are able to explain complex matters to different audiences

Our Organization:



  • We are a tech company with a banking license and we change banking forever. We combine the best from the digital world with our unique tech-enabled platform banking approach.

  • Take a deep breath – and get ready to grow at the speed of light: We're a young company and you can shape our destiny from day one.

  • You’ll join a team of experts from tech, entrepreneurship and banking. It's an exclusive combination you'll find in few places other than solarisBank.

  • We're growing rapidly – and you will grow with us. We have a true hands-on mentality which creates lots of opportunities for individual growth.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f) at Vehiculum (Berlin, Deutschland)

The road for us is clear: we will expand our business and become the leading platform for vehicle leasing in 2017. Our international team is growing rapidly and we are therefore looking for a  


Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f)

  • Agile development and modern project management following the Kanban approach

  • Support our business analysts with db reports, ad hoc queries etc.

item.title: Senior Android Developer with Backend Skills at WeltN24 GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Our goal is to become the leading multimedia news corporation for high quality journalism in Germany and an essential part of achieving this goal is to work with the best developers. Are you a passionate system engineer that can think outside of the box? Are you interested in working in an agile environment? If the answer is yes then we are looking for you to strengthen our international cross-functional teams.


Your Challenge



  • Join the Mobile Natives: A fast moving cross-functional team of backend and native mobile Android and iOS developers!

  • We build the top rated, 4-5 stars WELT Edition and WELT News apps with more than 10 million visits per month

  • We use latest tech available with Kotlin, Dagger 2, RetroFit 2, Glide, Espresso and more and are always eager to try new things, finding the best solutions

  • We completely automated our build, testing and release process and are constantly pushing the level of automation

  • We embrace and support open-source development

  • We build the top-reliable, scalable backend to enable our apps connecting us to other services in the WeltN24 micro services architecture

  • We implement, manage and support our own Spring Boot based fully-tested services running on Amazon Web Services (AWS) using Docker

  • We rely on our full automation of the infrastructure, extended monitoring and best resilience to deliver the best user experience to our customers


Your Profile



  • You are a talented Senior Android developer with at least five years of experience, having successfully delivered several big, real-life projects

  • You have skills and interest in backend development with cloud services like AWS using Docker

  • You write test-driven code in Java or Kotlin and use build tools like Gradle

  • You are passionate about sharing, challenging and improving your knowledge and skills in a heterogenic, cross-functional team

  • You love to stay ahead of the market by learning, evaluating and using the latest technologies

  • Optional: You have some experience with backend infrastructure automation using Terraform or CloudFormation


What we offer:

You will be given the opportunity to deploy your current strengths and gain additional ones. In an agile and highly qualified team, you will work on the newest media technologies in a modern office in the heart of Berlin. A variety of seminars and workshops give you the opportunity to develop your specialized skill-set and your knowledge of comprehensive issues. Besides that, various conferences and TechTalks as well as our regular exchange with subsidiaries of Axel Springer (e.g. Zanox, idealo, KaufDa and Immonet) provide an opportunity to build a valuable network.


Moreover: You will have flexible working hours and above average number of vacation days, and a generous subsidy in our four on-site restaurants every day. Furthermore, a MacBook Pro with Apple Cinema Display, which can also be used privately, will be placed at your disposal.


Apply now.



Contact:

Questions regarding this position (reference number 015700105) will be answered gladly by:
Stefanie Neckel; stefanie.neckel@weltn24.de


 
WELTN24 emphasizes equal opportunities. We welcome the applications of people with disabilities, whose integration is an important matter to us.


Join us at WeltN24 GmbH

item.title: Test Automation Engineer (m/f) at Takeaway.com (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We - Lieferando.de and Takeaway.com - are one of the leading online food-delivery platforms in Europe and are looking for a Test Automation Engineer to join our multinational and multicultural technology division. You are not only your team’s dedicated specialist when it comes to further automating Takeaway.com’s testing landscape but you also play a pivotal role in measuring the quality of their products. Your detail orientation, logical reasoning and improvement focus make you the testing expert that your team can rely on. As a quick learner and excellent communicator, you not only position yourself as a knowledgeable sparring partner for your QA peers, but also as a subject-matter expert for our broader developer community.


The Role



  • Expand our test automation framework for our web and mobile applications

  • Work closely with our developers to create automated tests for new features

  • Actively participate in the software development cycle in an agile and cross-functional team

  • Share knowledge and coordinate test efforts with other test engineers

  • Maintain, monitor and expand existing testing processes


Job requirements



  • You bring 2+ years of working experience in a software test-automation framework (e.g. Selenium Web Driver or Appium)

  • You have proven knowledge of any programming language (e.g. Java)

  • You are familiar with MySQL databases

  • You have superior English communication skills (written and spoken); German and/or Dutch language skills are very welcome

  • You approach your job with an open mind, both towards technologies as well as towards people

  • You relish working in a team and enjoy collaborating and sharing knowledge with your peers

  • You are persistent and resilient – the more difficult the challenge, the more motivated you are to sink your teeth into it

  • You are relentlessly curious and demonstrate initiative to continuously improve yourself and us


What we offer



  • The freedom to go where no one in our company has gone before

  • Work in a fast-growing company

  • Being part of a young, professional and international team

  • A competitive salary

  • Custom work stations/laptops (Mac/Linux/PC)

  • Internal as well as external schoolings and conferences

  • Awesome team events

  • Free drinks and fruits and several sporty benefits


Are you ready to join?


Send us your application documents in English with the subject “Test Automation Engineer”. Please, don’t forget to mention your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.


We are looking forward to receiving your application!


jobs@lieferando.de

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Kubernetes/AWS) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

Zalando is transforming from an e-commerce company into a multi-service platform that provides fashion as a service. We make it our mission to imagine and predict the infinite points of interaction between fashion and people, and develop the technology to make them possible. The 1,600+ members of Zalando Technology across our offices in Germany, Ireland and Finland build most of our 40+ platform products in-house and open source - from Smart Logistics to Brand Solutions to Payments and Warehouse Management.

At the core of our platform effort is the technical infrastructure - we work with a modern, cloud-native technology stack comprised of Kubernetes, Docker, AWS and Go. We offer our infrastructure as a service to more than 200 development teams in Zalando Tech that are running their applications on our clusters. Read our Kubernetes on AWS doc to learn how we run Kubernetes on AWS in production and check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.

YOUR ROLE
  • Working on the line between Software Engineering and Systems Engineering
  • Curious and a step ahead when it comes to software trends
  • A natural leader who takes ownership of the team's deliveries
  • Willing to take responsibility for running an important part of our infrastructure


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  • Proficiency in at least one high-level programming language, knowing Go is a plus
  • In-depth understanding of UNIX/Linux system internals and TCP/IP networking
  • Well-versed in scripting (Bash/Python) and infrastructure automation
  • Good knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms and data structures)
  • A track record of running large-scale systems
  • Knowing containers, especially Docker, Kubernetes and AWS is a big plus
  • Cloud native mindset, including microservices, resilience and scale-out


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US
  • Open Source. We work on open source software and actively participate in the Kubernetes community
  • Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 100+ internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events
  • Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice
  • Personal Development. Tour of Mastery (individual growth plan), extensive onboarding program, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences
  • Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Maria Garcia.

item.title: Senior Devops Engineer ( m/f) at orderbird AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
You love solving complex inter-disciplinary backend challenges. You automate anything you might possibly have to do twice. You get things done and own what you build. You don't agree to the status quo. You're a craftsman and embrace failure as an essential part of success. You take people for who they are and celebrate diversity. Does this sound like you? Read on.


Your goals: 



  • Dream, plan and build new parts of our infrastructure.

  • Improve our resilience to inevitable failures.

  • Extend our CI/CD pipelines to push code to production faster and safer.

  • Improve our monitoring platforms and use this data as a source for further optimization of our backend.

  • Work in an agile team of highly-skilled engineers to transform the hospitality industry.


What you won't do:



  • Boring and routine maintenance tasks. That's what robots are for.

  • Sit in pointless meetings. Your time is better spent doing things you like.

  • Have a complicated job title and report to someone you don't actually know. We have a flat hierarchy and want to keep it that way.


What you bring to the team: 



  • You have passion for what you do and you're nice to hang out with.

  • AWS experience.

  • Experience in relational and NoSQL databases. PostgreSQL and MongoDB experience is a plus.

  • Experience managing large-scale, fully-automated infrastructure-as-code landscapes (We use Terraform, Packer, Ansible and Jenkins).

  • Professional experience in at least one object-oriented programming language (we use Python in our backend).

  • Experience designing high-traffic, fault-tolerant systems at global scale.

  • An analytical mindset and a get-it-done attitude.

What we offer you:

  • Flexible working hours and home office opportunities once a week.

  • Modern equipment for your daily work.

  • Drinks for free and a chef who cooks freshly for us every day.

  • Beautiful and modern office, centrally and easily accessible by public transport.

  • Regular events and events, like our Company Breakfast every Wednesday: The breakfast serves as an ideal platform to introduce new employees, to provide department updates and to present news about our company

Glispa is the right company for you if you’re looking for:

item.title: Cloud Systems Developer m/f at Cloudreach (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak 30 languages.

Our mission at Cloudreach is to "enable innovation". We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It's not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.



What does the Cloud Enablement team do ?

The Cloud Enablement team is responsible for implementing innovative solutions for major clients who are moving to cloud platforms, built principally within AWS and Microsoft Azure.


How will you spend your days ?



  • Adventures in developing cloud-native distributed systems, container orchestration platforms, microservice and serverless architectures, and immutable infrastructure delivery mainly in AWS or Azure.

  • Orchestration and automation of build and deployment processes, continuous integration and application configuration management.

  • Using automation and configuration management tooling (Puppet, Chef, Ansible) to ensure compliance and ongoing operation of large estates.

  • Migrations of legacy workloads to transform and shape them into dynamic, resilient and scalable platforms -- helping clients to make the most of the cloud.

  • Working with reputable clients and stakeholders to identify requirements and take these from design through to build and beyond.


What kind of career progression can you expect ?



  • You can grow into a Systems Developer Lead, a Cloud Architect or a Cloud Consultant.

  • There are opportunities for relocation in our other cloudy hubs.


How to stand out ?



  • Passion and enthusiasm for technology and its adoption.

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar STEM subject.

  • Software development experience and/or automation in Python, Ruby, or Go -- but talk to us if you love to hack in any language.

  • Experience with cloud ecosystems, from requirements analysis all the way to operations in AWS or Azure.

  • You automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn't update each one manually, right?

  • Systems administration skills -- you'll probably prefer a command line to a GUI.

  • Fluent in German and very good English level.


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)

  • Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.

  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.

  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

  • Monthly meal vouchers which you can use at local restaurants and supermarkets. Enjoy, it's on us!

  • Private medical and dental care package in addition to the German statutory health care.

  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer at Kialo (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Sick of the Internet Shouting Factory? Endless circular commenting threads? Trolls derailing conversations with ad hominems?


So are we.


Welcome to Kialo, the purpose-built tool for critical thinking, thoughtful discussion, and collaborative decision-making.


After an overwhelming response to our initial launch, we are now looking to massively extend our team of highly skilled software engineers to take on the challenges of building and improving a highly scalable web app.


You are thinking on your feet, always coming up with new ideas for applying technology to solve problems? You are designing and living in code? And above all that, you know how to play in a team, because only in a collaborative environment the best ideas can become a reality? In that case we invite you to show off your wizardry of JS, your command of the Python, your dark arts of Unix and to unit test the hell out of it.


What we expect from you:



  • You know either JavaScript or Python 3 by heart. Or both, all the better. Even know React and Tornado? Visit us! Pretty please with TypeScript on top!

  • You have a strong opinion about Java, in whatever direction. We don’t use it, btw.

  • Ain’t no SQL. But we’re fine with Postgres, if you insist. Anyway, you know how to store the data. And find it. And read it. You got the idea.

  • You know how to work with and in the cloud.

  • You never stop to learn. We always try out new things, so you better keep up! And we’d love to see even more ideas for even newer things from you.

  • You will plan, design, code, debug, review, test, teach and be taught in a team. Software engineering is a group activity and you can and want to play the game how it’s meant to be played.

  • You are passionate about software. Our team is highly skilled, and we expect no less from you. You love and breathe the code.

  • You know what an argument is. You know how to discuss in a friendly and thoughtful way. You are not afraid to speak out your opinion. That’s what we do.


What you can and should expect from us:



  • We have a tech-stack that is fun to work with. And it’s not carved in stone. If you want to work with something else, just build a prototype and convince us.

  • We use the tools that make us efficient. Slack, Jira, Hangouts, GitHub, IntelliJ, Jenkins to name a few. You know about better ones? Please tell us about it.

  • We have an agile process that is tailored to what a developer needs. We do Scrum - automated tests and code reviews included.

  • We give you all the chances to grow and step up your game.

  • We will move to a really, really nice office in the heart of Berlin in April 2018, designed for software development right from the start. With a race track. And without noisy open floor plans. How the heck should anyone think in something like that?

  • We offer hardware of your choosing: Lenovo, MacBook, Razer, Raspberry, you name it. And we pack a pair of funky noise cancelling headphones on top.

  • Drinks, coffee, ice cream, sweets, fruit and at least one lunch a week for free. Ok, working with us may be a minor hazard to your healthy diet.

  • We are the unique opportunity to build and influence a radically new, world-changing thing right at the core. We will always listen to your ideas. Promise.

Job with meaning!


Do you care WHAT you do and WHO you work for?


Become a part of us.


Business Keeper AG is the IT-company with a social claim. Our tools are helping to fight corporate crime such as corruption and money laundering. We stand for ethical and sustainable management. At present we are extending our applications.


Become part of an innovative, sustainably growing company located in the heart of Berlin. We are offering an independent working environment, diverse projects, fast decision-making processes, flexible working hours and interesting benefits.


Support our international team, where code quality, code reviews and test coverage are of consistently high importance.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (FinTech, Scala, Spark, Flink & Kafka) at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact

At Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.

As a Senior Data Engineer at Zalando Payments, you'll help us to shape the data infrastructure that supports our risk assessment models, responsible for processing Billions of euros every year. You'll be involved into defining the data architecture and given the freedom to select the right mix of technologies to solve whichever problems come your way.

Your profile



  • You are experienced processing data at scale, in batches and streams

  • Spark, Flink, Kafka, Apache Drill and others are your tools of trade

  • You are experienced with RDBMS, NoSQL databases, and have an in-depth understanding of the consistency and availability guarantees they provide.

  • You understand the properties of large distributed systems

  • You are keen on understanding the business which your systems will enable and able to balance pragmatism and vision




You Are Setting Standards

Variety. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions that possibly impact millions of customers.
Autonomy. Based on our Microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).
Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.
Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

You Are
Skilled. In working with production-ready code in at least one JVM language (preferably Scala) and have prior experience in the big data technology landscape. E.g. databases, No-SQL data stores, distributed systems, big data processing frameworks (preferably with Spark)
Courageous. In taking ownership and being accountable for the results of your decisions.
Motivated. In making a positive impact on our engineering culture and encouraging knowledge sharing.
Ambitious. In delivering products that re-define the customer experience and making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation.

You Benefit From

Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.
Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.
Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.
Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Taryn Louise Bonugli

At Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.

You Are
Skilled. In working with Java 8 or Scala and relational as well as NoSQL databases. You understand the properties of large distributed systems. Experience or knowledge in a stream processing frameworks such as Flink, Spark Streaming, Samza, etc.
Courageous. In taking ownership and being accountable for the results of your decisions.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at FreightHub GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At FreightHub we are building the backbone of global trade and as part of the engineering team you are working on the core of that mission every day. Based on a cutting edge stack, consisting of MongoDB, NodeJs, TypeScript, React and Docker, our goal is to digitize this industry - one step more with every release.


We define ourselves as a customer-centric team that enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. Daily releases, a high degree of test automation and constant application monitoring is our standard. We strive to optimize our workflows, architecture and infrastructure every month because we know that there is always room to improve.


To give you an idea, these are some example of what engineers at FreightHub are doing:



  • We build quoting and routing algorithms to calculate prices for moving goods globally, e.g. what does it cost and how long does it take to move 150 bikes from Taiwan to Berlin via airplane, ship or railway?

  • We ingest live tracking data of ships, trucks and airplanes to infer meaningful actions on the supply chain, e.g. re-routing shipments when a ship arrives late.

  • We automate processes to lift the degree of automation from 5% to 90% - killing faxes, emails and phone calls from logistics once and for all.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer for a Fast-Growing AdTech Company at LiveIntent (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll work in an agile environment with talented, cross-functional teams to design, implement, and iterate on products that satisfy customer needs and drive company growth. Our tech stack runs on a Linux foundation and includes Scala, Akka, Node.js, DynamoDB and PostgreSQL. As a senior engineer you will help promulgate good design and coding practices, leading by example while at the same time gaining valuable experience. You will be responsible for the design, implementation, and delivery of products that fuel every part of the business.


What we offer:



  • Private office in a shared working environment at WeWork

  • Located very central location at Potsdamer Platz next to Tiergarten

  • Talented group of people to work with

  • Playstation for after work fun

  • A friendly international team

  • Subsidized gym membership

  • Free beer tap


Skills & Requirements


Our Ideal Candidate:



  • Is passionate about solving complex problems in running scalable, high volume real-time systems

  • Has a strong computer science foundation with a deep understanding of modern programming languages such as Scala, Java and Python.

  • Has at least four years experience designing, building and deploying production software.

  • Is curious about technology and builds projects on the side just to try new stuff out.

  • Developed with web frameworks such as Play, Node.js, Rails or similar

  • Has experience designing, building, and maintaining elegant, scalable software solutions.

  • Is dedicated to driving results while maintaining high software quality.

  • Has experience working with both relational and NoSQL databases.

  • Enjoys collaborating with different teams around the globe

  • Worked with AWS services like kinesis, lambda and beanstalk.

  • Du selbständig und ergebnisorientiert arbeitest

  • Du über sehr gute Deutsch- sowie Englischkenntnisse verfügst

  • Den Blick über den eigenen Tellerrand

Als Teil unseres Teams wirst Du

Wir bieten Dir



  • Einen spannenden Job mit der Option immer wieder etwas Neues zu lernen

  • Individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

  • Eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance

item.title: Softwareentwickler (w/m) für Embedded / WLAN at AVM GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Dein Herz schlägt für die Embedded Entwicklung rund um drahtlose Kommunikation?


Prima! AVM kann Dir alles bieten, um es noch höher schlagen zu lassen: Verantwortung ab Tag eins. Automatisierte Testumgebung für mehr Spaß beim Entwickeln. Und Experten an Deiner Seite, die Dich bei diesen Herausforderungen unterstützen:



  • Systemnahe Programmierung für Linux-Embedded-Plattformen im WLAN-Team

  • Integration und Pflege von WLAN-Treibern und Systemkomponenten in die FRITZ!-Produkte

  • Arbeiten mit den neuesten Technologien im Bereich WLAN und deren Übertragung auf FRITZ!-Produkte

  • Umsetzung komplexer Anforderungen in modulare Strukturen und robuste Software

  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Hardware-, Kernel- und Networking-Team


Skills & Requirements


Wir suchen jemanden wie Dich:


Du hast ein Auge fürs Detail. Und eins für das große Ganze: Denn als Softwareentwickler arbeitest Du innerhalb eines Teams von 14 Kollegen an der WLAN-Revolution –  dem flächendeckenden Durchbruch der Gigabit-Grenze. Du besitzt eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke, die Du auch fachbereichsübergreifend erfolgreich zur Umsetzung Deiner Aufgaben einsetzt. Dazu bringst Du noch einen kreativen Erfindergeist mit und erfüllst die folgenden Voraussetzungen:



  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eines verwandten Studienganges

  • Begeisterung für den Einsatz von WLAN im Heimnetz

  • Know-how in der Softwareprogrammierung mit C erforderlich sowie mit C++ und Perl/Python von Vorteil

  • Erste Erfahrung im Bereich Linux Kernel oder in der Applikationsentwicklung wünschenswert

  • Idealerweise Kenntnisse in hardwarenaher Systemprogrammierung (Kernel-Driver Entwicklung) und strukturiertem Schnittstellen-Design

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse, hohe Problemlösungskompetenz und ein analytisches Denkvermögen

  • You will integrate data from various systems into flexible and consistent representations. You will make sure that all people and IT systems in the organisation have an easy access to the data through various front-ends and interfaces

Skills & Requirements



  • You have at least a master's degree in computer science or a comparable qualification

  • You master at least these basic tools of computer science: object oriented programming in multiple languages, HTTP and current web technologies, the unix command line and basic server administration, version control systems, a basic understanding of the interplay between software and memory, hard discs and the CPU

item.title: Senior Java Developer for Berlin based company at reBuy reCommerce GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

As Java Developer in our Finance DevTeam, you will be facing extraordinary challenges and you will need to solve a lot of tough work tasks. Being a member of the Finance DevTeam you are responsible for everything related to the internal and external payment flow of reBuy. Recent projects have been the integration of a new payment provider, necessary enhancements for the French and Dutch markets and Amazon Gift Card API integration for special deals. So the job is demanding but never commonplace.


Let's have a look at your key responsibilities:

  • Object oriented and test driven development using Java

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Recommendation at eBay (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
eBay Kleinanzeigen is flexible and fast like a start-up yet we part of the global eBay Family. Our 70-people sized company includes all functions to run our business and do fast decision making. Members of our team value the entrepreneurial spirit, the “can-do” attitude and their mutual respect for each other’s talent and contribution.



We have one of the most-visited sites in Germany and are growing at an amazing speed. Currently, we have about 20 million active ads and more than 15 million monthly unique users – far more than half of them on mobile devices. All this traffic is powered by a set of Java 8/Spring applications and MySQL/Kafka/Cassandra/Elasticsearch servers that serve tens of thousands of requests every second. We use Kanban for development and have up to 10 releases a day, thanks to our fully automated continuous delivery pipeline.



Our 25 people-sized development team is small yet excellent. We build and maintain virtually all software components eBay Kleinanzeigen is made of - from backend to mobile apps. Right now we’re in the middle of a transformation towards a polyglot Apache Kafka based microservice architecture - which means that now is the time to get creative, introduce new technologies, and leave your mark!



To beef up our team we are hiring a Senior Software Engineer - Recommendation / Personalization (f/m).



Tasks and Responsibilities

Build scalable low-latency pipelines and components to handle large amounts of data

Generate high quality personalized content for our users

Be an interface between Product Management, Design, Business and Customers

Drive your own ideas for code and process improvement and achieve the next level together with the team

Be involved in the whole development lifecycle from planning through architecture to QA and deployment



Requirements

Bachelor degree in computer science or equivalent education

Passion for beautiful, test-driven code and an eye for simplicity and pragmatism

Excellent programming skills in Java, knowledge of one or more other programming languages

Experience with data-driven personalization and recommendation solutions

Track record of working in high-throughput stream processing or micro-batch environments like Spark, Kafka Streams, Flink, Storm



Beneficial

Strong know-how in object-oriented and/or functional design

Believer in teamwork and a DevOps mindset

Experience with RDBMS and/or NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB, MySQL)

Ideally knowledge of search engines (Elasticsearch, Solr) and Hadoop / MapReduce

Curiosity to learn new technologies



What do we offer?

An excellent working environment, flat hierarchies and challenging work with a diverse, highly skilled and humorous team

Competitive salary and great benefits e.g. conference & education budget, company pension scheme, employee stock plans, mobile phone for business and personal use, latest Mac Book Pro, Notebook, PC you name it, home office possibilities etc.

International career opportunities throughout eBay Inc.

A great campus with free fitness center, basketball and beachvolleyball courts, table soccer, bike rental, coffee-bar, canteen and shuttle-service

Free coffee, tea, drinks, snacks, fruit throughout the day

item.title: Senior Mobile Developer (f/m) for iOS at eBay (Berlin, Germany)

eBay Kleinanzeigen is the most-visited general classifieds proposition in Germany and growing at an amazing speed. Currently, about 17 million unique customers use our native apps, mobile website and website every month.

We are managed like a start-up yet we are anchored in the global portfolio of eBay. Customer centricity and passion for our products is what helps us to develop great apps. Our agile environment, weekly usability tests, prototyping and cross-functional teams make our product better each day.



To make our team even more powerful we are hiring a Senior Mobile Developer (f/m) for iOS.



As part of our mobile team you will be building and managing our app for iOS and power our amazing growth.



If you are a believer in customer centric thinking, agile and lean software development, feel responsible for your product, enjoy working in cross functional teams, want to craft quality and not quantity and most importantly want to make an impact then get in touch with us!



Tasks and Responsibilities

Help architect, build, iterate and manage our mobile application

Ensure that code is compliant with latest design standards and best-practices

Help to raise the overall skill and quality level through pairing, design/code reviews, and mentoring

Push forward our test-driven development process including unit, integration- and functional testing

Partner closely with product management to continuously improve our app

Research and prototype solutions to difficult problems



Requirements

Enthusiasm for iOS development, beautiful, pragmatic code and an eye for simplicity

Excellent understanding and strong experience with the iOS SDK (CoreData, UIKit)

Know how to use Instruments (Leaks, Object Allocations, etc)

Excellent programming skills in Objective-C

Programming skills in Swift

Strong know-how in object-oriented software design and design patterns

Experience with client/server architectures using HTTP, REST, XML, JSON and SQL

Effective oral and written English communication skills



Nice to Have

Experience in creating test driven mobile environments, e.g. experience in KIF, XCTest

Real life reference or open source projects (Github / Bitbucket / Stackoverflow Account)



Benefits & Perks

Attractive salary and great benefits (Employee Stock Plans, Company Pension Scheme, Commuting allowance, shuttle Bus to S-Bahn Wannsee)

Conference & Education Budget

Latest Mac Book Pro, Notebook, PC you name it

Mobile phone for business and personal use

Free Snacks & Drinks, subsidized Lunch in the cafeteria

Onsite Gym, Basketball & Volleyball Court, Table Soccer, Ping Pong

Most importantly: Greatest people and spirit on the planet

item.title: (Senior) Backend Developer (f/m) at eBay (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
eBay Kleinanzeigen is flexible and fast like a start-up yet we part of the global eBay Family. Our 70-people sized company includes all functions to run our business and do fast decision making. Members of our team value the entrepreneurial spirit, the “can-do” attitude and their mutual respect for each other’s talent and contribution.



We are one of the most-visited sites in Germany and growing at an amazing speed. Currently, we have about 20 million active ads and more than 15 million monthly unique users - more than half on mobile devices. All this traffic is powered by a set of Java 8/Spring applications and MySQL/Cassandra/Solr servers that serve tens of thousands request every second. We use Kanban for development and have up to 7 releases a day, thanks to our fully automated continuous delivery pipeline.



Our development team is small yet excellent. Just over 20 highly motivated people build and maintain virtually all software components eBayK is made of - from backend to mobile apps. The current strategical focus of our efforts is the transformation of our platform into a polyglot Apache Kafka based microservice architecture - which means that now is the time to get creative, introduce new technologies, and leave your mark!

Drive your own ideas for code and process improvement and achieve the next level together with the team

Strong know-how in object-oriented and/or functional design

Experience with Continuous Delivery, Jenkins-based build pipelines, Git and Maven

Experience with RDBMS and/or NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB, MySQL)

Ideally experience in the field of personalization.

Ideally knowledge of messagebroker systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ...)

Curiosity to learn new technologies (MySQL, Riak, MongoDB, Solr, ElasticSearch, Spring, Hadoop, Kafka, Cassandra, etc...)

Passion for beautiful, test-driven code and an eye for simplicity and pragmatism

Get up to speed with new systems and concepts easily

Believer in team work and a DevOps mindset



What do we offer?An excellent working environment, flat hierarchies and challenging work with a diverse, highly skilled and humorous team

Competitive salary and great benefits e.g. conference & education budget, company pension scheme, employee stock plans, mobile phone for business and personal use, latest Mac Book Pro, Notebook, PC you name it, home office possibilities etc.

International career opportunities throughout eBay Inc.

A great campus with free fitness center, basketball and beachvolleyball courts, table soccer, bike rental, coffee-bar, canteen and shuttle-service

Free coffee, tea, drinks, snacks, fruit throughout the day

item.title: Software Development Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
From a technology perspective, we have thousands of devices with our own firmware installed in our customers’ stores around the world and an advanced server infrastructure to manage these devices and process the terabytes of data that they are producing with Machine Learning algorithms. You will have a great opportunity for growing personally and professionally – while having lots of fun along the way.


Join our team as a Software Development Intern!


What we do all day


We build most of our applications using Ruby on Rails because we love it. We experiment and try out new things a lot so we are looking for developers who not only like to build new prototypes or minimum viable products and like to be creative, but also have great ideas and enjoy trying them out. We also built our main data processing architecture with Python because we love it. This architecture has been made to scale horizontally and with no single point of failure. We are processing multiple gigabytes of data per hour using different machine learning algorithms.


Any interest in data analysis or competence in data science would definitely be a plus.



How we work:



  • To be innovative and fast we organise our work using scrum and 1-week sprints.

  • To be as efficient as possible, we reduce the time spent in meetings to the minimum.

  • We love to test and we test all our code – we hope you like it too.

  • We like to do pair programming and code review sessions.



Where we work:



  • We have a new office next to Checkpoint Charlie. It is spacious and cozy.

  • There is everything you need to work in a great environment.

  • We have food, fruits, coffee, tea, soda and also a couch with a big TV and a Wii U for the occasional Mario Kart race.


Skills & Requirements


Required skills



  • Some coding experience (in any language)


Appreciated skills



  • Experience with Python

  • Experience with Ruby on Rails

  • Interest or experience with data science and analysis


Why there are just a few required skills


We believe that being a good developer is not so much a question of skills, but more a question of mindset. If you are passionate like us, you love to learn, work and share knowledge with your team, you will be a perfect fit. You will learn with us what is missing.

item.title: Data Science Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Do you love big data and analytics? Do you have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data? If yes, you will love working at MiNODES. At the core of our data analytics pipeline we apply advanced machine learning techniques to position people inside our customers' stores based on wifi signals. We are constantly improving these algorithms and are experimenting with new state-of-the art technologies (e.g. deep learning), to deliver the best data quality possible to our customers. 


With our Data Science team we work hard to help our clients to become industry leader for the future of retail. Therefore we offer an internship where you can apply current state-of-the-art machine learning models on a challenging dataset in an interesting industry.


Potential Task you will work on during your internship:



  • Identify potential weaknesses of our own MiNODES Wifi Positioning System and apply current state-of-the-art (e.g. Deep Learning) methods to overcome them.

  • Build new use cases around clients problems that we're able to solve by the use of big data and machine learning techniques

  • Improve our data quality monitoring infrastructure and help to improve our internal QA Processes


During your time at MiNODES you will be supported by our development and data science team.


Skills & Requirements


We're looking for preferably graduate students from statistics, computer science, business informatics, or related fields with:



  • Excellent statistical intuition and knowledge of various analytical approaches

  • Excellent communication skills

  • At least theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques (both supervised and unsupervised learning)

  • Ability to transfer theoretical concepts to practical implementations

  • Proficient in at least one programming language

  • Ability to write efficient SQL statements


Not a must, but we appreciate the following skills:



  • Proficient in Python

  • Experience with Scikit-learn, pandas, scipy, numpy and tensor flow

  • Knowledge of advanced machine learning techniques such as: deep learning, unsupervised outlier analysis, support vector machines, random forests, etc

item.title: Web Development Enthusiast at Mister Mobile GmbH // DEINHANDY. (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die Mister Mobile GmbH steht hinter deinhandy.de – der schnellst-wachsenden Plattform im Mobilfunkmarkt und betreut darüber hinaus noch weitere Plattformen im Telekommunikationsbereich.
In unserem Büro in Berlin-Mitte arbeiten wir täglich daran, die Sortimente und Angebote aller Anbieter transparent zu vergleichen und den Kunden das Leben etwas einfacher zu gestalten. Wir sind Hersteller- und Providerunabhängig und bieten unseren Kunden so unabhängige, persönliche Empfehlungen und eine One-Stop-Shop-Lösung von der Vertragskündigung, über sein neues Handy und / oder Tarif bis zur gratis Handy-Versicherung und weiteren Lösungen für Wearables, Apps und Smarthome Devices.


E-Commerce ist einfach, richtig? Falsch! Jeder der schon mal mit diesem Thema gearbeitet hat wird vermutlich zustimmen, dass das Geschäft von außen immer recht einfach aussieht, es aber erst hinter den Kulissen richtig spannend wird.


Bei DEINHANDY. verbringen wir unsere Zeit damit, genau diese spannenden Probleme zu lösen, ohne dabei den Blick auf das Frontend (also das, was der Kunde sieht) zu verlieren. Beides muss für uns in Einklang gut miteinander funktionieren.


Wir atmen Code, leben von modernsten Technologien und für den Spaß an der Arbeit mit selbigen und miteinander.


Weil wir uns noch viel vorgenommen haben um den Handy- und IOT-Markt weiter zu erobern, suchen wir hierfür Verstärkung in Form von enthusiastischen Web-Entwicklern.
